name: Good Karma
description: Great hotel/hostel/guest house. Many rooms available, Very helpful host and staff. Inexpensive rooms , hot water, a/c internet, common room

name: Kisama Heritage Village
description:
plenty of place in from of the museum of this Heritage Village.
Strongly recommended to assist during the Hornbill Festival at the beginning of December.

name: Baijanth Carpark
description: Central but rarely-used Carpark, hidden, right next to the River on the edge of the town. You can walk to the Shiva Temple from here by using stairs.

name: Gangotri to rishikesh
description: Drive through villages, to dead end Road next to resovoir. Might cause attention in the village, will Visite you but are Nice. Bottom of a Hill and Rice Paddy.

name: Mrs. Bandhari's Guest House
description: Mrs. Bandhari's Guest House is listed in every guide book. Idyllic gardens, pool, spotless, WC/showers, quiet, safe, good and expensive restaurant, fresh meat, 450rp/night. In cantonment, about 3km NW of city centre.

name: Parking outside Outram Hotel
description: I was at the Outram Hotel, but in the side streets around it you can stay in your vehicle, too. Rats, homeless, security guards around. Parking fees are negotiable. Noisy ACs at night, many students during daytime. Access: financial district, between Churchgate and Victoria Terminus, near the Dutch consulate, one block east of Bombay Gymkhana Grounds (sports grounds and Park).

name: Parking lot
description: Parking lot beside the panoramic road, about one kilometre before Arthur's Seat view point, cool climate thanks to high altitude, great views.

name: Peninsula Beach
description:
*Overnight camping/parking is NOT available at this location.
.....
Right behind the beach on a barren peninsula, a few fishermens’ huts nearby. Quiet, no shade, fine sandy beach. The last metres to the beach are a dead end. No turning point.

name: Surya Hotel
description: Parking of Surya Hotel (in cantonment, NW of city centre), about EUR 3/night, pool charged extra. Entrance gate might be narrow for trucks.

name: Mansarover House, chandraloke, kalimpong 734301, Telefon.  0091 7679622730
description: Family Homestay with 3 rooms, beautiful garden with own vegetables and loads of flowers. Perfect meals are around 90 rp,  fried eggs etc. just 20rp - cheapest place in town, 2000rp negotiable to 1500. Carpark available, quite area! Monastery nearby

name: Rumtek monastery (old building! )
description: car park in front of monastery. ask the monks for staying overnight. good chance of using toilet with running water - if monks deny, in front of the main gate are parking slots, upstairs toilets available

name: Heliport Ravangla/Rabongla
description: big heliport, entry through a tibetian  gate, people sometimes use this place for campfires and beer sessions - if not, very quite and pleasant

name: Roadside Ravangla - Namchi
description: Parking slot on green lawn, Mountain views

name: Deolo Hill in Kalimpong - Sikkim
description: Follow Deolo Cliff Eco Lodge sign, turnoff mainroad further uphill 500m, green spots on the left

name: Izheto Village
description: Drive through big concrete gate until you arrive in the middle of the square or the soccer ground of the Christian  village. Ask Huska Sema for permission to stay, he is the head of the village and will be happy to welcome you! Very warm and friendly people. Almost everybody speaks English.

name: NFA Marvel Logistics
description: Shipping agent. 4th floor of SICCI building.

name: Crossword Book Store
description: English lanuage book, magazine and stationery store. Stocks Lonely Planet and other travel guides.

name: Red Lollipop Hostel
description:
Nice hotel in none tourist area of the city. Near bus and train stations.
Freindly helpful staff. No off street parking. Fast internet.

name: Hotel d' Europe
description:
Basic rooms with hard beds and fan. 
A/C optional. Breakfast included and free bottle of water. Single rate with a/c 1400R Off street parking. ATM and shops neither by.

name: Airavatesvara Temple
description: Great temple with no crowds.

name: Brihadishwara Temple
description:
Sign posted as the Big Temple. Impressive structure enclosed in fortified walls. 
There is a large free park car opposite. Can take trucks and coaches and anything else.

name: Hotel Valli
description: Off street parking with guard on flat concrete. Single bed room with fan and bathroom. 550R pn.

name: Parking for Rock for temple.
description: This actual position is a dirt carpark which is a short walk from the Rock cut Temple. Access from Sinarathorp road. Not suitable for big rigs.

name: Parking for Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple
description: There is street side parking for big rigs. The temple is a short walk through the west outer to gates and round to the North gate entrance.

name: Parking for Sri Meenakshi Temple
description: Dirt car park. 60rp charge. Attendant will give you a ticket to put in your window.

name: Roof top view of temple
description: If you are brave enough to run the gauntlet of 3 floors of tourist trinkets then you can view the temple complex from the roof here. Building is called The Museum Company

name: Vedanta Wake Up (formally Viswa Residency)
description:
Clean and tidy rooms with ensuit bathroom. Common area with TV and roof top terrace view 360 views.
Secure off street dirt parking.
wifi in lobby only.
500rp for shared room with fan.

name: Day parking at Varkala beach
description:
50rp for a car all day parking. 
Opposite  to beer wine shop.

name: The Palm Ayurvedic Beach Resort
description:
Simple tidy rooms with ensuit bathroom. 650rp p/n for room with fan.
Access via dirt track leaving helicopter pad. Parking in court yard for 2 cars.

name: Maritime Hostel
description: Good hostel with A/C dorms at 500rp per night. Free breakfast and easy walk to most sites in Fort Kochi. Helpful freindly staff. Only down side for overlanders is limited street parking..

name: The Mansion 1907
description: Nice hostel in old building with parking. Not far from all the major sites.

name: Parking at Mysore Palace
description: Paid parking for visiting Mysore Place. Can take big rigs like trucks and coaches.

name: Malpe Beach Parking
description: Parking strip for tourist buses next to beach and opposite Paradise Beach Resort. 50rp charge to park over night. Only ok if you sleep in your vehicle. Pay toilets near by. Plus street food near by at night.

name: The Goan Corner
description: Fantastic place with great friendly staff. Good location to ruins/temples and climbing. You can sleep on the roof top with mozzie net for 200rp or rent huts 700ish. The access path is a rough narrow track between paddy fields. So only motor bikes or cars with good ground clearance can get there.

name: Zostel Goa
description: Nice hostel in old Portuguese house set in leafy grounds. Parking for two cars and 6 motorbikes. AC dorm 600rp a night. Free wifi and drinking water. Access is via narrow lane.

name: Wild Camp north of Ganpatipule
description: Grassy area with level patches of ground. Access is via salt pan and does have muddy patches. 4x4 only. Lots of mozzies.

name: New Rajesh Hotel
description: 2km down the road from the caves there are 4 hotels on the either side of the street. Room with fan 600rp, room with a/c 1200rp per night. Only 2g edge vodaphone mobile coverage.

name: Hotel Rituvan
description: Hotel with secure parking at rear. Locked gate at night. Deluxe double room (there cheapest room) is 1500rp a night. A/C, fan and warm water shower. Wifi on landing area.

name: Supermarket and beer shop
description: Supermarket on corner with wine/beer shop opposite on other side of street. Fruit and veg also available from street stalls.

name: Honeydew Retreat
description: Great hotel with very friendly staff with good english. Limited off street parking on ramp. Can fix 2 4x4 cars. Real grass, pool and good wifi. Quiet area. Room 1100rp a night.

name: Doodle Hostel
description:
Great place and friendly/helpful staff. Driveway parking for two cars. a/c Dorm 350 a night.

Driveway camping 100 pppn

name: Zostel Agra
description: Only 1.5km from the Taj Mahal and with  parking for two cars. This is a friendly hostel in convenient location. Dorm bed  350rp a night with fan.

name: Corbett Motel
description:
User reports"bed not very clean. after few hour my legs itch"
Good motel close to Corbett Tiger Reserve. Tents with bathroom but no fan. 800rp, room with fan and hot water 1000rp. On-site restaurant with good food. They also run jeep tours into the park.

name: Hilltop Camp
description: Safe and Secure place to base yourself before entering Myanmar. No facilities

name: Baran Kalan
description: Wild camp just 50m off the road on outside of corner amoungst large rocks. High ground clear need to access site. Tight turn around so a 4x4 is as big as you can get in here. Flat terraces to pitch tents also. Traffic stops between 22:00 and 06:00. Good Vodafone 3G coverage.

name: Lawrence Road. Airtel Shop
description: Vodafone store / Airtel Shop, State bank of India plus many more. The main shopping street in Amritsar.

name: Charming Chicken
description: Great range of Chicken dishes plus some veg dishes too.

name: Last Indian Oil Gas Station
description: 48.7rp/lt for diesel.

name: Next to Ullal Beach
description: For free. Sandy area. 4WD recommended. Little bit of garbage but ok.

name: Munnar Parking Area
description: Safe parking area. Security 24/7. 100 Rupees a night. 15 minutes walking distance to town. Tuk Tuk driver Raja is a very good help in Munnar. He knows a lot of places and has good information. His tel: 00919447830731

name: Gas Refill
description: 110 Rupee/kg

name: Post Office
description: Parking spot in front of the post office. Right next to the palace.

name: A Plateau 200 Meter Next To The Highway
description: Very quiet, no garbage. 4 WD needed!

name: Behind Liebherr Company
description: Many options to park. 4WD required. Nice and quiet!!

name: Golf Court Parking Area
description: For free. Have to ask security. Next to a park with running track.

name: The Hill Top Hotel
description: Parking spot behind the hotel. Very quiet. 200 INR per night.

name: VVIP Guesthouse
description: Parking lot right in front of the guesthouse. Unfortunately also next to a street but quiet at night. Very clean. Very safe. A lot of security.

name: Finest Hours Restaurant
description: Highly recommended parking area. Staff is extremely nice and take care of you.

name: Swiss Hotel Kashmir
description:
SWISS HOTEL  KASHMIR .  A home of overland tourists.  
We are situated at one of Srinagar's most sophisticated, quite suburbs only two  kms from the Tourist Reception Center and a one minute walk from the world renounced Dal Lake. Our lush front garden with its chirping birds, green lawn and pretty flowers is the perfect place for quiet relaxation after a busy tourist day.﻿ Enjoy all the amenities and ambience of the best of modern hotels and the constant attention of our trained, friendly and dedicated staff.

Im Hotel Swiss wurden wir nach langer staubiger Fahrt wie Freunde empfangen. A home far away from home....das ist die beste Beschreibung. Manager Rouf und sein Personal kümmern sich persönlich um jeden Gast. WiFi, Garten, ein guter Tee....sogar unser Hund war willkommen. Das Swisshotel können wir allen Overlandern uneingeschränkt empfehlen. 
Swiss Hotel Kashmir is an eco friendly and commission free hotel.

name: Outside Nurpur in riverbank
description: Depends on river level, possibility also at River View Hotel, no facilities, friendly neighbors, 3G internet available, trucks possible

name: Chamera Reservoir
description: nice view over the lake above the dam. Only security personnel appeared and wish nice stay. No facilities. Springs could be found at street down from main road. Late night discussion with security staff because of safety and sensitive area, after calling to officer everything fine.

name: Riverbank next to Doda
description: Near Police Post Karaha, east from village Doda at NH244,small track down to the riverbank, no visitors, no facilities we asked before at police checkpoint for overnight stay. Nature toilet. 50 m behind police station small general store and small river with clear water

name: Patnitop Forest Park
description: 60 Rs. Entry Fee for VW camper. Big forest pick nick area with lots of hotels. Small road from entrance gate. Avoid weekend time because of party people.

name: SH26 Kilar Tandi Road - Between Trees
description: go down south side from Main Street to the river bank. Small unpacked road. Great area with lots of trees and close to the river bank. No disturbing by anybody. Nice sunset and sunrise. Beautiful place. 2.800 m attitude

name: NH 3 Manali-Leh Highway
description: Riverbank, clear water,4900m, silent place

name: Solang Valley
description: a wasting campground with wasting facilities. It's used as parking place. Nice view into the mountains. Water tap you can find on small temple down the street. There are good possibilities to put up a tent. Some small restaurants and general stores nearby. No disturbance. No charging for parking.

name: Swiss Hotel
description: Free parking in front of the hotel. Staff is awesome. Helps you to get camping gas. We stayed here for almost one week. Bicycle friendly.

name: Ibex
description: Beautiful place. Parking is for free. Shower and toilets also for free. Meals are very good. Bonfire every evening. Overlanders are very welcome.

name: Imphal
description: The boys from Wilderness Adventure Manipure belong to one of the best hosts we have ever met! You can find and contact them on Facebook. They will be happy to support all kind of overlanders! Highly recommended!!

name: silent place near street
description: follow track from the street. Grassy area between trees or on the field. No disturbing, silent, peaceful, no garbage.

name: Katni Bypass Road
description: Follow Track from coordinates to the water-filled Channel. Silent peaceful place. No disturbance

name: NH 44 close to a lake
description: Follow track NE from highway to field 300meters. Many options. No disturbance

name: Beach of Chirala
description: Take track from coordinates to the beach. Reduce pressure in your tires and have fun. Fishermen close by to buy fresh fish.

name: Leh, beside a Stupa
description: Wild Camping, near the town center, no facilities (except in the morning 1,5 hour water)

name: Virgin Valley Parking Area
description: Narrow Street to this parking area.friendly owner behind the parking area.  No disturbance. Jungle feeling. Sometimes elephants appear on the other side of the river.

name: Karalad Chira Lake
description: beautiful place above lake. No disturbance. Follow street to backside of lake and drive down to  grassy area.

name: Canacona Market
description:
At Chaudi (near Palolem)

Fresh Fish, fruits, vegetables and chicken all day

name: barbecue Coal Supplier
description: Very friendly and  helpful men. Located behind Sumaya Goan cuisine restaurant. He supplies barbecue coal in this area. 8kg for 240 Rs phone: 7774-909600

name: Pushkar Resorts
description: Very nice cottages, Swimming Pool, Billard, Volley Ball... Spa & Wellness area. Restaurant

name: Bundi Haveli
description: Very nice Hotel in traditional look. Best service und fine kitchen Roof Top  Restaurant

name: The Sher Garh
description: Very nice Hotel. you sleep very comfortable in large bungalows. Sometimes warm shower!!! Opened in 2015. Very nice staff. Full board only.  Big swimming pool. Not far too Rathanbhore National Parc entrance. A must see!

name: above Ozran Beach
description: Grassy Area above the sea with beautiful sunset viewpoint. 4x4 recommend to get at highest point. Avoid weekends because of disco nearby.

name: Silver Sand Beach Shack & Coco Huts
description: Used parking place in front of beach huts. Friendly and warm welcome by the owner 2 weeks before season starts. Offers us water for use. Grassy area around with coconut trees. Beach is reachable within 50meters.

name: Poladpur NH66
description: Near street, small river, looks like a temple/holy place

name: Parking GYMKHANA
description: Possibility to stay in your motorhome next to beach and a police station. Very noisy due to Main Street. Nice view around. No facilities.

name: Under Tree At Vandri Lake
description: 50 m after checkpoint turn left

name: Nagol Beach
description: Lonely but dirty, take small paved road from given coordinates to direction West, many options on the beach. Keep attention on low hanging power lines. Roughly max. 2,80m height possible

name: Elina bed & breakfast
description: modern rooms in a green area. not much trafic. A/C TV Hot Shower

name: Modi Ressort at Umbhrat Beach
description: Big parking area, Police bring us Midnight after attack by locals and a kind of special forces to this resort place.  Before we stayed some kilometer south at a nice spot. But not recommend. Nice and friendly staff at resort. Rooms available with AC from 1650Rs. At daytime a Amusement park is at this area and lots of people using it. Loud music. They charged nothing for parking. Toilets available. Police point at the opposite. Beach nearby and nice but Indian-like very dirty. Black sand, brown water. Lots of rubbish

name: Riverbank Mount Abu
description: Follow narrow track from given coordinates down to the riverbank; 4x4 necessary; space only for one small car; lots of friendly village peoples

name: Devine Ganga Cottage
description: Nice small Hotel hillside with view to Ganges. Basic restaurant on roof top. Very basic rooms with hot shower. A/C and Internet did not work while we were there (6 days! ). Very nice and friendly staff. 8 minutes to go to the bridge with premium sight to the Ghats and main temples.

name: Luni Riverbank
description: Depends on water level; water is salty; quiet; many options for parking

name: Brar Veg Dhaba
description: 24 hour open; good and tasty veg food; big portions; reasonable prices; big parking area with possibility to stay over night

name: Hotel Jahabee Regency
description: 850 rupee for sure simple double room. Warm water shower. Very secure parking. Good restaurant. The staff were very, very friendly and helpful and made us very welcome. No internet. Worked out as a good stopping overnight spot. Clean though could use a coat of paint.

name: Hotel Dekyi Pelbar
description: 2,000 rupee for a double room. The outside of the building looks tired but the inside has been restored. Really nice room with king size bed and lots of blankets. Restaurant has good food. Secure parking in a garage with gate under the hotel.

name: Kaziranga Guest House
description: 1,500 rupees (after negotiations from 2,000) per night for the larger double room with attached bathroom. Hot water. No internet. Secure parking. Clean.

name: Numaligarh Dhaba
description: This restaurant has three really nice rooms. We paid 1,000 rupee for the simple double after bargaining. We were broke down and the didn't mind Mike working on the bike. Good and cheap Thalia plates too. Very clean.

name: Hotel Tragopan
description: Simple double room was 1428 with taxes. Needed to press for a non delux room. Very clean. Lukewarm shower. Good restaurant

name: Shree Birla Tempel and Religious Guest House Kushingar
description:
You have a lot of space for parking and camping with car. A 3 bed room cost 975 Rupees (nice bathroom). Slipping in car is possible. The public toilet are dirty. 

The R&J

name: Honey Bee
description: Located in a calm valley up a steep road it's a very chilled out place (there's a sign on the left of the road). Basic accommodation (bed, shared toilet, shower out of a bucket) is 550 for one person, 600 for 2. Lunch and dinner buffet is 180 + tax and ok, but not a highlight. Homemade alcohol is awesome. The real highlight here is the calm nature and the climb to Tadiandamol. Ideal to escape into the calmness and quietness of the Indian countryside. Motorcyclists can park the bike right infront of the room.

name: Parking back yard of hotel
description: You can stay in the back yard for 300 Rupies the night. Nothing special but good when you come late from the border and dont want to drive at night.

name: Pyrenees Resthouse
description:
Private room 2 people = 550 a night
Car parked safe within compound.

name: Hotel Barahsinga
description: Small hotel with large pleasant garden area for parking. Rooms are basic but adequate.  Owner very friendly and helpful.  Close to entrance to Kahna NP.  Rooms 2,000 rupees but we negotiated to 1,500.

name: Cola Beach
description: Turn of the road at this coordinates  15° 03.608' N, 73° 58.905' E

name: Pench NP
description: Camping on some communal land between the village and the entry gate. Villagers curious but friendly.  No facilities.  Free.

name: Wild camping: peaceful. Next to a big red rock!
description: Maybe a bit hard to find.. but real safe and quiet. Next to a big red rock. Last left of big road before toll and then first left on dirt road (after 1000m +-)

name: Ajanta Car Park
description: We were allowed to stay on the car park for the night before going to visit the caves on the morning.  As we arrived late we didn't pay anything but parking was 50rupees.

name: Riverside
description:
Parking spot Next to Lake road.Clean lake in nature. Nice for swimming not much Noise and people still close to Udaipur. 

Greats R&J to India

name: Ellora Heritage Resort
description: We camped on the quiet carpark at this hotel.  Owner very friendly.  Rooms are 1800 to 3000 rupees. We paid 200 rupees to camp and park.  Walking distance to the caves. Facilities below are for parking.  They will be different if you take a room.

name: Hotel Rupmati
description: Large parking area at hotel overlooking the escarpment.  We paid 500 rupees to park for the night.  Toilet next to restaurant.

name: Parking inside Yoga Hotel
description: Perfect location right next to Ganges river and the ghats. If you take the cheapest room (500 rupees) you can stay in your car and can use all the hotel facilities. Very friendly stuff.

name: Dry season only
description:
Camping in the middle of the salt lake. next to a track in northwestern direction. There is literally nothing in several kms radius. Did not see a single human being out vehicle while here.
It was pleasant in January, but may be unbearably hot in summer or off limits after rain.
The track could be in another position when you get here. Rather search for tracks than this exact position. You're in the middle of a salt lake, so know what you're doing and 4wd highly recommended. We entered the lake at Zinzuwanda.
Weak airtel 3g.

name: Camping next to main road under big tree
description: Wild camping 200m to the main road. A village is close by. Enjoy the peace with the last sun rays of the day under one of the big trees of the area. Level. No facilities.

name: International Youth Hostel
description:
Big parking Space infront of the hostel. Quite silent area. Hostel is in bad condition. But cheap dorms for 150 rupees. Mostly Indian travel groups. 
Nice stuff.
Greats R&J to India

name: Woodlands Adventure Club
description:
You can park here between the bungalow quite place. You can use the facility of the "club" and the climbing Wall :). You can order food in your car 

Friendly guy how mange every thing

name: Wild camping right next to Mahanadi river
description: Nice spot right next to the river. You can see the sunset from here. Water seems quiet clean. Some women do there washings here. 150m from road.

name: Bushcamp next to small lake
description:
Nice silent campsite near a small lake. A few villagers came by but were very polite. One brought us fresh milk. :)
Unpaved road goes right from main road.
Airtel Edge coverage.

name: Kunja Camp
description: Camped in front of this nice hotel.  Asked hotel owner for permission and he said ok.  Didn't use any of the facilities.  Close to where the Siberian cranes come in large numbers in the winter.  No facilities. Free.

name: Nice camping spot at beach
description: About 20km from the highway. Nice spot right next to the beach which is somehow clean and has fresh water. Village is close by and people are curious, friendly and very nice. A lot of fishermen around. You can get fresh fish if you want ;-)

name: Plattform with level at the beach
description: There is a little plattform in the hotel area of the beach region. Nobody comes around and you can park your car while having perfect level. You're just in front of the beach. Unfortunately like everywhere in this region you'll see a lot of trash around :/

name: Hotel Shivam Parking
description: The hotel Shivam has a large parking lot opposite it.  It's 50 rupees to park for the day and 100 for the night so 150 for 24 hours.  Can use the toilets in the cafe underneath he hotel. Not the quietest place but easy access to all the sights.

name: Close to Rewa
description: Close to NH135. Same threes and grass. Watch out for the very low hanging power line.

name: Gulistan Tourist Complex
description: Large parking area in the tourist complex where there is a hotel.  Lots of space and relatively quiet and close to Fathepur Sikri.  It was a little confusing when we stayed as there was never anyone at reception.  When we found someone he wasn't sure if we could just park for the night as he said he would need to register us. If he registered us he thought we may need to pay for a room (1,100 rupees) but would check. We never saw him again or anyone else at reception so ended up camping in the parking lot for free. Clean toilet in reception.

name: Wildcamping on beach
description:
Beautiful and Lonely! Drive through beautiful small villages as little houses.

Relatively clean and easy and nice to stay!

name: Eagles nest (named by: Heiner)
description:
Wild camping on the beach. Not too busy. Clean beach and very spacious! Perfect place to camp. If you are lucky, locals build a bonfire for you and so far they haven't charged us. 

Also check out the fort at Murud. But probably you would go there any way, cuz while else would you be here?

name: Easy wildcamping on beach
description:
Clean, quiet, nice and beautiful

Edit: 4x4 recommended, parking in loose sand

name: Camping in Youth Center in Auroville
description: You can use the big space of the Youth Center for staying some days in Auroville.  There is a big kitchen and a bathroom with even a laundry. Wifi available. Many nice people around. Ask for Babu, he gives you the permition to stay for what he ask 100 rupees the night which is more than fair when you see all the facilities. Saturday is a pizza night and in the morning a weekly market on the ground. Free water for drinking. Big workshop with many tools.

name: Darjeeling Tiger hill
description: 1km from Tiger hill.

name: Nivati Beach camp
description:
Beautiful, lonely beach, little rubbish. Almost no tourists, just friendly villagers. From the road, enter the beach at the ship building yard at the T-junction and drive all the way to the south. 4wd required.
Fresh coconuts available directly from the farm. Fresh fish is sold every morning in the harbor on the north end. Watch out when walking along the beach in the morning. The villagers use it as a loo. Nevertheless a great place far away from all the tourists. Weak 3g she'll Airtel signal if you walk to the southern edge of water.

name: Ganesh Tok
description: Good spot for overnight parking, 40 rupees. Compleately empty during the night. Early morning tourists arrive. Toilet and water. Alu chura is served for 20 rupees in the morning also a cafeteria here.

name: Hotel Tamil Nadu
description:
ADMIN NOTE: on August 17, 2018 a user reported: We asked for the same, room with parking. they told us it is not possible to stay in the caravan in front of the guesthouse. the cheapest room would be 1400 R. 

If you take the cheapest room (500R$) they let you camp here. Breakfast included. Great views to the sea.

name: Parking next to beach under palm tree
description: Only 10min walk by the tourist busy north cliff this quiet parking in the shadow of the palm trees must be nice for everyone. Nice spot for sunset too.

name: Boarder Parking
description: This Place is for the Tourists just coming for the closing ceremony so the place is empty at 9pm. It has basic toilets and restaurants on the street. The parking costed less than 1US$ if you want to see the ceremony and don't want to move after its a good place. Internet at restaurants.

name: Melli checkpoint
description:
We got park and borrow shower and toilet free.Was a lot of traffic during the night and the morning.
Several restaurants on the other side of the bridge. (about 200 meters)

name: Camping at Happy Life Retreat
description: Very idyllic place in the mountains and tea plantations. Many acitivities like hiking or waterfall around. Kitchen use possible.

name: Western Motorsports
description: park your vehicle and camp.

name: Hotel Ghoomar Camping
description: A relatively quiet spot in the back yard of the hotel. For 250INR we could stay over night and use the toilets. They even allowed us to use the shower but pointed out that this is a favor and not included in the price.

name: Workshop
description: They said it is one of the best mechanics around. Could organize spare parts from Mumbai.

name: Parking in shade in Anjuna
description: Small parking in the shadow, only 50m from the beach. No charge. Stayed three nights and nobody care. Chai wallah on the other side. Quiet noisy after 9am till 10pm

name: Parking at Ajanta view point
description: Very nice leveled parking at the view point to Ajanta. Free of charge. Very friendly people around. Save with night guard. Filtered water to fill up your tanks. Wash rooms free to use. The best: Veeeeery quiet at night. One of the most quiet places in India hahaha

name: Elements hostel
description:
Perfect please to stay at in Chennai if looking for hostel and parking car. Safe outside, also 24 hour security. 

People are amazing friendly and will help you with all that's needed!

name: Davids Campspot / wild camping
description:
We are curious why the hack you have to stop here, but it is a Perfect place to stay for the night if you are driving by and don't know what else to do.

We haven't seen one Indian person coming by. 

Nice!

name: Sleeping in sand dunes in desert
description: About 3 kilomter from a village you find this sand dunes with nice spot for camping. Many antilope, fox and lizards around. Just follow the dirt roads. You can here the temple sound of the village so its not completely off nature but in general very quiet.

name: Sunset wild camping point
description:
Beautiful place to camp - be sure you don't miss out on the sunset. 

Relatively quiet. Only a couple of people came by and they didn't bother us at all. 

We pitched up our roof tent when it was dark, to get less attention. But otherwise I still think the people won't talk too much.  

Water in town centre; in front of mosque/tomb! You can fill up there! 

On the other side of the hill music is playing on Saturday evenings - about the other days of the week we don't know - but it wasn't too bad or too loud.

Enjoy!

name: Glass graveyard wild camp spot
description:
Beautiful place to camp - in the middle of the fort. You are pretty visible, but funny enough no one bothered us. And we stayed here for about 16 hours.

A lot of glass around, but not a big problem

name: Wild camp next to highway
description: Easy wild camping. We didn't get bothered at all. Might be someone's private field but only in the morning around 10 people started coming around. We were leaving by then but they seemed curious, not angry.

name: Falcon Crest
description: Friendly place, good food, secure parking by the banquet hall. We had dinner and breakfast and could stay in the car for free. Ask in the reception for wi-fi code.

name: NRI
description: Guarded parking. Had dinner and breakfast, slept in the car for free. Exelent food, air con restaurant, very clean place, western toilets also relatively clean. Super friendly staff. Rooms from 1000 rupees.

name: Free camping spot in side valley
description: Use the ground of "The paying guesthouse" Far away from busy streets. plenty of space. Owner didnt charge us anything. Waterfall with drinkable water within 20min walk. You can use the facilities of the guesthouse. Dont follow google maps and take one road after the mountain road google recommends.

name: Zostel Hostel
description: Hostel that you can camp with your vehicle in Ooty or stay in private rooms/Dorms. Rooms 1800rps/ Dorm 450rps. Trekking/sightseeing. Food delivery from local restaurants. Common room to hang out. Bring your own beer. Camping with vehicle 500-600rps for 2 people.

name: Jyoti Lodge
description: Secure parking in town available. Nice rooms ranging from 1000-1600rupees private bathroom and fan (ac available). Really nicely run with an amiable owner.

name: Wheelostay Overlanders Homestay
description:
Homestay for Foreign RTW Overlanders / Moto Travellers / Cyclists / Homestay/ Motostay/ Boondocking/ Warmshowers/ Motorhome parking / Big rig parking friendly / International package delivery collection at Jammu.
To stay with us : Whatts app on +919419140718 or message on  www.facebook.com/wheelostay

name: Phyang near to Phyang Monastry
description:
15 km north of Leh , in the courtyard of the "After School Project " (school for poor children from all over Ladakh)
Overlanders are welcome!
Free of charge, donations and/or pratical skills are mostly welcome.
Perfect Place for park and trek !
View to the Monastry and Stok Kangeri 
Facilities: toilet, shower, water

Attention: Koordinate are not taken correctly by the system 
34 degree 10' 59.45" N
77 degree 28' 53.1"    E

name: Hotel Siachen
description: Safe parking, internet, clean rooms and close to restaurants and shops.

name: Zanskar Valley
description: Great lush gras spot between big boulders. River not too far away and a bit off the road. Very quiet place.

name: Hunder Eco Villa
description: Nice new Hotel, just opened one month ago. It's closed through the winter.

name: Innerline Permit Office
description: You need two pictures, copy of passport and visa.

name: Kuber Guest House
description: Basic Hotel, wifi yes but no internet ; ) with airtel between E and 3G

name: Zostel Hostel
description: Nice basic Hostel, and Tents to rent, bikes can be parked on the ground inside the smal fence, i guess they serve food in high season, not all year round open, closed for winter

name: Mountain View Hotel
description: Clean Hotel with nice view, basic und luxury Rooms available

name: Goba Guesthouse
description: Great spot for overlanders. Parking for big rigs, cars, motorbikes. Clean showers and rooms. Open all year and good prices.

name: Pangong Campspot
description: Great flat spot to pitch the tent or park the car. Protected from wind and street view. Very quiet at night. Lake water is salty so bring enough water.

name: Tso Moriri Lake Camp
description: There are some quiet spots after the village without fence and sandy patches to pitch the tent. Lake water is fresh and good to drink after cooking.

name: Dragon Inn
description: Cheap, clean and good hotel in old Manali. Hot showers and internet. Safe parking for cars and motorbikes.

name: Camp before pass
description: Nice flat grassy camp spot with running water from a small stream. Quet at night.

name: Hotel Ganesha
description: Clean simple hotel, very central with safe parking up to two motorbikes. Car is not possible but bycicles or motorbikes. 800 rupees per double without AC.

name: Hotel Shani Palace
description: If you need a hotel (because the road is horrible up there) then you can go to this indian "beauty". It not nice, not really clean BUT beds are fine, there is a beer store in the same building and safe parking!!!

name: Parking Place next to the lake
description: Free Parking Place next to the lake. Beautiful view. Close to every sights. Have public Toilets. Enough Space for all kind of Camper Cars.

name: Car park behind bar and restaurant
description: Car park behind bar and restaurant. Pretty primitive, but toilet facilities available and no fee for sleeping overnight if you eat/drink in the bar. Beer reasonably priced.

name: Wild camping by Talpona beach
description: Wild camping space for a couple of vehicles in shady spot on Talpona Beach. Further along beach are a few simple stalls selling great seafood for low price and a couple of bars with wifi available. If approaching from North, drive past all stalls/hotels and just as road swerves away from beach, turn left down dirt/sand track. We parked under trees basically on the beach for two night, no problem. Locals said it was fine.

name: Oakwood School Parking
description: If you like to visit a school in the village you should come to this place. Mrs Chowfin senior who has built the school all by herself is living next to the school building. We were invited for tea and the kids presented their sports activities. We could park our vehicle over night at the parking lot. Travellers a welcome to visit the school.

name: Hotel Queen
description: Brand new hotel, 1000 rupees for a double room, very nice staff and good restaurant. Good for a rest along the highway. Safe parking for car, truck, motorbike.

name: Depghar Guest House
description: Small farm along the road. Simple rooms, cold shower, clean toiletts. Good to stop for the night.

name: Friendly Truck Stop & Restaurant
description: Truck stop with a big parking ground in the back of a restaurant. Very friendly restaurant owner and delicious food. When you're hungry check out the "daal deluxe" for 150 Rs. Meals for 50 Rs. are available, too. You can also pay with Nepali Rupees. No parking fee. Peaceful place over night.

name: Friend's House
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Owners contact information below. Location is hard to find. 

Beautiful and calm Guesthouse with a big parking lot. Our vehicle fit exactly through the entrance gate. Double room and sleeping dorm available. All Indian motorcyclist love to meet here. Overlanders are welcome. 
Not that easy to find...just write a e-mail and they will help you...raviudr@gmail.com or +919829083630 his name is Ravi...lovely guy...

name: Sai Colorium
description:
We had the rust in the wheel arches of our 25 yr old Landcruiser sorted here and were really impressed with the work done. Very reasonable and excellent customer service. The colour match in their paint work was also excellent.
mailto:saicolorium@yahoo.com

name: Hampe Area
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because camping is illegal here.  Protected Area

name: Motorcycle temple
description: Temple worshipping motorcycles. No entrance fee. Very small place. Just a 5min attraction.

name: Zubinn Design
description: Great spot if you need some work done (painting or mechanical) on big motorbikes. He also has facebook and instagram. Nice spot and great work!

name: Karfule Pump / Cleaning / Parking
description: Perfect spot to park the car/motorbike. You can clean everything for shipping as well. Daniel is a great guy and can help you with everything. You can sleep in your car/truck. Email: dan.sequeira@gmail.com

name: Boondocking on grass
description: When you make miles in India, you can overnight here. Even surface, railway not too close. Big Lake in walking distance.

name: SECO shipping services
description: Mustafa is very helpful. I shipped my bike from Mumbai to Antwerp. And paid about 700euros at departure. This is including crating and custom paper work

name: Gas station next to mc donalds
description:
Gas station with a lot of space. clean toilets. If you need water ask for the water station behind the house. 
stuff really friendly, before you stop ask for stay. 
mc donalds next to it. 
Good sleeping place on the way to goa.

name: ranibenur (HunamanaMatte)
description: safe truck stop with very friendly staff. open 24/7 with basic toilet and shower facil 4sc gavrxxxvaities. they also rent rooms ( with Ac). serving the best veggie only food ever.

name: Maldevta Winter Riverbed
description: This is a riverbed that runs slim in the winters and one can bring rigs and camp on the rocky riverbed with a thin river flowing  along side. Not safe in the summer as the river is a raging bull from melting ice from the himalayan mountains.

name: Devi Desert Resort and Retreat
description: A spacious oasis in the Desert of Jaiselmer Rajasthan, india. With huge parking grounds to park and camp with big rigs. Has a restaurant and mind blowing sunset views.

name: Indian Petrol
description: Could bushcamp here on premises of fuel station.

name: Zostel
description: Nice Hostel, dorms and private rooms (600-800/2000). laundry 60. one small parking lot. smaller rigs can fit, otherwise on street parking in front of hostel (if you're lucky). sleeping in car is free. nice rooftop terrace. kitchen available.

name: Toyota Moter Care in Delhi
description:
Nice small place for Toyota repairs. We had shock relievers changed, oil changed and other small damaged parts that he found when inspecting the car. An honest guy. We wanted to have the timing belt changed but he didn’t think it was needed the next 40.000km after he inspected it. Some spare parts were unavailable to get for our old Hilux, but it was not critical things. 
He doesn’t speak much English but he called some friends who does.

name: Wild Camp next to the Beach
description: Nice spot next to beautiful, clean and empty beach. Beach only exists during dry season. curious but friendly locals. Low hanging electricity lines on the road down to the beach.

name: Quite street Camp
description: Parking on the street. Street is quite at night. We were able to use toilets and shower of nearby Zostel Hostel.

name: Wild Camp next to beautiful lake
description: Just a few meters from the road next to lake. street is not busy at night. beautiful view. A little bit of rubbish. Some locals made small bonfire close by.

name: Lakozy Motors Toyota
description: This is a bigger garage with a nice English speaking head mechanic who knows about overland travelling. Service is good, genuine parts. We had oil pressure measured and the oil pressure gauge sender changed but no big work done. 1770 rupees including car wash and two cups of coffee ;)

name: RAM Auto Spares and repair
description: Quick and good Service. Speaks good english.

name: Springhaven B&B
description: Great place which you can book on airbnb. Very clean, safe are to park bikes or a car. Good food, modern bathrooms and big ac rooms.

name: Kayalpura Homestay
description: Lovely place, newly opened (01/18), 3 AC rooms (2500/=) other non-AC rooms, homecoming food available, water view, nice bathroom and super friendly owners. No parking but small rigs can park on the end of the road. Big rigs will have a problem.

name: Periyar National Park
description:
To those who think about coming here, there are some points to think about:

- read a little bit about this place, the reviews provide a mostly good picture of how touristy this place is.
- if you plan to do any tour in the national park, book in advance. In high season (nov-march) waiting times of two days are nothing exceptional
- be warned: we had the impression that the capacity of the national park is at its abdolute limit in terms of absorbing tourists. It's solid mass tourism here.
- if you do (night) walks: expect to stay in plain sight of the village and not to really enter into the forest. a 3 h tour lasts about 1.5 h. it's a pretty easy stroll.
- the whole village is cramped with hotels and handicraft stalls. 

Think about if this NP really is a must on your itinerary. Most likely you won't see a huge amount of wildlife. Most likely you'll have a weird feeling to pay around $12 for a walk 15 m off the village road.
The mountains are nice, maybe it's worthwhile staying nearby in a less touristy place.

name: Department of Forest & Wildlife
description: Here you can get the permit for hiking in Sukhna sanctuary. You need to get the signature of the head of the department. It took us half a day to get it and they made us come back and wait for him. We got the permit for free.

name: Nepli Entrance Gate to Sukhna Wildlife Sanctuary
description:
Open 9am - 5 pm. 
You can park behind the gate in the premises of the Sanctuary. There are even some roads you are allowed to drive in there. We recommend to park the car and hike the trail to Kansal Log hut. Make sure to get the permit for entering at the department of forest and wildlife before you come here.

name: Govt. Beer Shop
description: Beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer beer.

name: Neelkanth Mahadev Spot
description: This spot is not leveled at all but the best we could find in the area after driving up the hill. If you have level blocks it's alright. There are also many stones you can use. We stayed two nights. It is next to the road and the hiking treck to the temple. Few cars passing by. During the day mostly pilgrims pass by. You have cows and friendly monkeys around. At night there are elephants in the area so be careful. We stayed two nights and walked to the temple from here.

name: Majestic Residency Beach Resort
description: Big name for a small place. Free parking with sea view. 2 times a day spectacular fishermen show. Not the nicest beach, but good for a walk. Only little rubbish. No shade for vehicle but some picknick huts next to parking lot. Owner speaks little English and has a grumpy aura but is very friendly and happy to host overlanders. Nice family. Toilet and shower available as well as four rooms. Veg.Thali 120/= and breakfast 60/=. Super delicious food! Only Indian tourists around (don't come in May, they told us that's very crowded because of Indian holiday), only small shops for soft drinks and snacks. To enter the area you have to pay 10/=.

name: Pine Beach Forest
description: Nice shady place in pine forest at beach. good access. weak 3g Vodafone signal. some locals around. very quiet.

name: Vedha MAN Truck Workshop
description: One of the very few MAN workshops in India. Friendly staff, overnighting was possible here. Attention: Most european MAN parts are not available in India, you have to bring them yourself - typical when outside of Europe.

name: old farm road
description: old truck track off the main road. we saw cattle tracks but saw no other signs of life.

name: stupa wild camp
description: wild camp just beyond a religious site. there is a road just at the bridge, and it goes into a valley with a stream.

name: Riverside beyond town
description: beyond the towns take the road to the right if coming from kargil (64ks away) and follow as long as you like. good flat spaces near the river available. had some curious Shepard visitors in the morning but harmless.

name: Company Bagh
description: Parking for 10 rupies per day. Very calm and safe. Nice people. they close the doors at 8 pm.

name: Rajputana midway Mahwa Rajasthan (Agra-Jaipur Highway)
description: Stop for restaurant, breakfast, WC. We sleep one night (ask for permission). Really nice people. The food in the restaurant is very tasty, they do it food for tourist people, without spicy!!! Nothing nothing spicy!!! Perfect place.

name: AH2 north of Kohima
description: Large flat area. 3/400 M from AH2. No facilities. Room for big rigs. Tents. Mobile coverage. Great views. No shade.

name: grass strip on amazing lake
description: Strip of grass, next to the road on bundi lake. The view is gorgeous bht the place is very dirty. Though, can be a good campspot. The entrance is thin, so only a small car, maybe a 4x4 can fit.

name: little forest near temple
description:
A little shaded place between a bunch of trees
Surrounded by wheat fields and small friendly villages. Shaded, with good wind. You can camp inside but more than a 4x4 will be too big. Beautiful place to spend a night. No running water but 4g connection :)

name: parking next to gangas river
description: Nice parking spot. Overlooks the beautiful gangas river. Relatively quiet, close to river and easy to get to. The down hill road is a bit rocky and steep,but our 800cc omni did it like a champ. No shade or infrastructure.

name: peaceful parking
description: A nice small parking next to a clean river. The spot is relatively far from rishikesh but close to friendly small villages with vegetables and groceries. Very quiet and peaceful. A big rig will have troubles entering. No signal or infrastructure.

name: Dudhia
description: Large area in base of river so dry season only. Not too close to cemetery. Army base close too, so expect a visit. They were concerned with our wellbeing, nothing more. Airtel 3g strong.

name: View Point Taj Mahal
description:
Very nice view to the Taj Mahal. We were there early at the morning. No tourists and not a lot of other people. 
You can park your car and walk only 200 meters.

name: Siliguri Bharat Petroleum Fuel Station Overnight
description: You can park your rig here for 200 Rupies per night. Safe. Restaurant nearby. You may sleep in car or go to hotel via Taxi as we did.

name: rishikesh to daramsala
description: Great hotel for campers. Big yard for any sized rig, great food and very nice staff. Overlanders are welcomed. We stayed in our van for free and even used the bathroom and shower. Suny is the man

name: Quiet and close to the highway
description: Quiet, lot of space, no disturbtion and close to the highway, good sleep! Big cars also

name: At abandoned factory, close to main road
description: Easy and level parking for a night next to empty factory building.

name: Tadoba Tiger Vally Resort
description: Irai did not have a room free. It is more expesinsive but looks very nice. This is One of many Resort. We stayed here 2 nights. Everythig was perfekt. Staff is very helpfull. 6000rp per night and 5500 for safari. Usually you have to arrange safari online before you come here but as we went first to „Irai Safari retreat“. The guy on the reseption was very nice and arrange the hotel and the safari on spot.

name: Consular Section of Iran New Delhi
description:
Bring all your Documents in copy! We went to „The Hans“ Hotel around the corner to get the copyies. You will need an Iran registration number bevor you go to the embassy. Look at Caravanistan hompege for an agancy (we used Key2Persia) and more information. 

Next to the Indian bank at Tansen Marquet you can make passport Fotos. 5min walk.

Visa was done in 2 Days.

name: Hotel Haveli Kalwara
description:
Parking space in a garden behind the Hotel.
Entering the Indira Bazaar Rd. On your left is the hotel entrance, they will show you the way for the parking area.
You can see your car from the balcony. Rooftop view of Nahargarh Fort.
Hotel is renovating and we guess it will be very nice once finished ;)

http://www.booking.com/Share-n0o6op

name: Manohar Mistri
description:
Good mechanics Specialised in 4x4

For Address insert in google maps: Prem Johdpur Auto Engineering Works, opposite laxmi petrol pump, M I road, Jalupura, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302001, India

name: Hatu peak homestay
description:
Amazing homestay with lovely kind family on a mountain edge overlooking valley. Best place we have stayed in. Cheap and excellent 

Grt food also. Superb hike up to the peak

name: Sai’s Auto works
description: They do mechanical jobs for all types of european cars like audi, bmw, land rover , jaguar , mercedes benz, vw, and skoda

name: Dame side camping
description: Flat area with some mango trees. Quite a lot of locals around but compared to other places in India it’s okay. Decent Indian “wild camping” ;)

name: Rouf John
description:
We are Trip Advisor Certificate of Excellence  Award Winner for five consecutive years.

Swiss Hotel Kashmir is always trying to promote natural tourism and organising city tours.

Being also a home of overlander tourists with ample own secured  parking place. Our customers enjoy all the amenities and ambience of the best of modern hotel and the constant attention of our trained, friendly and dedicated staff.﻿

name: Camping at Ganges
description:
Beautiful well hidden place next to the Ganges. Very quiet, no people, some monkeys, nice view to Haridwar.
Many other spots nearby. 
At the entry Gate tell them you want to go to Rishikesh.

name: Speed Monks (motorcycle workshop)
description: The go-to place in Delhi for Superbikes, but still took care of bearings for my DRZ. Carries tyres as well, mostly Metzeler.

name: Hotel Ashirvad
description: Budget hotel, 400/night single, 550/night double for no AC. Very basic accommodation but friendly staff. parking for bikes on a platform in front of the hotel,  cars have room on the street in front.  The owner owns a bike wash and car and bike mechanic shop next door, and they helped fix my flat tire.

name: Chakka Morh Bowli (spring drinking water )
description: Fresh cool drinking water from a natural spring. ' BOWLI' , a spring called in local language is a common source of fresh water, thought to be very good for health, it certainly is refreshing to drink from one. Bowlis are the natural heritage of this valley and are an important part of the everyday life.

name: Triund Camping
description:
The official campground which you can book in McLeod. Lots of people, some shops/restaurants, possibility to rent tents and sleeping bags, etc. 
you will be probably charged if you put your tent here.

name: Next to Triund
description: Really just next to the triund camping, but free of charge. Best view on the snowy mountains from that spot!

name: Free space with mountain view
description:
Very big place next to some stone houses. Beautiful view on the snowy mountains. 
Make sure you start the trek at the waterfall. There you won't be charged!

name: First camp/half way to Triund
description: This campsite is wide open. Tours stop here half way to Triund. If you are exhausted make a stop here. Not completely sure if it's free. I think they also provide food there if there are groups. It might be possible to rent tents here!

name: India migration office
description: You need to bring a copy of your passport (you can make it here) and visa.

name: India customs
description: Customs office right in front of the bridge.

name: Ruins of Gaur
description:
Gaur is the medieval capital of West Bengal. In this area you find a lot of sites to visit. And you don’t have to pay an entrance fee! 
There is a village close by but it seems to be a quite peaceful place where you could try to camp.

name: Care container lines
description:
For shipping you contact Poolak: poolak@carecontainerlines.net

We are going to ship with them and they seem to be experienced and reliable about shipping vehicles for travelers.

name: Wild camp near Takloch
description: Great spot above quiet road in the hills. Parking possible for bike & SUV. Just walk a bit up hill from the road and there is place for tent & fire.

name: New Customs Office
description: Customs office where motorcycles and vehicles that have been flown into the Country are processed

name: Forest wild camping
description: Nice and calm place in a small forest, also for big trucks

name: Bon Barbecue
description:
Restaurant wit bbq and buffet. 

We are traveling, and don’t like buffet or expensive restaurants. But IF you want to eat a lot Indian food. Nice and clean. Lots of tastes. You have to go here.
You first get 10 appetizers and a small bbq on the table with meat or vegetables. Later you can eat from salad bar, buffet and dessert buffet. Two persons 1800 including drinks.

name: wild bush Camp
description:
wild Bush Camp Next to Street. Calm in the night. 
just some Indian visited us.

name: wild bush camp.
description:
We stayed here for lunch, but I think the place is good for wild camp with the car. empty field next to the street. 
no Vodafone connection!

name: WHEELWORLD TIRES SHOP
description: good tire shop. Continental and bridgestone and more. balancing.

name: Lulu mall
description: biggest shopping mall in India. there is a supermarket where you get everything! really everything also western stuff like tampos !

name: johns residency
description:
nice hotel, superfriendly und helpful owner John. really fast internet. 
5 min walking to betty boat which brings you for 4 rupees to fort Kochi. 
Indian coffee house nearby. 
parking lot for motorcycle

name: Mustang Motors. pvt ltd
description:
mechanic garage for foreigner cars. 
We changed our breaks.
nice and friendly stuff

name: Krishna store
description:
here you get everything what a supermarket have.
fruit and vegetables, tea, bread, rice and a lot more. 
on the side is a little little cafe coffee day bar what you get the best latte ( 20 R), cappuccino (40 R) ever and fresh juices for less.

name: mayam Next to lake
description:
a wonderfull peacefully place. you can park next to the lake. the locals a very friendly and don't bother you.
no mosquitos and very quiet at night.
one of my favourite places in hole India.

name: customs commissioner
description:
for extension the visa of the car. 
bring copy of 
passport. 
carnet and original
automobilclub of your homecountry
automobilclub India
letter why you need the extension.  

And a lot of time

name: laundry for smart people.
description:
laundry shop with real washing machines. We paid for 4.5 kg 190R 
friendly and needs 2 days.

name: RAMA COLOR photoshop
description:
they do passport pictures. or print 10 passport pic for 300 rupees. 
needs 15 min. for good quality.

name: India customs office.
description: Small little customs office, blink and you will miss it, but the locals are quick to point it out for you.  Small but efficient staff.

name: CST (Main Train Station)
description: Main train station for long distance travel through India. Accepts motorcycles and can be shipped with the traveler, large bikes included (I shipped a 1200gs with hard boxes).

name: Computerised Weigh-bridge
description: Weigh-bridge for weighing the car before shipping. 120inr.

name: Saraswati Motors
description: Excellent spares parts shop, very professional. They imported spares for our Toyota Hilux, which were not available in India, it took some time, but the price was good, so it was worth waiting.  011 26114814

name: Welder & Fabricator
description: Needed a luggage racked welded. The guy was also repairing a SUV radiator. Cost of repair to luggage rack was 100INR. Did not need to wait long.

name: Airtel Mobile Shop
description: they sell mobile sim cards, already pre-activated for up to 84 days. 1,5 GB a day!

name: Dzükou Entry Point
description: For me it was quite difficult to find any useful information about the valley. That's why I'm sharing my experience with you. I stayed in a homestay where I could park my bike safely and leave all my other stuff. Then I took a taxi in the morning to get to this entry point here (keep the entry ticket, it will be checked at the guest house). Everyone told me I need to take a guide (1500Rs/day) and a jeep (2000Rs) to get to the starting point of the trek. Result: I didn't take guide and jeep and arrived at the guest house in the valley after 4,5 hours of hiking (2hr to get to the starting point of the trek and 2,5hr to get to the guest house). The trek is quite difficult on some parts but mostly easy. There is only one way leading to the valley, so absolutely no guide required. Maybe you should consider about going with a guide when you want to explore the whole valley and stay for a few days with camping.

name: Dzükou Valley Guest House
description:
Prices in Rs
Dorm 50
Private room 150/person
Kitchen 50
Dal and rice 200
Tea 30
Coffee 50
Omelette 80
Noodles 60
Blanket 50
Foam Mattress 50
Tent 1000/person
Sleeping bag 100
Pillow 50

name: Japfü Homestay
description:
Simple and clean rooms with hot water. Safe and roofed parking for motorcycles and enough space for cars and trucks in front of the house. The owner speaks english very well and is an excellent cook.
I left my bike and stuff here when I went to Dzükou Valley.

Turn left from the highway at the sign to Vicha homestay.

name: Harvalem Waterfall
description: Nice waterfall and swimming hole (for the adventurous).

name: Mountain View
description: Place next to the road with an amazing view to mountains and the Monestry far away. Lots of armycamps around. This is the furthest point between two of them.

name: Mont Blanc Guesthouse
description: It's more likely a homestay. Only 4 rooms. Secure parking. Nice family. Hot showers (if there is electricity) we paid 800 for double room 300 for breakfast and 400 for dinner.

name: Overnight spot on roadside
description: It’s half on the road so that people can still cross. But is a old road that’s not being used anymore. Just for narrow cars and may need 4x4 to get up the first bit. Only had 1 car pass in 12h and nobody walking past or standing next to car.

name: Dzomsa
description: 100 Rps/ kilo bring before 11am, get back at same day.

name: Shiva Face Rock
description: Old sculpture of Shiva's face carved into the rocks. Sculpture is located on Ozran Beach which is very picturesque and rumored to be clothing optional in the high season.

name: siachan enterprises
description: Nice experimented guy. low level of english but he nows what he does. best in town

name: BMW Motorrad Service Center.
description: Authorized BMW Mottorad service center. they pulled and repaired my engine for $38.

name: Parking in front of Borgos resort
description: Just in front to Borgos Resort. Big parking place, broad lawn, with water easily behind the houses (where resort workers live). some local Very quiet for the day, especially the night. We stayed 5 days, Nobody has charged us anything. We ask permission at the resort reception. very friendly people. just 200 meters from the entrance of the safari. town at 15 minutes walking. Excelente for relax time.

name: Cooking Classes
description:
At Babli Kitchen you can learn how to cook authentic Indian dishes 
you find her also on facebook. search for Bable Kitchenz

name: Indian Culture Resort
description: some huts behind a big Parking Area. Very good parking for Motorbikers in front of bungalows. shadow and sun. quite clean, hot shower, average Wifi. short ways, quite central

name: Umiam Lake
description:
Lake side. Cooking hut. Very friendly locals. 
treat the kids with smiles and the adults with respect and you will feel like home.

name: TIR parking Shimla Inn
description: Big parking place in front the hotel. many truck slept here with us. It a bit noisy from the road but no-one came bothering us. Free parking. Toilets available and 3G coverage.

name: Total car care
description: I came here because of a cooling liquid leak and they found the guilty pipe and changed it. In the end they even let me the choice to pay or not and I had to define my own price :D

name: Beautiful beach
description:
We found this one after the other nearby was  closed.
Just go straight at the southern corner of the street. There is a little path down to the beach. Some clearance needed. Maybe only for 4x4.
2g airtel and vodafone

name: In the fields
description: We arrived here at night so nobody saw us. In the morning there were few people around but they didn't really pay attention to us. It is near an irrigation channel.

name: Restaurant & TIR parking
description: the owner is very welcoming and will let you sleep on his parking with other few truck drivers. He gave us water bottles and tea in the morning. A bit loud because of the road but very convenient and easy to find.

name: Auto World Vintage Car Museum
description:
We came here because of the museum but they also have a great shaded parking where we spent the night. There is also a restaurant nearby with a local menu and dances. Toilets nearby.
Parking gets empty at 11pm because the restaurant closes.
You can hear the road but it was ok for us.

name: Hotel New Park
description: Large parking lot at the hotel "Hotel New Park" next to the main building suitable for big ricks, 250 INR per night without breakfast, very quiet because little busy road, inexpensive hotel restaurant available, toilet use possible

name: In the bushes
description:
Flat area in the middle of the bushes. Very quiet except one car in the morning (8am). It was the police but they just checked my passport, seem to be hesitating whether it was allowed to stay and left without saying anything.
From Zainabad village, go in the desert, then there are two main path, follow the left one until a temple. At the temple, go on the right and follow the path until here.

name: honeymoon point
description:
Also called sunset point, it is a parking at the end of dead-end road. Don't come there during sunset because it's overcrowded but one hour later should make it.
We slept one night here were disturbed only by some young people playing loud music for 10 minutes in their car around 11pm and left. But as we were already sleeping in the car they didn't realize we were inside and didn't bothered us.
amazing view!

name: Wild spot near the road
description:
We slept on the first area along the road because we arrived there at night and we didn't see the second area a bit further down.
It was calm during the night but traffic started again around 7am.
On the first area you're barely seen from the road, on the second area you're totally hidden.

name: GOKARNA
description: Very nice parking by the beach. Quiet and secure. Vishnu was born here and there are many pilgrims.

name: Quiet place near the highway
description:
Old excavated place with many flat areas to park. 2wd ok. big rig ok.
Only two curious in the morning but they left quickly. You can't be seen from the highway or from the main dirt road.

name: Huge deserted flat area
description: From the main road, take the dirt road just before the wooden fences. Then go straight wherever you want, the ground is hard enough for 2wd. If you go far enough, you'll be hidden by the small hill.

name: Royal Agonda Beach Villas
description: Nice Place to stay, also with big Trucks. Close to the Beach, very friendly staff. Restaurant with delicious food. We have been there 4 Weeks included a break at home.

name: Wind turbines hill
description:
Exit the main road after the bridge and take the dirt road. Be careful where you go, some paths are soft sand, some others are hard sand. If you come to my exact location you'll be hidden from the road and have a nice view on the other side.
The wind turbine keeper came only 5 minutes to check on us and left. we slept here one night. 2wd ok.

name: Under the wonderful trees
description: Big area with many flat spots and big trees. You can easily find shade here and the ground is hard enough so that any vehicle can come. You are visible from the small road nearby but nobody came to us. The sky full of stars is wonderful here. Many camels, goats and cows passing by.

name: Apani Dhani Ecolodge
description:
Very nice and zen guests house in the middle of an organic farm. You can rent a tent or a little bungalow. The family is very friendly and helpful. They prepare very good Indian food all made from fresh ingredients from the garden! 

You can rent a bike(250 for a day) and cycle around in the area. In the villages around this place you have a lot of havelis(over 200 beautiful painted townhouses already in Nawalgarh) some are open to visit and walking around in Nawalgarh is really a one of a kind experience!

It is a ecolodge so water is heated by solar panels. In the morning it will be cold but they do provide buckets with hot water on request.

You can just send an email to apanidhani@gmail.com. I added the price list. Camping in your own car not allowed.

name: Nannilam organic farm stay
description:
Little gem. It is a organic farm. The also rent 2 rooms and 2 tents(see picture) for 2500 the night. Also little nice swimming pool
But camping is also allowed. Nice food. The owner speaks well english and also german.
Good wifi and 4g airtel reception. Washing machine available. Plenty of space

name: Ranthambhore Tiger valley hotel with campspot
description:
Hotel near Ranthambhore National Park with beautiful view over the park.

We booked one of the safari tents for 2 nights, to go on a safari tour to spot tigers in Ranthambore National park. 

After talking to the owner he is interested in receiving more overlanders to camp in their own vehicles. He has a big fenced garden to facilitate campers. 

Toilet and (cold) shower available, hot bucket shower on request. 

Around 10€ per night would be the price. 

Send him an email or call to make reservations. 

Mail: jai007@ymail.com
tel: 09460336678

name: Shower in thr temple
description:
For 15 rupees you can get a shower with a towel at the toilets of the temple.
Good opportunity to visit this cupcake temple

name: Toll Station
description:
This toll is 80 rupees. If you don't have a Fastag then you have to pay double - so 160 rupees maximum. Just be firm and don't give more. After 10 minutes they will let you pass. I have done this myself several times.
.

name: Rangniwas Palace Hotel(camping possible)
description:
A little oasis in the middle of Udaipur. Hotel rooms are just renovated (1800 rupees per room is you bargain a bit) Rooms are super clean and modern. Also possible to camp here on the parking of the hotel (500 rupees). There is a little bathroom available.

The place is a old palace, has a big garden to relax and a swimming pool!

name: Heera bicycle rent
description: Shop where you can rent a bike or bicycle to discover Udaipur and the lakes. They give you a free map with different routes in the area. Bicycles 200 rupees for a day.

name: Kale da dhaba
description:
Delicious food for small budgets. 
If you stay at Mrs Bandhari’s 1km away, you can eat here to offset the steep camping prices there. 
Great tasting chicken tikka masalas, afghani masalas, malai kofta etc. 
Big menu, veg and non-veg. 
We ordered for about 400 rupees each but it was so much we took home half in a doggy bag.

name: Tadka family restaurant
description: good food. veg restaurant. they have burgers pizza and sandwiches. India food they got too. they can do no spicy. they speak english normal. animals inside, like rannits ducks, etc. clean place. good parking. nice price.

name: Behind Rama Teertha Hindutempel
description: Calm spot with a great view behind the Rama Teertha Temple. You can approach it from the south easily.

name: Brewhaus and other beer bars
description: On the 6th floor there is a micro brewery with nice beer. When we were there they had a stout, amber and honey beer. On the ground floor there is a nice beer bar as well with international beer. Both have great atmosphere and great staff. Around the corner there is another micro brewery: The Brewmasters wich has also great beer. Good area for beer lovers like us :). All three places have a kitchen as well.

name: BMW Motorrad Lutyens
description: Official dealer and workshop for BMW Motorrad. Very nice team and professional. If you are in a budget, you can discuss with them which work to do or not before, they will arrange everything for you. You can purchase original parts, oil, accessories, and tires from them. You can contact them before to be sure they have the parts if not, they will be ordered for you. Prices for some parts may be more expensive than in Europe because they need to import. But this may change as BMW Motorrad has a new manufacturing plant in India. We trusted them not only our K100RS but also our Bonneville us almost all the team used to work for Triumph before.

name: Money Change
description:
Money Exchange.
When you enter from the Main Street it’s the 4th Shop on the leftside. Yellow Logo!

name: Near the temple
description:
Near a temple and a tiny lake, we slept one night here. Only one guy and few cows came around 7am.
You can't be seen from the road.

name: Castle Toyota
description: Toyota dealer. Amazing service and good english speaking mechanics. We had a problem with the temperature of the engine. We checked it at two other workshops but we were not sure. The second one brought us here. They checked the car for half a day and fixed some small problems. They only charged us for the new coolant. They even let us sleep on the parking. We could use the toilet whole night and even the security guards were very friendly.

name: Harike wetlands
description: Beautiful and peaceful spot at the Harike wetland bird sanctuary. Especially in winter its a heaven for bird lovers. We also spotted wild boar, monkeys and a fox. You can camp near the interpretation center, see coordinates. There is a water well but other then that there are no facilities. Dont forget to get your permit at the Wildlife office in Harike village. Take a left after the police station if your coming from amritsar. We stayed for free.

name: Lonely road
description: This wild camp is close to the main road, but surprisingly quiet and lonely. You can be seen from the street far away, but no one was bothering us. With 4x4 you can go deeper into nature so you are not even visible. Road is dirty and high ground clearance needed!

name: wild camping
description:
quiet place near to the road. we came to this place whit suzuki omni but it might need 4wd in some seasons.
full 4G Vodafone service

name: in the salt desert
description:
we slept on the road that lead to Gangto island. we came in a full moon night and it was amazing.
people came for the sunset and left 2 hours later, so we stayed here without interruption.
possible only in the dry season.
have Vodafone 4G service.

name: Sambar salt lake
description: One of the many places where you can sleep on the Shambar salt lake. We entered the lake near the temple Shakanbhari Mata Mandir, spent the day driving on the lake and went here on the side to be hidden by the bushes.

name: Mandvi beach
description:
Parking spot on the beach. was quiet at the night except of police people came at meadnight and asked questions. people start to arrive at 6:30 in the morning. it cost 20 rs.
 there is toilet in the place that we didn't try. 
there is Vodafone and Airtel phone service.

name: Camp at mantra surf club
description: Possibility to camp on the parking of this surf school. Not very cheap(600 rp without meal and 800 rp with meal per person) but very nice place! Clean toilet and warm shower available. If you have a tent you can camp next to the water. You can also do all kind of water activities here like subbing, surfing and canoeing. Very nice people, quiet, good food and great atmosphere. (Smoking/drinking not aloud)

name: Dream Beach
description:
Follow the road on GoogleMaps to find this place. When you reach the beach, there is a big flat spot to park your car. However, it’s way less buisy if you continue to follow the road to the right. You can park easily behind the Hindu shrine and will be left alone for most of the time.

The beach itself is a dream of a place. Big, wide sand area with mango and coconut plantations behind it. Most of the day nobody is around, just for sunset some very friendly villagers are joining you. There is also the possibility to stay at a cottage right at the cliff with a view above the whole coastline. It should be very cheap and can be found on AirBnB, yet we didn’t try it. We stayed for 5 nights and had no problems. You should buy groceries beforehand, as the next good village is 20 km away.

name: wild camping
description: nice peaceful place between the agricultural fields. quite easy to reach. There are people living and working on the fields. they came at 11pm to ask what are we doing there but were very kind and understanding

name: Reliance Smart
description: super market with everything you can need

name: wild camping
description:
Very quiet place. A road that rises on a mountain close to the freeway. We passed a guard who let us sleep there.
slept on the road. 
Vodafone 4G service.

name: United marine agency
description:
We shipped our car from india to chile.
Abraham was very helpful. He needs three working days to do everything
Day1: go to his office, hand in carnet and passport, they bring it to customs to get the approval to initiate the export process. Once granted you need to bring your car to customs warehouse leave it there
Day2 go to the warehouse to make customs inspection. They do net deep search in the car
Day3 got to the warehouse, they bring the container. You stuff it in. Wait again for customs and steamer approval to seal the container. Go to abrahams office again, make payment and collect your passport.
If you need the carnet back, maybe on day 4 depending on customs.

Was straightforward processing but it is still india and simple steps like waiting for the container to get out on the ground from truck can take 2 hours

name: Pro Mark Tyre India Pvt. Ltd
description:
Mr. Sachin will arrange tires of European brands and sizes for motorcycles and cars. Prices are correct. His office and workshop are in Delhi but he can send (small fee) tires everywhere in India, just make a deposit for the payment in a Axis bank. If tires are available he can send them within 2-4 days, if not allow him 10-12 days for import and shipping. Contact him by WhatsApp (+91 999 999 2202) or email (promarktyreindia@gmail.com) he is very reactive.
Two-wheeler tires brands: Heidenau, Pirelli, Bridgestone, Metzeler, Michelin...
Four-wheeler tires brands: Continental, Falken,  Michelin, Pirelli, Bridgestone... 

I bought from him one front (Rs 7'300) and two rear (Rs 11'300 each) Pirelli Scorpion Rally STR tires for our motorbikes. Sent to Goa by land for Rs. 850.

name: Parking on the beach in front of Novotel
description: This is a quiet spot right in front of the ocean. Guarded by the CCTV of the Novotel hotel so it felt safer. Locals are nice, except one who kept asking for alcohol because he thought our olive oil was some kind of whiskey.

name: Moustache Hostel
description:
Cosy hostel where we felt at home! They have private courtyard where you can park your car and sleep in it for 200r per person (negociable price). Quiet and nice area. Free access to bathroom, kitchen, Tv, rooftop... Free masala tea everyday at 6:30pm. Many tours and activities available with them. Bed dorm from 350r. Diner for 150r and breakfast for 100r. They also have a laundry for 200r.
Nice place to visit Dehli without driving too much in the city.

name: Paridhi Niwas
description: New, clean and affordable hotel with beautiful garden and very friendly staff. We stayed for free in our car and used their restaurant. We could use the toilet and even had a shower. However, for us this was arranged  so I'm not sure if they let any sleep in the car. Anyway, they have a good secure parking and clean rooms from 1500 rupees.

name: River Rock Resort
description: Resort with swimming pool and restaurant. Tent 250 INR. Quiet and safe, staff helpful. Clean bathrooms.

name: Ibankordor Jungle Resort
description: Pre-erected tents, and huts. Remote safe location for parking, room for 4x4s and Vans as well. Close to root bridges and incredible views of Bangladesh.

name: Hotel Una Megh and Garden cafe
