description: this guesthouse is one of the few that has safe parking. It is a simple but nice guesthouse. The garden from the cafe is a nice place to relax a bit. Price room is 400 per night with shared bathroom. There are also rooms with private bathroom.

name: Dhonk cafe and crafts
description: Very nice cafe (with good coffee!) and delicious food. They also have a shop with crafts. The workshop is right behind the cafe and worth a visit as well. They provide training and work for villagers. Some of them come from ex-poachers families to offer them a different future and dont harm the nature anymore. A great place to spend some time between your morning and afternoon safari :).

name: Open field across Tall Chhapar
description: Beautiful open field right at Tall Chhapar wildlife sanctuary. On the field you'll find already many Black Bucks and other aninals. There are some trees to hide but you'll be in sight. We got a visit from some villagers but other then that we were left alone. We stayed for two nights

name: Lucky's guest house
description: We paid 150 INR for one tent in the garden of that "guest house", they also have a restaurant, a small shop, basic bathroom. But very convenient for those who are used to do wild camping. The owner and his family are really nice.

name: Best food in India
description:
Seriously, if you’re on the highway passing by between Rajasthan and Mumbai (the NH1 is rickshaw-free between Vadodara and Ahmedabad!), consider making a stop here at Sigdi restaurant. It’s the best food we’ve had in India! Delicious fish in gravy, grilled chicken, great curries. All mouthwatering-delicious. And it’s a pretty atmospheric place with a garden. 
The three young guys who run the place are super nice. We let them decide what to bring us and is was all sooo good. Hifzy is a 4x4 enthusiast also, so can give you some advice for tracks perhaps. Plus, you can *probably* park in front and sleep in your car if you need an overnight stop around here. It’s OK to drive in the wrong direction in the NH64 service road for a few hundred meters to get here; they all do :)
Say hi!

name: passport photographer
Golden Temple car park
description:
Multi level car park next to Golden Temple. 25 Rs for 12 hours. Parking is at the beginning of the nice area leading to the temple. 
You enter the parking lot through a seperate street (ramp) and it is high clearance (at least 2,5 meter). Stay on the main road until you see the beginning of the ramp. It’s easy to find with maps.me. Dirty toilets on the ground floor but fresh air on the roof top.

name: Drive-In Beach
description: Nice and big drivable beach during dry season. Price for cars is 30 rupees per day, staying over night was not a problem. Might be very crowded on the weekends, in the evening always Indians come to play soccer or cricket.

name: Huge flat sandy area with many trees
description: Beautiful desert like area next to the road with many flat places and trees to hide. There is a lot of space so just follow the dirt roads and choose any place you like. Nobody bothered us, just some curious birds in the morning. No 4wd needed.

name: Reliance gas station
description: the only gas station we saw on this side (from Ahmedabad to Vadodara) of the NE1.  With restaurants, shop, toilet, ture repair and resting area. Also a good place to sleep in your car I think. The NE1 is a really good road and no bikes, tuk tuk or animals.

name: Covelong surf school
description:
A great surf school that allows you to camp right next to the beach and use the showers and toilets. 
Pahlani, Murty and the crew are great surf teachers and make you feel right at home. The restaurant serves a great mix of Indian and western food.

name: Train station parking lot
description: Friendly stationmaster that allows you to park behind the station and use the stations toilets. Guy speaks excellent English. Couple of boys came for a chat but left after a while and we had a calm night. Only one train per night passes

name: Rishi Toyota
description: Amazing service! We had a small problem that was difficult to solve and they fixed it. They even ordered a part for us while we were still in Jaipur. Eventuelly we didnt need it and they didnt make us pay for it. They  were really friendly and knowledgable and smoke really good english. They gave us a free ride to the city while working on the car. They charged us just some service hours, really cheap.

name: family guesthouse and campground
description: A very nice family who let us camp on the farmland. They also have a small camping ground and rooms for rent. The entrance is opposite the Kent Club. I do not know what the costs are for camping and the rooms. There is a toilet and washingroom available for camping. It is very quiet here. They don't speak english, but they are very friendly.

name: Guarded Goverment Parking
description: Huge area and parking place in the middle of the city. Mostly used by government officials to park their cars in nearby offices. 800 rupees for 24h

name: Great camping spot right besides the beach
description: Great spot for wild camping right besides the beach in a palm grove. Weren't bothered. Police came to check but said it was fine

name: Amazing views over Jawai Dam lake
description:
Between the rocks close to the water you'll have amazing views over the Jawai Dam lake. There are some tourist and locals coming but there are still many places that are quite hidden. 
Be aware of the wild animals that live around (Leopard, hyena, bear, crocodile) so its wise to make a bonfire in the evening.

name: Hibiscus Guest House
description:
Clean rooms, hot shower in the morning. Parking for two to three motorbikes. 
Lake view from rooftop.

name: Sadar Haveli Heritage
description: central, old Hotel with parking possibility for Motorbikes

name: Zostel Mysore
description: Really nice hostel, managed by two guys. They only have dorms, but also a big fenced empty lot just next to the hostel to park and camp. They let us us the common areas (kitchen, rooftop, garden) and a bathroom downstairs for 250rs./pers/night

name: Camp spot next to small riverbed
description: Beautiful spot close to the beach and next to a small river. We saw many cranes and flamingos on just 500m distance. From here you can also walk to the "private" beaches which are also used by some locals and fisherman. Very quite. You might need 4wd for the sand and mud. Be aware that the water comes up at night.

name: Next to the temple
description: Had to stop somewhere for the night and found this nice flat spot near a temple. Almost clean and water is available. Pretty quiet, even with the road nearby.

name: Perfect hangout at the beach
description:
Look no further! This is the place you are searching for. It is close to the beach behind a stonewall. Your position is at high ground so you can see the ocean. It is directly at the road, but people don’t bother you and there is maybe 2-3 motorbikes per hour passing by. It is one of the most relaxed places along the coast of Kerala. We stayed for 6 days, some small shops are in walking distance at the main road. There you get cold drinks, eggs and some other basic stuff. A little further walk you have nice food stalls to eat. We bought some Parota and made a curry ourselves. Highly recommendable. It is the perfect place if you need some time off and want to relax. Airtel 4G Connection is also good! 

The only thing to be aware of: there are 2 stray dogs that are really aggressive, charged us multiple times and we took cover in the car. If you are afraid of dogs it might not be the best place! In the end nothing happened, stay calm and look away. Then they don’t care :)

name: Moradia dos Quadros
description:
Neves has set up a beautiful luxurious guesthouse here. You can check prices and book online. 
He happily allowed us to camp on the gravel parking. There’s very nice places to sit on the veranda or in the lush green garden. 
There’s a separate building with clean toilet and powerful hot shower. 
We were the first guests who asked for camping and he didn’t know how much to ask, going from the price of a room to nothing. We eventually settled on a fair 400. 

To get here you have to take one of the ferries crossing from the Old Goa side which cost 7 rupees for a car. 

The access road to the guesthouse is narrow and a sharp turn to get into the gate, so big rigs might not make it.

name: Small abandoned factory
description: A 100 meters from the road, up a small track, is a small abandoned factory with enough space to turn around. Need blocks to level out. Close to a small waterfall (so "fresh" water available)

name: Under the smog of Dimapur
description:
On the side of the outgoing road from Dimapur is a clearing with some market skeletons (wooden frame). 
Behind it is a small patch, out of road-view. 
It's not much, but it's quiet, clean and easy accessible.

name: Guwahati restaurant parking
description:
On the ringroad of Guwahati. A large luxurious restaurant with a gated parking. 
The owner let us spend the night here. We at a light meal (very good, but pricy) as compensation. They offered the use of their bathroom. 
Very friendly

Entrance height is limited to around 3.5 or 4 meter.

name: Orbit hotel
description: After having 4 negative answers from hotels... (apparently full but we think that they are just not open to foreigner tourist), we found this hotel in Silchar, open for foreigner tourist. 1900 roupies for one room (2 single beds) with private bathroom, very good wifi, breakfast included, silent place, warm shower and nice people. They also have restaurant in the hotel and the food was good. Street parking.

name: Nehru park, Delhi
description:
For unknown reason this fantastic spot in the heart of the diplomatic area was deleted. 
Now it is back again. 
Free parking, day and night in a relatively quiet (for Delhi) place in the Nehru park. 
Pakistan embassy across the road, Iran embassy a 20 minute tuktuk-drive. 
There is public toilet and water in walking-distance and a market 10 minutes (on foot) away. 
It is safe (security guard) and as it is a very posh area, no beggars or roaming kids.

name: Botanical garden parking
description: Clean and big parking place of botanical garden. Public drinking water and toilets. Perfect for stay some nights there. Quiet place, which is difficult to find in Bangalore. Entry fee 60rps.

name: Parking Bangalore palace
description: Big quiet parking area. Toilets nearby. Security during night .

name: Parking gardé
description: Parking with views of the Ganges. 300 rupees a day. The boss is very nice. Very good little restaurant next door, same owner.

name: Hidden, quiet spot in the forest
description:
There was a house, long time before, but only ruins are left, and you actually camping in the garden, so it’s easy to access and flat. 
We went there by motorbike and pitched the tent, but cars can go there too. 
In the evening you hear some cars passing by but at night it’s very quiet, and you can’t be seen from the road.
Mobile is not working here (Airtel and Vodafone).

name: Fatipur Sikri parking
description:
For 200 roepies you can stay on this large parking-area. There is a night-guard and after sunset it is deserted. 
Bus to the site is right here, 10 rupees.

name: campsite near the river
description:
On the way to Moreh from Imphal, take the first track on the right after the bridge. it goes to the river. Here you can camp hidden from the road if you are cyclist or motorcyclist. For 4-wheelers a parking is available just before the river but you can be seen from few houses close to the road.
Very quiet at night, we saw nobody.

name: Heritage Village Parking
description:
We couldn’t find the other place, so we parked and camped here. 
It’s full of garbage, and locals come to drink in the evening, so watch out with empty glass bottles. It’s not a really nice place, but ok, if you want to safe money. 
With a car you could park a bit more in the front, there it’s nicer, but with the tent you better go to the end.
It’s a bit hidden from the street, and you can use the shelter for cooking.
When you continue the road up you can find two springs for water. The cleaner one is at the playground (drive up, it’s the second one), the first one is right sided, close to a gravelroad. Good coverage with IDEA (LTE) and ok coverage with Airtel. You can make a fire here if you want. Lots of fireplaces.
On the mainroad there are some shops and restaurants.

name: Hotel near Ranakpur
description:
The Roopam hotel. 
A few km from the Ranakpur Jain temple (a very unwelcoming place by the way) in the parking of a small hotel/restaurant. 

The owner (or man in charge) immediately let us spend the night. 

In return we ate a light meal in his (rather expensive, but tasty) restaurant.

name: Parking at Bishnoi Village resort
description:
We camped in the parking of this "camp resort". Normally the owner would ask 500 roepies, but we made a deal since we wanted to do a tour the next day (seeing wildlife and local life of the Bishnoi community). 
1500 for the (half day) tour and nothing for parking. Good deal. Saw lots of wildlife (deer, antilope, crane, flamingos, peacock, etc)

name: Supa Reservoir
description:
*Overnight camping/parking is NOT available at this location.
....
Nice hidden camp spot at the reservoir. Many birds chirping. Not far from the road, so if trucks pass, you’ll hear them. 

Take the turnoff towards the water at the intersection 150m west from here. When the tarmac turns right towards the gate and dam, go straight along the dirt road instead. This will lead you to the water. We parked at the first hidden spot we found. If you explore further, there might be more good spots. 

Between the coast and this spot, it’s a very nice drive through the National Park and Tiger Reserve via the southern route.

name: Polem Beach huts
description:
Rustic back to basic beach huts - they still exist in Goa. Very simple accommodation at the southern end of this peaceful little beach. He quoted 600 rupees a night for two people. No parties, no souvenir shops and almost no tourists. Only a slightly  more developed resort with restaurant at the northern end - for now. And surprisingly the first trash bins we’ve seen in Goa. 

There are a few huts in this coconut grove at the southern end of the beach. See right side of picture. It would be a perfect place to camp, and with a ground tent you can he said, but unfortunately there’s no car access. Young owner told us we could park in an open field right behind, but that’s away from the beach. 

I’d say if more overlanders show up he might realize it would be worth making the property accessible for cars from that field since he has plenty of space and the rest of the facilities in place already. There’s a basic outdoor toilet and shower and kitchen in a hut. Would make a very nice new overlanders spot in Goa if only he would arrange that car access..

name: Shosa Kitchen
description:
In Shosa Kitchen you get really good and tasty food. 
They have amazing cakes (for example warm apple pie, with icecream), they make homemade juices, you get sausage and bread in the middle of nowhere.
It’s a fusion of Western-Manipuri- and Tangkhul style cuisine.
They are super nice aswell - go there

name: Kizhunnarocks Beach
description: Small hotel resort with clean rooms, super friendly staff and outstanding restaurant. Directly on the beach! Pet friendly .

name: Mot Palong park
description:
Viewpoint of the plain of Bengladesh.
Flat parking. Rough road.
No amenities. Airtel 4G.

name: Rengpang's playground
description:
Wide flat spot. 
100m before a village with small shops and a bazar.
Good view of the valley.

name: FATBOY CUSTOMS
description: customs shop and one stop solution for all your motorcycle needs.

name: Mahi river
description: Big lake, close to the road. There is a way for van almost to the water. Nice for spending night and there is place for fire. No bothering pepole.

name: moustache hostel
description: Nice, lively and very clean hostel, lot of backpackers, awsome communial area with restaurant. We slept in the car for 200 r per person on the tiny parking space. Not for big rigs. There is a mosque in front that will wake you up with the morning prayer but the street gets more or less quiet in the night.

name: Choburja Balaji
description: Nice place to sleep for a night with a amazing view over the city. The small street is only with 4x4 vehicle to drive. We asked in the Tempel it’s possible to stay in the front, it was no problem. The place is very small, only for one car.

name: Parking at mountain lookout point
description:
We had a very quiet night here after watching the sunset at Savitri Point. The temperature is noticeably cooler here due to the elevation. 
When leaving at 8:30 a garbage truck arrived but apart from that there was no one.

name: City On Pedals
description: Backpackers hostel and guided bicycle tours company.

name: Bush camping next to river
description: 4x4 necessary. We arrived just before sunset and there were still a couple of locals by the river, though they all left as soon as it was dark. No issues/visitors in our overnight stay. There is Airtel 4G reception.

name: Hotel g.k Jain
description: Ok, it is not a very charming place to stay but if you are on the road and just looking for a (guarded) place to sleep it is fine. We booked a room for 600 rupees to use the facilities and slept in our own tent on the parking. If you barking a bit and don’t need a room you can probably pay less. The boys who work here are super friendly and there is nice food available in the hotel restaurant.

name: River next to road
description: There is a flat area underneath the bridge with a nice view on a small river. Nice swimming sunsets spot upstream. Some local comes here to swim or to wash the clothes. But at night there was some loud 'music' coming from the hotel. The bridge was not loud. Nobody bother us. Any kind af vehicle is possible. A lot of space.

name: Varanasi
description:
Parking on the banks of the Ganges. Kept for 300 rupees a day. Very nice staff. Good restaurant next door.


Parking au bord du Gange. Gardé pour 300 roupies par jour. Personnel très sympa. Bon resto à côté.

name: Parking
description: parking en sortie de ville. proche du poste de police.

name: nandanic hotel palace
description: FREE parking, Single room starting from 550rn

name: Hotel
description:
Single room starting at 400. They try to get higher prices...
Food is okay and the price as well. Bikes can be parked in the basement. Its directly to the Highway, so its nice to stop for a night before or after Kalkutta, but you hear the trucks at night.

name: finestay guesthouse
description: Single rooms starting from 600 ringit. Kind of close to some attractions. Very friendly and helpful stuff. Parking for bikes and normal size cars behind gates.

name: bushcamp
description: There are some bushes that protect you from the road. Not a busy road so it was a quiet night. If you have 4x4 you can explore further. There is a small water reservoir for the farm grounds where you can take a refreshing swim. Only two people came in the morning but they left really fast so no trouble at all.

name: spencers
description: Supermarket for some Western stuff. No parking nearby...

name: The Short Giraffe Hostel
description: Parking at the Short Giraffe Hostel. Only room for 1 car (no big rigs) or a few motorbikes. The hostel is very chilled out, in a very central spot if you're visiting Varkala and the owners are really nice. You can also use the toilet and shower, kitchen and wifi.

name: Kumbhalgarh Fort
description: Parking at the fort is 20 rupees. There's the main parking as you drive through the gate though you can follow it around the outside of the wall to a flat area. We visited the fort in the afternoon and then hung around to see if we were allowed to camp here. At first the security guards didn't want us to stay though we explained that we were just staying overnight and they were ok. Very quiet here at night and a great view of the fort.

name: Jingkyrkhu I Pa Homestay
description: Nice Homestay with camping option on the roof. Room for rs500-600 and (own) tent rs200. very quiet and supernice owner who speaks very good english. Good location to start trekking to the rootbridges and waterfall.

name: Kumbhalgarh Fort Parking - theft attempt!
description: Stayed overnight at the parking by the Kumbhalgarh Fort. Woke up next day at 8am to two kids trying to break into the car. Be careful here. If you park here, try to stay lower, closer to the guards.

name: Camp spot with beautiful view
description: Very nice spot with view over de fields. In monsoon its probably even more beautiful. Very quite and hidden, we didnt see anyone, just many birds. Many spots around. We didnt need 4wd but I dont know about rain season. Enjoy this rare beautiful spot in this area!

name: Ticket Office. Panna NP
description: Very nice and affordable park. Really good chance to spot animals like tiger, leopard and sloth bears. We saw a sloth bear and many deer and birds. We paid 2680 for a long morning safari for 2 persons. Worth the money! We also camped in the parking lot of the ticket office for free.

name: Root bridges
description:
Great place to stay for having a look to the root bridges. The parking lot is a bit buisy and you may have to search for a good place to park. But if you do find one, you are rewarded with toilets and a shower (50 rup). In March 18 they seem brand new, we will see how fast it gets worse. 
The way to the root bridges is the shortest possible, but still 400m down a stairway. Don’t forget to also visit the blue lagoon, it’s the perfect refreshment after doing a small hike in the area.
All people are very friendly and in the small stalls you can buy basic stuff and/or eat. It’s really a great place to be.

name: International travellers hostel
description:
Probably the best place to stay in Varanasi for overlanders. We could sleep in our car a little further from the hostel. It was in a alley next to some property which belongs to the hostel as well. Felt really safe there. The hostel itself is very nice. Good vibe, nice garden and very clean. The staff is really great and they have good food as well. You can also use the kitchen to prepa
re your own food. We paid 500 rupees to sleep in the car and use all the facilities. There is also a washingmachine which you can use for 100 rupees per load + 100 rupees if you want to use there detergent.

name: Yuksom Helipad
description: Directed here by National Park ranger. Large flat tarmac area 1.5kms from the restaurants of Yaksom. Quiet with extensive views down the valley. Right beside start of treks into Kanchenjunga National Park. 4g signal.

name: NE of Kalimpong
description: Flat grassy area by small cafe. very friendly family but please ask first and make a contribution to the family. 4g signal.

name: Quiet camp on the hill
description: Good campspot, not visible from the road and on a hill. After driving up you can take a left and the path will continue, offering several relatively flat campspots. During the day you hear some cars and trucks driving, but totally quiet during the night. No village & no people around.

name: Ellora hotel
description: Very basic hotel but with private secure parking. On site restaurant. Room with private bathroom (only cold shower). Wifi works. Price twinroom with fan incl breakfast R1400.

name: Quiet fieldcamp
description: Field with several spots along a dead end road. Very quiet during day and night. There are more campspots along the road, perhaps with better valley views. There seems to be a path leading to a rootbridge (500m). We tried but did not manage as the path was overgrown :-(. Airtel 4G available, but not everywhere on the field.

name: Riverbank camp
description: Pretty difficult to find a quiet spot along this busy road. From the main road there’s dirttrack (sharp turn at 27.0982527, 88.4643549) leading to the riverbank. At the start of the track there is a gate but it was open when we were there. We camped along the path but plenty of spaces down the riverbank (dry season). During the day there were a few trucks collecting stones. No one seems to bother and the people were very friendly. Quiet at night. 4G airtel.

name: zigzag guesthouse
description:
cozy guesthouse in Agra.
Moses and John are really nice owners.
clean guesthouse with terrace, restoran, kitchen.
I camp in the terrace for 100rupi
the road outside the hostel is safe and not traffic at all.
highly recommend here in Agra

name: Meyong powerhouse
description: If your are in need of a overnight spot this one will do. Nothing special. At the end of a (sometimes steep) 2 km track there is a powerhouse. From the mainroad (27.5280074, 88.5955669). We camped above it. Looks like it is still in use but we could’t find anyone so, decided to stay. Path becomes narrow with sharp hairpins at some point so not suitable for big trucks. No place to turn only at the end of the track. Airtel coverage.

name: Lagoon Beach
description: We spend here two nights but could stay here for infinity. Small lagoon beach, easy to reach,clean but no shade. Except if you are with a tent, then you can easily hide between the trees. Sometimes some locals come but most of the time nobody is around. For us perfect spot. With Airtel 4G but not everywhere .

name: Paradise
description: There is a road al the way to the beach, after that you can drive in the forest. Beautiful clean empty beach, I think it will be busy in the high season. Friendly locals, friendly police. We stayed here a week.

name: in the forest
description: Wildcamp on a lonely forest Road.. Some fields and farmers in the distance, the owner of the lands nearby past on his bike, but it was no problem to rest here. Nobody else bothered us, very quiet night

name: Parking area with a nice view
description: Nice guys on the parking area with a lot of shops, restaurants, etc. Ask the parking area guy for a nice car place close to the beach and in the night you will have a little bit wind. I payed 80 roupies for 24 hours. They have a parking area toilet, but I used the toilet and the shower from the “Palolem Beach Resort”. Not the best place, but if u have to stay there it’s okay.

name: zostel
description: Very nice hostel, with a pool! Nice pancake breakfast and really cool guys who run it. Place to park the car in the dead-end street infront.

name: Nice place with lake view
description: Nice quite sleeping place with the possibility to take a swim session in not salty water. Surrounded by water, no mosquitos, 4G connection and friendly locals. In the afternoon came a lot of locals to take a swim session and to wash there dresses. Close to the spot are some local shops to buy fruits or icecream ;)

name: Orange Sky
description: Nice place to have a drink at the bar or eat (breakfast, lunch, dinner). Prices are reasonable for Agonda and the food is incredibly good, go for traditional Indian food. Really friendly staff. Even the music is nice. A good, and not crowded, placed.

name: Short Giraffe hostel
description: The perfect place to stay and chill in Varkala. Incredible staff, young and dynamic. Dorm for 400 Rps. The hostel is located less than five minutes walk from the beach. You can also order really good food (nice breakfast). Bbq is often organised. It's out of the main road so really quiet. Hammock, ping pong table, badminton net, rooftop also available. Enough place to park, from motorbike to truck (if the gate is not too narrow). Pitch a tent is also possible. Definitely worth the stay.

name: Fresh chicken for cooking
description: Really delicious chicken for cooking! I payed 160 roupies for 1kg.

name: Garage
description: Nice guys / good garage. One of my mirrors got broken and they cutted a glas and put it in the body. I payed 500 Roupies.

name: Camping at a home
description:
ADMIN: Submitted by the owner and not Overlander verified.
------
It's a indian sikh family home built in a peaceful place in the outskirts of Amritsar .The place is 40km away from Amritsar with almost all the facilities nearby. Book an appointment on +919465957275

name: nivasa
description: Nice hostel with garden 1 km from metro station. They have 1 parking spot for smaller car ours didn't fit but under 2.50 you should. So we parked it on the street and slept in the dorm, 300 pp with airconditioning. Really chill vibes.

name: valliyoorkavu temple ground
description: There are already some nomadic people camping on the ground. there is a big ground with heavy vehicle can stop over in summer season (October to may) . some trees are there on the end of the ground for share. there is a small river nearby to access water and swimming. shops and restaurants are all within 50 meters. only issue is curious local people there asking about the trips

name: Silent place with a nice view
description: Silent place in the night for sleep close to a Hindu temple. Nice view. In the morning around 7 came friendly people to pray.

name: Youth Hostel
description: 300 rs per night double room, very basic rooms with bathroom, the manager is very helpful and gave us lots of information of the northeast India area. It’s a good spot to stop for one night in Imphal. There’s room to camp outside, bit of rubbish though. The gate closed at 8 pm, if you contact the manager (03852421618)can  open till 8.30pm, he speaks English.

name: Laktok Lake Viewpoint
description: Beautiful viewpoint of the lake, you can meet some curious locals,but very quiet after sunset. There is a basic toilet.

name: Lovers Beach small car park
description:
Tiny asphalt car park at the entrance to the Lovers Beach (part of Colva Beach). Almost no people, ok to camp out with chairs and table, big light at night, very safe. 100m to the beach with trees shade, but cars not allowed to drive in - we saw one 4x4 getting stuck in the sand 5m from the car park. 
Lovely quiet place, there’s literally no one at the beach, no hotels, resorts or restaurants. One lonely life guard only. :)

name: Galgibaga Beach small car park
description: Small car park by the beach, the only place we found in Goa with a big shade - trees and palm trees give a huge shaded area. Narrow road leads to the car park just by the beach (could be too narrow for big rigs). Few locals come throughout the day, lifeguard house nearby, also turtle hatching area so need to be careful. Very nice spot, very windy too so great for hot summer days.

name: Immigration
description: Immigration office. Quite a bit before the border. Get your passport stamped here first before you continue to the Customs office for your carnet.

name: Gorte Beach small car park
description: Small car park with direct access to the beach, at the end of the Gorte village. Enough space for big rigs, some street light at night, feels safe. Lots of locals moving around throughout the day, as it’s a fishing village. Temple and cricket ground nearby. We spoke with locals chilling at the stairs in the evening, and they were super friendly. Beach is a bit messy, but is a fishing beach so expect no tourist attractions whatsoever. Good for a night stay with a dip in the sea.

name: Tyres - Lal Sales & Service
description: Great place to get your tyres fixed or replaced. We’ve got 4 new tyres in a good price with no extra charges (unlike other places :/). Service is great and they go out of their way to find you the right tyres, which was a bit of an issue in our case. Good folks.

name: Wild camping at a large carpark by fishermen
description:
Huge flat concrete area right by the beach, in a small fishing village. Not many people at night but lots of movement in the morning with fishing boats going out to work. 
I’ve got 7am cricket session with the local kids. 
Great for big rigs, plenty of space.

name: Alsisar Mahal
description:
A period palace in the heart of the Shekhawati region of Rajasthan, converted into a modern, plush hotel, with all the ameneties like A/c rooms, Internet, Pool, Restaurant, Parking, 
Also, the venue for the annual music festival  'Magnetic Fields'

name: Forest camp
description: A little open space in a small forest. You can reach the place via the (paved) road to Baltal. Rocky and bumpy tracks run into the forest. As the spot is not too far away from the main road, you can hear some traffic during daytime but at night really quiet. A friendly sheperd family is living in a tent next to the forest (out of sight). They came to say hello, invite us for chai but didn’t bother us at all. Most of the place is not levelled but lots of stones around to level with. No reception with Jio. Unfortunately lots of rubbish in the forest. Alternatively there are also campspots close to the river with great views, but these are noisy and exposed.

name: Checkpoint
description: District police check point. They need your passport, visa & vehicle registration.

name: motorworld maruti suzuki
description: excellent car mechanics. the owner is a passionate of extreme raid both 4x4 and motorbikes. best place on in shimla.

name: Hilltop wildcamp
description: Nice and quiet spot with great views. As the only levelled places are on top of the hills, it could get windy. To get there, follow the path starting at coordinates 34.38926, 76.44246. After about 100 meters you can leave the path and drive straight uphill to the pile of stones. After that you can drive on to get fully out of sight of the road and pick your hilltop. Pretty steep climb, so low gear and 4x4 is needed.

name: Rajaji jungle castle
description: resort to the edge of the park. very scenic view. room for 3000 roupies. I didn't want to pay so much so they let me put my tent on a very good place inside. also a big flat place next to the resort that would be perfect for 4x4

name: Riverbed wildcamp & warm shower
description: Nice spot in the riverbed, away from the road and houses. As the river is very rocky and you cross it several times, ground clearance and 4x4 with low gear are recommended to drive further up the river. There however are already camspots in or around the riverbed right after the bridge at the town Shilla, on both sides of the river. We took the path over the bridge and went down into the riverbed after a few hundred meters. Locals told us it was ok to camp anywhere and pointed us to a hotspring further upstream (see other spot iOverlander).

name: Hotspring shower
description:
A nice warm open air shower coming from a hotspring. 
Parking at an abandoned building. Walk next to the river, follow some pipes.
After the second building next to the river you find the shower surrounded by natural-stones. Beautiful in a canyon. Reachable by vehicle, parking distance 150m. This place is also used by locals. In the early morning though, we were alone. No entrance fee!

name: Alchi wildcamp
description: A quiet campspot just before Alchi. Hidden from the roads. Driving to Alchi from the mainroad, don’t take the right paved road after the white row of stupas, but drive approx. 200m further to Alchi and take the dirt track on your right. Find your way by following the tracks.

name: Airtel shop J&K simcard
description: Airtel shop for local simcard Jammu & Kashmir as Indian simcards don’t work in this state. Bring passport and visa. 360 INR for 28 days (1,5 GB per day). Should be active after 30 minutes... However it took 3 days to activate and then the internet package was not activated. We needed to go back to the shop to activate it. Not sure if they tried to trick us or they made a mistake...

name: South Pullu permit checkpoint
description: 1st checkpoint where you have to show your permit for Nubra valley

name: Gaby’s cafe good place
description: gaby's cafe is an ideal bivouac place before or after the passage of customs of myanmar.  the owner is very nice.  for a vehicle he takes 200 rupees in a place with a view.  there is very clean toilet and shower with hot water.  a restaurant and even for those who want a guest house.  closed parking and watch.

name: Meadow Wildcamp
description: Quiet wildspot for the night, away from the road and with nice valley views. Also possible to camp in between the hills. Many spots available but take care with water crossings, muddy patches and deep sand. Best entry from the road is at 34.7549154, 77.5559791.

name: THE NEST
description: very Nice coffee and restaurant. wifi available. confortable. Nice and cosy  décoration. good food not too spicy.

name: Parking near Dynasty Resort
description: This is a taxi drivers grass parking, very big next to Dynasty Hotel, near lake Khurpataal, no facilities. Good stop to see the surrounding mountains in Nainital. Very quiet place on the hills, of course there will be some locals or tourists coming and looking at the car as usual in India

name: Lakeviewcamp
description: Quiet campspot at the lakeside. Beautiful views over the lake and the snowtopped mountains. Different ways to reach the place, but best is to find a lower track before the road goes up again, passing some nomads. Alternatively you can take a more steeper track down. There might be a lot of flies around though, so pick your spot carefully ;-)

name: Kiagar tso camp
description: Campspot with lakeview out of sight of nomads and the road. Some relatively levelled spots around and luckily no flies as on Tso Moriri. The lake is salt, but down at the lake along the tarmac road there is a waterpump with clear water.

name: Kasol Forest
description: Just outside of Kasol. In the forest. An open place. Close to the small river.

name: Hotel Batote
description: We ended up at this hotel hidden behind the maple trees (because the campspot in iOverlander at Patnitop is directly along the road and we couldn’t find another spot out of sight). Away from the busy touristy Patnitop. Friendly manager, basic clean rooms with hot showers, a small parking area and a cheap restaurant on site. Lots of monkeys around but they don’t bother you. One of the staff members helped us with a local simcard (Jio). Rooms start from 800 INR (the one we took on the picture).

name: NH109 7.5kms north of Gairsain
description:
Large flat area set 30m off the road amongst pine trees. Secluded but probably on police
 land. Visited by friendly police officer from the police camp who took ID details. Stayed 2 nights and had two children visit. Phone but no Data signal on Vodafone.

name: near Nainital
description: Secluded grassy area beside track to an ashram. Only suitable for small campers - up to Landcruiser size. No facilities. One or two cars / motorbikes passed but nobody bothered us. Intermittent data on Vodafone.

name: Track near New Tehri
description: Parked beside a track through pine woodland near New Tehri. A few people walked past in the evening and morning but we were ignored. OK for overnight stop - peaceful, cool, mobile and data signal on Vodafone.

name: the real end of the road
description:
There is a dam here and this is the real end of the road. The drive up here is realy spectacular.
The camping is not great just some spots on the sidw of thw road. But pretty quiet.
If you cross the dam you can walk to malana or there is another village more upstream.
Beautiful hiking between weed fields

name: riverbed
description:
Camping on the riverbed. But just next to the road. Not a very nice place but the best i found close to Vashist.
On the road there is a drinking water tap. And its 50m from the river.
The owner of the ground came to say hallo and that it was no problem to stay here.
Its a 20 min uphill to the Vashist hotspring.

name: Sagnam campsite - Pin Valley National Park - Spiti
description:
Camp ground by river side.
Village association charges rs 100/- per tent.
Very windy.

name: Ten Degrees Off
description:
This private property has been host parking for overlanders and camping for two tents at a time.. Access to water, restrooms are available. The property is surrounded by forest with solar power fencing to keep wild animals away. People who own the place also live on the property.

please communicate couple days before on Facebook or email

name: Rajendra Toyota
description: We just drove to this place with our land cruiser  from ‘94 for a service check up. Although they didnt have many spare parts for an old Landcruiser they delivered great service as we had most of the spare parts with us. They even offered us free lunch and chai! And great English speaking staff! Highly recommended!

name: Hotel Royal Inn
description: Very nice hotel with rain shower with hot water! Safe parking available on big grass court. We paid 1300rupees for a double room incl breakfast (booked the room online as this was much cheaper than booking a room at the hotel). Maybe if you ask it is even allowed to camp on the grass court. Very friendly staff!

name: Tourist Village Hotel
description:
NO CAMPING OR RVs. 

Great place with nice parking and green surroundings. . We had some chai and dinner in the restaurant in return:)

name: Hotel SB Castle Hotel
description: We could sleep in our car on the secured parking of the hotel for free. Western toilet was available inside the hotel 24/7. A bit noisy because of traffic but it is of course India, just bring your earpluggs;)

name: Hotel Tridev
description: Nice hotel with secure parking spot available in front of the hotel. We paid 3400 rupees for a double room incl breakfast so not the cheapest but comfortable room.

name: Hotel Suyash Palace
description: Found this place to sleep on our way to the Nepal border. It is the only hotel in town which allowes foreigners to stay. Sleeping in the car is only allowed if you book a room so we booked the cheapest room (1400rupees). The rooms were smelly but the shower was good so we used the shower and toilet and camped on the parking lot of the hotel. Also ok restaurant in the hotel. Would not recommend this place but if you need a break from a long day driving it is ok.

name: by Yunam River
description: flat, grassland set away from the road, though visible from it. very peaceful location with great scenery around. No phone signal. No facilities. Accessed via small track off the road at 32^53'59.98" 77^33'12.26"

name: Spiti River
description: Large flat area above the Spiti River well away from any habitation. You can get well away from the road with spectacular views along the river. Some fantastic eroded rock structures. Very quiet, only a few cars passed along the road and no one bothered us, just a few toots of the horn and a wave.

name: Chandratal Lake
description: flat gravel area adjacent to the track and away from the tented camps. OK for overnight stop, but all traffic to and from the lake passes close by.

name: Perfect overlanding Hotel “100 Petals”
description:
Ideal place for overlanders - superb hotel, amazing mountain views, great food and most importantly - an owner who is a biker and runs motorcycle tours in Sikkim. 

Karma will be able to help you with any issues you may have, related to bikes or cars, mechanical, practical, advising route, places to see in Sikkim, helping with permits, etc. 
The most hospitable, welcoming and friendly person we met so far on our journey. His other venture Ride Sikkim takes him regularly to the farthest corners of Sikkim, so he’s the person to show you around. 

Gangtok is really a very busy, congested town with no place to park your van freely. Here we found peace and could relax for couple of days, with easy parking and great company every night. Exchange travel stories, get advice and just enjoy this place. 

From 1 night we extended to 1 week, relaxing and taking a motorcycle trip to Dzongu valley, staying with and learning about the indigenous Lepcha people, fighting to sustain their way of life connected to nature, and opposing constructions of dams (power plants) in the area. 

Take some time and enjoy this mysterious region of the Kingdom of Sikkim, our most favourite state in the whole of India.

name: Quite riverside
description:
Nice accesible place from the road, just 20km away to Myanmar border. River, fire and quite athmosfere guaranteed. Have fun. you can go down to the river or stay 15meters above. 

the intersection to the main road is at thr right side after the bridge going to Myanmar.

4g aviable

name: Pangi Road near Rekong Peo
description: Good overnight stop on wide sandy area beside the road between villages. Local traffic morning and evening but all friendly. Useful for stop-over to get inner line permit for Spiti Valley in Rekong Peo, an unspoilt locals town. Stunning view across the valley to the Kailash Group of mountains.

name: near Youlkam
description: set 100m away from the road and partially hidden in semi sheltered position on hard gravel ground with fantastic views up the valley. very quiet as very little traffic. no signal.

name: 20kms above Shorgole
description: Flat location 100m off the road along a small track set high above the valley with fabulous views to Pillar Pass in the distance. Windy when we were there but exceptionally quiet, just a few voices from the village below.

name: Kinnaur Valley permits
description: You need a permit for the Kinnaur valley. When coming from Shimla, this is where you get it. The office is in the town of Rekong Peo. It takes around one hour to do it. Nowadays a travel Agency has to do it for you. "The Monk Travels" is the closest and they also have another office next door to deputy office. Only the passport is required, forms, pictures, etc. they do on spot. Office hours are from 10am to 5pm.

name: Inner line permit checkpoint for Kinnaur valley
description: Friendly military checkpoint with basic English speakers staff will record your permit data.

name: Rhotang Pass Checkpoint
description: Flattish Area just below the checkpoint. We stayed, as the pass is closed to traffic on a Tuesday. The checkpoint staff are very friendly and we were viewed by many other people who arrived not realizing the pass was closed, but were not bothered by them. A peaceful night but the traffic for the pass started early. Water and toilet available at the checkpoint.

name: shanti stupa
description:
The parking of the shanti stupa.
Realy quite. Not a lot of people during the day
There is water and a toilet at the stupa but the gate closes at night
Great view

name: Samdo police checkpost
description: Inner line. permit checkpost and vehicle registration.

name: Valley wild camping
description: Green flat ground available with some trees for shade. Clear water available if you continue following the car path: the stream is between the road and the big river. Very calm, it's visible from the road but nobody bother us. We stayed two nights. The entry is from the main road, a descending steep dirt road.

name: Hotel Swastideepa
description: Good roadside hotel to or from Calcutta. Clean, good food and good staff. 700 for a double room. We paid only 50 pp for dinner. Secure parking. You could even ask to sleep in the car. There is a toilet outside. Little English but enough to communicate.

name: Big open field somewhere in the city
description: Big open field in front of the OYO flagship BBD hotel where foreign people not allowed to sleep. For a city quiet at night. Just for the night not more than that

name: Simcard
description: Here you can get your Airtel simcard, for a foreigner It’s hard to get a simcard because they can’t write down your address details in the registration fields. At this place they managed it.

name: Camp in the rocks, 5kms from Khangral
description: Just from the main road you will find an dirty gravel road in to the mountains. Next to a small dry river. It’s quiet and nobody around you. It’s a windy area but you can find some shelter

name: Nearby Tso Kar Lake in the valley
description: You can camp in the valley nearby the quiet main road . There is a dirty road from the main road in to the valley. No traffic at night on the main road, so it’s a good spot to spend the night. At daytime it’s hot. there is no shelter.

name: Lake side
description:
Open grass next to the lake.
Also next to a forest.
Very beautiful and quiet.
There is no running water.
The road up here is steep and narrow. But good.
Except the last 200m is a dirt track that is not used by cars a lot.

name: Umrat Beach car park
description: Large concrete car park by the sea. On a Sunday evening lots of locals here till dark, then very quiet. The local police visited at dusk, asked how long we were staying and gave us their phone number if we needed help. Quiet night but windy. Good for an overnight between Mumbai and Udaipur.

name: Yes Please Guesthouse
description: Backpacker guesthouse with big parking directly in front of the building. The guesthouse is in the center of Old Manali, surrounded by Reggae bars and restaurants. Staff and owner are very friendly. 500 rp/room. WiFi is available from the surrounding bars and restaurants. 4G Airtel working very well.

name: Sandy's Homestay
description: Sandy's Home stay is a 4 bedroom beautiful, quaint and peaceful home stay. With Ample and safe parking, very friendly and helpful hosts. It is located in a very central location with easy access to most parts of the town with good connectivity.

name: Hotel 49
description:
perfect hotel, 1000 rupees per night for large spotless room with aircon, TV, powerful hot shower etc. parking spaces in car park which you can see from your room, and they have 24hr security guard.

they can arrange a car to take you to the wagah border ceremony, wait and bring you back for 1300 rupees, or rickshaw to golden temple, 60 rupees.

they do food here but it's not amazing, good place to go is La Roma Pizzaria, 100 rupees in a taxi. 

300 rupees more than camping at mrs bandhari, no competition

name: Happy Place
description:
Private guesthouse with very secure motorbike or car parking. Centrally located to mechanic and KTM and RE service shops.
Friendly host who is very knowledgeable about the region and can suggests good routes, parks and river cruises.
Breakfast included and for small fee laundry can be done too.
Rooms have a/c and are clean and tidy.

name: Behind Naygo Dwar Dhaba
description:
Decent overnight stop in the backyard of Naygo Dwar Dhaba in Nako. Just ask if you can put up your tent in their backyard. Good spot if you've been held up in Peckong Reo with the permit and blasting on the highway. 
Paid 250 Rupees and could use the simple bathroom facilities. Nice view over the valley can be a bit windy though. Not very confined as well but nobody bothered us at all. Very nice food at the restaurant.

name: Plateau above Highway
description:
Camping on a plateau just above the highway, trucks will probably see you but cars and bikes won't. Beautiful scenery.
Coming from Manali you will see the ramp up on the right side.
Good distance from Keylong.

name: Bharat petroleum
description: bharat petroleum all women petrol pump. This place has only 2 petrol pumps with high 97 octain pertrol. Free air for car. Also washroom and water for drinking. Best petrol pump in Kolkata. There's also a shopping mall attached with the pump. Located near command hospital Kolkata or see map.

name: Bidhan bike shop
description:
Bidhan Ghosh bike repair shop is best in Kolkata area. all kind of bike repair. honest person. very helpful. animal lover too. he is few novice staff too. 
contact : +91 70039 91330
call him before going to shop 9am to 9pm,  reference:  Anjan Karate r.s.s

name: Whaga border
description: Pakistan-India took us an hour and ten minutes. We arrived at 11:30am. Pretty straight forward, it’s a big border but everyone tells you where to go. More or less completely empty as very few locals cross it - it was a bit strange being the only vehicle there! Carnet needs to be stamped when leaving Pakistan and when entering India. On the Pakistan side we changed dollars for Indian rupees at a better than the market rate (we made money!). This border closes every day at some point in the afternoon (not sure exactly what time but it was closed at 4:30 when we went back a few days later for the ceremony) so don’t get there too late - also worth going to view the closing ceremony that happens each night if you can, it’s brilliant!

name: Mall of Amritsar
description: Big modern shopping mall with lots of western (and British) brands - H&M, forever 21, Skechers, Marks & Spencer’s, The Body Shop, Holland & Barrett and more. In the basement is a large supermarket called Reliance Smart. Well stocked - dried goods, fruit, veg, dairy. Couldn’t see a bakery but it said it had one. Western brands. There is an underground car park which costs 30 rupees and has a 2.3m height restriction. We are taller than that so just parked to the side of the mall (within the complex) to the left of where you go into the car park. We didn’t pay for this.

name: Toyota service center
description: They could not touch our car, because the computer system wouldn’t accept foreign registration plates.. but they can sell you stuff that you might not get in Nepal, like our cooling liquid.

name: Nutz Backpackers hostel
description: Great place. Very clean. Airconditioned. Dorms 280 rp, private room 1000 rp. Bicycle can be stored safely in the storage room of the shop next doors

name: Shree Durgiana Tirath - Hindu mini golden temple
description: Hindu and smaller version of the golden temple. Free shoe storage to the left of the main gold domed gates. Interesting walk here from golden temple.

name: Rock Garden
description: 25 acre art installation mainly consisting of rock, concrete and porcelain. Similar style to Gaudi in Spain. Well worth a visit, one of the most interesting things we’ve seen on our trip! We spent a few hours here, on a nice cool day you could easily spend most of the day here. 20 rupees to park a car, 30 rupees per person for entry. Prices on signs, so can’t be ripped off. Open 9-6:30/7:30 winter/summer.

name: Truck stop before Highway King
description: Quiet truck stop (apart from road noise!). We weren't disturbed. There is a car focused Highway King services about 100m further up highway with usual restaurants and better than average washrooms/toilets. It is possible to visit Highway King first and drive against the flow of traffic on the service road to get back to the truck stop.

name: Shaarma Guesthouse
description: Nice and very clean rooms with hot water (bucket shower) and a fan. Nice view and friendly owner. 600 rupee for the room.

name: Bedweiser Hostel
description: Cheap hostel, fairly clean, serves food. We paid 220 per person for a dorm with A/C that had an en-suite bathroom. Private rooms available for 1000. 30 rupees for toilet paper and 30 rupees for a bath towel - we used our own. Decent WiFi. Open balcony/cafe/common room area on the top floor. There is a parking space (just about big enough for us to squeeze into in our Land Rover Discovery) on the street in front of the hostel. Parking not ideal but unless you can pay for a 4* hotel, there aren’t really any places with secure parking close to the Taj Mahal. 15 minute walk to Taj Mahal. In the morning when we checked on the car there was a mark on the door from where a bike must have fallen over onto the car - the price to pay for a cheap hostel with only on street parking!

name: Hotel Kinnaur villa
description:
Parked in the car park of this hotel. It's flat but up a steep slope with overhead clearance not suitable for tall vehicles (over 3.2m) 
Great views across the mountains, very peaceful, and friendly hotel staff let us use the toilets in their reception. 
There is Airtel 4G here.

name: Monastery Car Park
description: Appears to double as main parking for Nako. Nominal fee/donation to monks for parking. Large flat area. BSNL mobile signal (occasionally) only. Parking is suitable for big rigs... Access roads may not be or be difficult... hence have tagged as not suitable however if you have driven to here you should have an idea of which village roads can be navigated by your vehicle

name: Riverside
description: Camping by River outside Kaza. INR 100 entrance for own vehicle. 300 for own tent. No facilities, but quiet with friendly people.

name: Grassy Area
description: Wild Camp with view of Key Monastery. Uncultivated flat grass area of main road.  Away from village. We weren't disturbed. Great view of monastery. Overlooking Spiti River.

name: Near Patsio
description: Good stop before tackling passes going North. Flat area near rest house (not working). Little noisy with trucks crossing old bridge during night. Hopefully new bridge will be completed soon and improve situation. No mobile service on any network

name: parmath niketan ashram
description:
yoga ashram next to the Ganges. 1000 rupees per night. including two free yoga classes a day. 6.30 am and 4.30pm.
also very cheap canteen. 50 rupee breakfast. 80 rupee dinner.

name: Ansu guest house
description: Ansu guest house is close to all temples and tourist places but just far way enough to still be peaceful at night. beautiful front garden to sit out in at night time.

name: Campsites and Cabins
description: you will find here campsites, cabins and tents where you can also sleep. there is one restaurant as well but most accomodations have dinner. electricity only works few hours and no internet

name: T.Norboo Auto-Engineering Works
description: Complement mechanic for clutch, brakes etc. on older vehicles. 5 or 6 other workshops in compound working on small cars to trucks.

name: OYO 44525 Yo-yee Travellers Inn
description: Nice OYO hotel on the NH127B road. There are not many options on this road and the place is surprisingly good. Clean double room with hot shower and really fast wifi. Street is a bit noisy however. Starting price was 1’800 rupees but we paid 1’000 including breakfast (check OYO’s website price for negotiation). The road from Dudhnai is beautiful, in really good condition with almost no traffic (which is priceless in India). There is no parking amenities available, just street parking. Small restaurant and ATM available in walking distance.

name: Near to Dar Village
description: There’s nowhere wide enough or flat enough to park up in the village so we made do with the corner of this bend! You could also try the bottom of the hill near the police post - it was already dark so we didn’t venture further up the hill.

name: Flat camping area near Alchi
description: The coordinates are for the entry point from the road to Alchi. Follow the tracks up to a large flat area suitable for all types of vehicles and with flat areas to park. Not visible from the road and with a view back to the villages near the highway.

name: Rotang pass permit
description:
If you come from Manali you need a permit for the Rohtang pass. 
If you try to do it online it is not possible with a vehicle out of India. So a offline permission is necessary. We changed in the online form the numberplate until it was correct 
You only can do it offline only in Manali 

The website for the permission is: rohtangpermits.nic.in

They charged 50 rupee

name: Forest Camp
description:
Nice and quiet spot. 
Less traffic on the little gravel road, nobody bothered us. Very quiet at night!
With car it isn’t possible to come up here, but about 100m back there is a little "parking“ lot for cars. You can sleep and camp there as well. 
We chose this place because there is a water spring. 
4G aviable with Airtel.

name: Kor Shongthait Homestay
description: Basic home stay with a dorm. Bathroom in the dorm is clean and has hot water! 300 rupees for a night.

name: Stupa below Hemis
description: Car park beside Stupa below Hemis Monastery. Quiet spot at this time of year even though on main route to Hemis. Relatively flat tarmac parking area. Great Airtel 4G.

name: Diskit gompa car park
description: Huge flat at car park at diskit gompa. Monks were fine with us overnighting here and it was quiet and peaceful. Could be bathrooms and restaurant in season but everything was closed when we were here.

name: Abandoned Station near Shyok River
description: An abandoned military or BRO site. Flat areas, easy to park up behind buildings so shielded from road. Quiet spot, few curious and smiley people in the morning.

name: Road to Darbuk
description:
A small gravel track off the road from Diskit to Darbuk, sheltered by bushes and leading to a slightly raised stony area. Flat and quiet place to spend the night. 

We were disturbed briefly by some very polite gentlemen with excellent English around 9pm. They wanted access to the stony area and insisted all lights and engines were turned off!!

name: Padma Restaurant, Pang
description: Dhaba with good food and large parking area set back from road. Popular with bikers and trucks. There are other Dhabas in the vicinity to choose from but they are immediately adjacent to road.

name: Wide open calm space
description:
Lots of possibilities for wildcamping. No people around. Calm. Beautiful. 4G. 
Reachable by a very small dirt road from the road to a football field. Keep following the path behind the football field.

name: Assam/Manipur checkpoint
description: Checkpoint between Assam and Manipur’s states. You need to go in two different offices (one for Assam one for Manipur), show your passport and fill a form.

name: Checkpoint
description: Military guys ask for name, vehicle number and destination.

name: Bharat petroleum
description: Petrol station with petrol and diesel available.

name: Uclean Laundry
description: Full services laundry service. Cleaning and drying with machines. Good and cheap. Dry and fold is 50 Rs/kg plus taxes. Normal service is next day ready but you can discuss with them if you are on a hurry. Open from 9am to 9pm.

name: Spring field apartment
description: We can rent more than a month or 2 weeks.  We stayed here for two weeks.  Cheap and quiet.

name: Catamaran Cafe
description: Nice restaurant overlooking the ocean. Affordable and delicious local and Western food. Free wifi (just ask for password). Lots of parking on empty lot next door.

name: Government Tourist Home
description: Rooms are quiet and clean with fan and a.c.. Autopark guarded. Access easy. Restaurant. But wifi only at the reception.

name: Salt Lake
description: Salt Lake approx 70km north of Bikaner. On outskirts of small town. Few visitors in evening and morning. Even more geese visiting. Take usual precautions driving on salt flats. Also check for dead animals in vicinity before parking up. Road and railway traffic can be heard at night.

name: Checkpoint
description: Checkpoint on the way to/from Myanmar. They just ask for passport.

name: Checkpoint
description: Checkpoint on the way to/from Myanmar. They just ask for passport.

name: Checkpoint and gate
description: Checkpoint on the way to/from Myanmar. They just ask for passport. The gate is open from 6am to 6pm.

name: Forest side-road on the way to Ziro
description:
Small side-road just off the main road. Since the main road passes a few meters above it’s enough to not being discovered in the morning ;)
Though you might hear passing vehicles.

name: Tawang Monastery
description:
Great spot at the end of the small road leading to Tawang Monastery.

We arrived after sunset, very quiet and great view.

Before sunset, between 4 and 5am, the morning prayers start. Feel free to join inside. Around 6:30am the young monchs finished and went for breakfast. Afterwards they all came out for prayers.

No one is intrusive around here, very calm and relaxing area.

name: Deur Kothar
description: Deur Kothar is a 2000 year old Buddhist Stupa location that has a very beautiful country side backroads approach. It overlooks the valley in the Sohagi hills.

name: Sudip Homestay
description: At Dalim Busty, Sudip Homestay is a homestay, a private home, where travellers can put up. There are 3 rooms available each of which can accommodate up to 5 adults. Rent starts from ₹1200/- per person per day including breakfast, lunch and dinner. However, as of 27th October, 2019 there is no cell reception here save and except BSNL. The owner Deo Prakash Rai and his family members are very friendly and amiable. There is a view point behind the property. There is a waterfall and remains of an old fort some three kilometer long trek away. Overall a very quiet and peaceful place.

name: Hotel City Point
description: Decent restaurant with large parking area. Also had guesthouse but we didn’t use facilities as we stayed in our vehicle. Inexplicably they started blasting music at 7am despite all being relatively quiet the previous evening).

name: meadow next to parking
description: 50 Rp for parking with official receipt. we stayed here for 4 days and nights. silent AT night. nice sourrounding with Buddhist monasteries and lots of eating places in walking distance. good atmosphäre

name: Rest between Tawang/Bomdila and Guwahati
description:
Quiet spot just off the main road after passing Bomdila on the way from Tawang to Guwahati.

A few cows spent a visit in the morning. 

Might be tight for big rigs to u-turn. Land Cruiser was fine.

name: Free parking place Jodhpur
description: As it was really difficult to find a convenient place for our big rig to stay for the night (we’ve been sent away very unfriendly from several places), we finally ended on this parking lot. Not the most romantic spot, but absolutely ok. No bothering except the normal “selfie, selfie”, night was quiet even it was Divali. Shops nearby, entrance to a temple in front, where is also tap water (and probably toilet?) during daytime.

name: Nice spot close to Highway/ Stone factory
description: Really nice and quiet spot near to the Highway. In the middle of cactus plants and flat grassy area. Lots of birds. No rubbish!! Close to a very smal lake where local women do their laundry and people take water from. There is a stone factory nearby - so not sure if it’s more busy and louder if they are working. We stayed here during festival days. Some locals coming, just curious. Got some milk.

name: Shanti the peace Restaurant
description:
This restaurant is in the fort with an amazing view and great great food! 
The prices are cheaper than in the most other restaurants around here! It’s a family restaurant with top service and totally clean toilets! 
We really loved it! 
Enjoy and chill! It’s amazing!

name: South of Salt Desert Wild Camp
description:
We didn’t stop at the salt desert wild camp further north as it was a major public holiday and extremely busy on the track over the salt lake, which had also not dried out well as monsoon was late this year. Found an innocent looking clearing between cultivated land and hidden from road. Some locals approached after an hour and after usual pleasantries agreed we could stay, but suggested we move 1km further down the track as it “may not be safe” we thought this was just our embarrassing lack of Hindi/Gujarati resulting in something being lost in translation and over caution on their part. These nice gentlemen did insist I take their phone number in case of problem. About an hour later some different men passed by without stopping and then came back 5 mins later with sticks and more man to insist we move on. They did know the first group of men and spoke to them by phone. Seems we inadvertently got caught up in a neighbourly land dispute. Most of the second group of men were ok when spoken to calmly. However one was a little unhinged and overtly threatening me and the vehicle with the large sticks men like to carry after dark in this state. 

They did suggest we could park 2km away and followed us to show location but the trust was broken due to this one individual (who had clearly got hold of some illicit alcohol in this dry state). Thus we drove back to highway and found a Dhaba.

name: 33 Indian dishes in one Thali
description:
This is the best stop to have lunch or dinner! 

We ordered one thali for 130 Rupee and we got all you can eat with 33 different dishes! And every dish was very delicious! We were satisfied!

It is great, if you want to learn the indian kitchen. 

Look at the pictures. It’s absolutely amazing. The best Thali in India!

name: The Grand Anas
description: Roadside Dhaba catering to trucks and cars. Restaurant clean, good value and didn’t hold back on the spice. Not so busy, therefore not too much noise/disturbance but enough other customers/trucks stopped overnight to be comfortable that it wasn’t too isolated. Usual highway traffic and the odd truck arriving/leaving in the early hours of the morning. Vodafone/Airtel 4G signals available.

name: a place for one night.
description: if you are in need of a place for the night, is is on of the more or less rare opportunities. because most of the Land here is farmland or near villages

name: Losar
description: this is a very interresting town. Nice  People and many havelis. people show you around. very clean for an indien town.

name: good place, when there is Water in the lake
description: very big area with trees and bushes. Some People passing by, but no one bothert us. we saw 2 Antilopes as well. very silent at night.

name: Zostel Alleppey
description: Hostel across the road from the beach with parking. Rooftop and ground floor common areas. Clean dorms and private rooms. Hot water. Free wifi. Helpful staff. Small affordable cafe for breakfast lunch and dinner on site and close to bigger restaurants.

name: Aguanda Fort
description: Old Fort and lighthouse with beautiful view of the coast. Heaps of parking up the hill. 300 Rs entry for foreigners. 25 Rs for locals.

name: Indian Immigration & Customs
description: The immigration and customs on Indian side. Note that the border opens at 6, but the immigration &customs office is completely deserted until 7:30. So plan the crossing and Myanmar arrangements accordingly.

name: Old Port Park
description: Easy access, quiet and guarded (150 INR/d). Near of beach and center of the city.

name: Vijay Villa
description: Wonderful boutique hotel. They were happy for us to park in the grounds without charge (we did have dinner and breakfast at the hotel). They kindly provided access to bathroom facilities in an unused guest room and in general were kind, caring, and attentive hosts. It is out of town up an unassuming road. If coming from Palitana town, take the more direct looking route even if the GPS is suggesting an alternate route that is classified as major (the latter is not suitable for big/tall rigs). When you get close to the hotel there are signs to follow rather than GPS. Lane is narrow and overgrown but we got our 3.2m tall vehicle down it albeit scraping a lot of branches on side and roof. We were following the owner of the hotel who had randomly passed us on the road in, so this was the best route! Food was excellent. Unfortunately mobile internet signal currently poor on all networks.

name: Backpacker Panda
description:
Nice hostel at the end of the road. Hard to find. Follow the signs to Apple Country. Ride to the front door of Apple Country and then you will see a small road on the right side. Just follow that road, keep right.
Very helpful owner and staff. There are double rooms and dorm rooms. Free WiFi. Free parking in front of hostel. Simple breakfast, lunch and dinner available.

name: Hotel All Orchha View
description: Not bad hotel, quiet location. parking for motorbikes and car park next door. 600 rupees a night. We had drinks and a meal on the roof with the owners.

name: Banaras Hostel
description: Brand new hostel in quiet location near Assi Ghat. Air-conditioned dorm rooms, super clean ensuite and communal areas. Shared kitchen with stove and fridge. Free filtered water. Secure parking for up to 4 Motorbikes. Very helpful owner, Raghavendra can organise mechanic for basic service. Prices fluctuate depending on season and festival times. I got dorm room to myself for 350 rupees.

name: M/S Bodoland Dhaba
description: Oh...my...god...Amazing! Super nice restaurant on the highway. Has an amazing meal. But be warned...The portions are enormous :)

name: Madpackers Hostel
description: Nice hostel quiet and relatively save parking for motorcycle (not cars). Dorm and double private rooms for 800 rupees per person. Rooms are small but clean with western toilets and showers. A little bit tricky to find, but the last meters are good sign posted and you can ask the people.

name: Emergency Camp
description: Semi secluded area next to the road. Judging by the trash, it's popular. Good for a night if you get stuck. like I did. small village 5 mins down the road for supplies.

name: Diamond Foodway
description: Nice Hotel by the Side of the road. Very good Food in the restaurant. parking available, room with AC and double bed with clean sheets and towels and hot water. I paid 800rupies. I told the owner about my motorcycle travel and he came to my room in the evening to give me back the money I paid for the room to support me. He likes motorcycles. He is speaking English very well.

name: Krang Suri Waterfall: Big, quiet parking
description: Follow the signs to Krang Suri Waterfall. There is a big, green parking on a hill. You have to pay 30 rupies and you get a quiet campspot, free toilets and a free shower. There is a small restaurant where we ate a thali for 100 rupies.

name: whispring pine
description: Nice little hotel. Some rooms with great views. Hot water. 1500 for 3 persons. Quite safe parking for motorcycles.

name: Hotel Amaravati
description: Fairly nice clean hotel. Parking is available in the front and at the side of the hotel. We were told it was 24 hour security but we’re not sure if this was actually the case. Variety of rooms at different prices. We stayed in the cheapest (which had no AC but did have a bathroom and was fine) for 980 (1 night, 2 people, no breakfast). Good speed WiFi and very hot showers! Photo of price list for the different room types.

name: Illiterati books and coffee
description: Excellent coffee and cakes. Worth the trek to this chill oasis from the more hectic centre of Macleod Ganj

name: Reliance Petrol Station
description: There is a closed Dhaba behind petrol station with large flat parking area. We stopped for a rest in the middle of the day and where approached by a friendly guard, who was keen to stress that we could stay overnight and that there were two guards to cover day/night shift. From what we could tell plans are to reopen restaurant sometime in 2020.

name: Jungle Camp at Lake Ummiam
description:
Huge flat space in the middle of the jungle. Take the old Shillong - Guwahati road, which leads into the lake.

When we were there no other cars were there and the night was very calm. 

No village or locals around.
Full Airtel and Vodafone 4G connection.

name: Deur Kothar
description: This is the caves and cliff edges in Deur Kothar.

name: Grassy area
description:
Grassy area at little lake . Next to the road is a little grassy area. 
It was simple with our motorbikes but with car it might be a bit difficult 
But with 4x4 it should be no problem. 

Nobody bothered us or came to us to say hello. 
Very quiet .
You Can hear the road but we didn’t care.

Airtel 4G average network connection.

name: Khana kázání
description: Very good restaurant, friendly owner, delicious food

name: Near Police Station
description:
We had been parked a few km away at an event parking area near the cricket stadium. After all cars had left police got nervous about us staying there (even though several police had earlier confirmed we could park until morning). They first suggested that we move beside the security hut at entrance, which we did but later came back too ask us to follow them to the nearest station where we could park outside and be safe. Clearly the flurry of phone calls had resulted in superiors who weren’t on the ground being spoken to who were being super cautious and concerned for our safety. Anyway, was quiet place to park with buildings shielding us from highway noise. Not disturbed until morning when a couple of very young curious kids tried doors. 

Given the concern for traveler welfare (police from 3 stations and the control room got involved in getting us to move to this place) would expect any other overlander could just turn up here and park after seeking token permission. 

No other facilities.

name: Grassland with trees
description: A big area with many many places like this. (See photo.) you are hidden from the road. on weekends many Picnickers.

name: Manipur checkpoint
description: A few hundred metres before these coordinates (when entering Manipur) there is a checkpoint where foreigners are checked. They fill in a form, ask how long/where you plan to stay and put a stamp in your passport.

name: Decathlon
description: Decathlon India. European products plus some indian - as cricket. Silent and clean atmosphere.

name: Pandav Caves
description: Free protected historical site. Ancient caves. Good view from the top. Lots of parking.

name: Pachmarhi Hill
description: Short hike up the hill. Incredible view of the surrounding hills and Pachmarhi bazar. Ideal at sunrise or sunset. Trail starts through houses and turns straight up the stairs built in the rock.

name: Entrance to Pachmarhi hill
description: Walk up to the mosque and continue on up the rock. Camping not permitted.

name: By the river
description: Multiple tracks from the main road leading to this spot. There is a height restriction of some fake concrete trees - about 3.5-4 metres. You can see the road/bridge, but it is quite far away. A few locals walked past us but unbelievably for India none did anything more than wave and say hello! There is a variety of potential places near the river but don’t get too close to the bank as it was quite unstable.

name: Matoshree Cafe & Resort
description: Small hotel with 5 or so rooms and restaurant. Only been operating a year and very informal. They kindly let us park in their large, flat, paved parking area without charge. Owner works in Dubai but place is family run.

name: Supermarket Jodhpur
description:
Reliance Smart Mall with a good choice of products, almost western style: vegetables, fruits, food, clothes... 
No alcohol and no meat.

name: Wildlife Guda Bishnoiyan
description: Pond with many birds, specially the demoissele cranes from October to March. Entrance fee 80 INR.

name: New Sagar Palace
description: Roadside Dhaba. Usual selection of food. Relaxed about parking overnight. Hasan, the 82 year old owner is quite a character. Little noisy as is a stop for interstate buses overnight. They were also using firecrackers to scare away stray dogs. Bit untidy/litter in vicinity.  Avoid Shiv Sagar a few hundred meters north. They were rude, refused parking. Turned lights off as we approached etc.

name: Raahi Hostel
description: Nice English-run hostel. We've paid 1200 for a room. Quiet and nice. Motorbikes not complete safe but better then in most other places. Highly recommended!

name: Parking in the Tibetan Colony
description: We parked in the Tibetan colony and slept in the vehicle.  The place is quiet and there is room for a lot of vehicles. people walking around the area but we had no problems. It is a good solution for those who are in Delhi and do not want to enter the city.  The colony is a really fun and peaceful place and there are many hostels, cafes and restaurants
