name: Chillout Guesthouse
description: Great Guesthouse with parking outside, good for cars, bikes and vans

name: restaurante parking
description:
next to the road, big parking.
we parked our van in here and had quiet night.
cars passing by once in a while but for us it was ok

name: Camel Charisma
description:
A non governmental organization (NGO) supporting the local people in keeping their camels under changing conditions. There is accomodation at this place, see their website. Usually there are are no camels right at this side.
Coming from Sadri, turn left at 25.16944, 73.489643.

name: Hotel Vacation
description: Good to reach, especially for vehicles, save parking. Rooms basic, but OK. 1200 for 3 persons.

name: Auks Farm
description:
Organized zimmer area with 3 expensive cabins, toilet and showers.
We stayed here for 1 night, used the wash room, slept in the car and enjoyed dinner and breakfast for 1000 NIR, the family is really nice but the price is a bit expensive and also won't be available every day because of other guests which stays in the cabins. It will be better to call them before and ask. Fine option if you'll get stuck at night and really want a shower.

name: Hotel safari
description: Not too far from the center, safe parking for motorbikes. Basic but clean, good value. 600 for 3 persons.

name: Punjab Racing Store (Motorcycles)
description:
Er. Amrinder Tej Singh (WhatsApp +91 93575 11007) is official distributor for motul, k&n, pirelli, etc. Good level of stock on hand. Anything he doesn't have for your moto maintenance he should be able to get with two weeks notice. Operating out of family home and
 plans to build a workshop next year. All the best Amrinder!

name: Nice Riverside
description: Follow the road and than off-road (easy) to get close to the river, close to the dam. Right under the pedestrian bridge. Don't get too close to the river because if they will close the dam at night the water will get higher. Beautiful spot for camping.

name: Night in the car
description:
We have stopped here at the gas station and asked if we can park and sleep here.
They agreed.
Some people came and tried to talk with us but most of them don't speak english.
They all were very friendly and tried to help us with water and food


nice place

name: a meadow for overnight stop
description: You can heare the highway but only a little bit. peaceful place, only some friendly shepherds come by.

name: S.Pandey & Company
description: International freight forwarder specialising in shipping vehicles. Goutam responses very quickly to all enquiries and queries. The office is based in Birla Brothers Building. Friendly staff who know what they are doing. I am shipping my motorbike with them.

name: OYO
description: If you need a stop between Agra and Varanasi, then this is a fair choice. 1400 for three persons, safe parking even for big vehicles.

name: Bosch garage
description: Very good garage, good prices and they speak good English here.

name: In the bushes
description:
Nice place to camp for the night on the way to Bengalor.
We just stop in the bushes, some Indians pass by, but nothing else.

name: Grover Zampa vineyards
description:
Great winery on the way to Bengalore.
It's a nice place to stop before the madness of the city

name: Sonam's homestay
description: A must visit place in Sikkim! just come... Thats actually a home stay with few rooms and dorms, cost 700 Rupees per night with 3 delicious meals. you can also sleep in the car for less and use the shared wash room. Sonam's family is just amazing, we felt like at home and didn't want to leave. There is an off-road from the lake to this location, a little bit difficult to pass but possible. You will not regret coming here...

name: RS Autotech
description: Tyre workshop accustomed to dealing with 4x4 vehicles. One of the best equipped tyre places we’ve seen in India. Rahul the owner is very knowledgeable and has great English.

name: Eve Resort
description: Small hotel/restaurant/bakery. Clean Rooms Rs 2,500 for a double B&B. Flat parking area beside restaurant but not too noisy at night. They also have parking area at rear. They should be flexible if you need parking only, as long as you’re using restaurant etc. They have had rigs stay for months so a time in wooded area at rear of property.  Ask for Clive Rodrigues the Manager. +91 86058 05613

name: Masala guest house
description:
Nice and cheap guest house with wide parking lot.
Said is the owner and he is very nice and will glad to help you

name: Laundry
description: Himmat Laundry. Good service within one day. Each piece of laundry is ironed. 150 Rupees per kilogramm.

name: You can stay at old overlander place again
description:
Again it  is possible to stay here. Still nice. To come to this place it  is best to go early morning, because there is a lot of traffic later. The road is a bit narrow , especially for big rigs. IT is also a good idea,  to bring a wooden stick for pushing up the deep hanging cables, except you habe a small car.
The place is now much less noisy as it  was in former years.

name: Mandir and bus rest stop
description: A small mandir with a huge flat car park. Empty long distance busses park up during the day then leave overnight to pick up the passengers so only a few bus drivers will come and chat. Not too much road noise.

name: MRF Musclezone
description: Well equipped tyre workshop that has the equipment to balance truck tyres. They also have alignment equipment that can cater for big rigs but weren’t quite sure how to put on settings manually as the software only had Indian trucks/buses preloaded... so we have that a miss.

name: UP Bihar family Dhaba.
description: More of a truck stop than family Dhaba. Didn’t try food. But large parking area. Quiet enough apart from usual selfie requests. Unfortunately woken very early by ‘guard’ requesting money for parking (rs100) and then an hour later with his mate requesting a selfie!

name: Near Garadia Mahadev Kota
description:
Grass land with some trees and plenty of space. Perfect for visiting Garadia Mahadev temple in morning. You can hear the highway but it is ok. It's next to a small road but no one seems to use it. 
No one bothered us.

name: BMW motorcycle workshop
description: The guys here got my alternator rebuilt! They are very kind and really looked after me. It wasn't cheap for India but that's BMW for you. The workshop is clean and well lit. They can also help with crates if you need to export from India...this is something that I wouldn't recommend but I had to do it.

name: Roots western style supermarket
description: not very big but has plenty of western products. toilet paper and bin bags

name: Indian Oil Fuel Station
description: Fuel Station. Bit rundown looking but parking area at back and nice staff. Shuts at 10pm. Quiet enough.

name: Koraput Sports ‘Stadium’
description: Small raised platform overlooking sports field and beside sports hostel. Activity stops and sunset as no floodlights. There is watchman looking after adjacent changing rooms. We stopped over weekend so was busy during the day as athletics competitions taking place and PA system on the go from 7am! Only disturbed by a few curious people in the evening. Good Airtel signal. Big rigs can fit here, if you can navigate either of the access roads (narrow and low wires, we managed with 3.2m height).

name: parking near the road
description: Right before the close village, big parking where the locals used to play soccer (as a local told us), some locals came to visit and were really nice, offered us toilet, showers and tea. Be carefull at night because there are leopards around so stay in the car after 9 PM and dont leave anything outside. Locals are super friendly..

name: aloobari - Lama Homestay
description: lovely home-stay! teaches how to make amazing local food that you'll eat for dinner. host has good English and is very nice. available locked parking. very comfortable.

name: sandy beach parking
description: An Indian campsite with big parking next to the sandy river beach. There are lots of people down next to the river (maybe only in weekends), so expect a lot of noise. Also some simple restaurants and kiosks. Not the best place for cars because of noise and trash all over, but the beach is quite nice and a legit place for tents.

name: Aahana Resort
description: small hotel close by the national park. rooms are basic and kind of clean, emphasys on the "kind of". they agreed to give us "local price" of 1400INR after starting of 2200. parking available - locked gate. food is paid seperatly. all in all pretty good as sleeping outside is not recomended  due to wildlife all around. tried to park somewhere and were kicked away by a ranger. anyway  owner is ok and SPEAKS ENGLISH.

name: indian Oil gas station
description: nice rest area with a huge parking. probably meant for trucks. with toilets, outdoor showers (cold), and running water. also there is sing for washing machine but didn't see it. is next to the highway but far enough. the staff was very friendly.

name: Ramachandi Beach Car Park
description: Not right by the beach. Large rectangular flat car park with a few stalls around. There is a car park closer to beach but it is smaller and busier. Seems to be a picnic spot where people rent cooking pots and gas cylinders from the stalls. Stalls all shutting up around 6pm and all closed by 8pm, thus a quiet night. Inexplicably stalls were setting up again at 6am (lots of banging pots and Indian rave music!) even though first day trippers didn’t arrive until after 9am.

name: KTM service center
description: Good head mechanic. We changed the oil seals of the front suspension of our Yamaha XT660 here.

name: Wild Leaf Guesthouse
description:
Nice little guesthouse, managed by very friendly Ansar, a good English speaking local. 
The small guest house has 4 double bedrooms, each with its own bathroom. The rooms are simple, quite big and nicely furnished, not overcrowded. The guesthouse is located a little bit set back from the hotels directly on the cliff, and because of that very quiet! 
Small(er) overlanders and bikes of course can park in the garden; you can pitch your tent around the house.
The rooms cost - depending on the season - about 800 Rupees. 
Ansar also cooks for his guests on request. He has spoiled us with four different freshly caught fish and crabs as well as other local specialities and fresh fruits.
Ansar is helpful with all questions and helps, no matter what you need.  
Yoga space also available.

Mobile +91 9995920886
E-Mail wildleafguesthouse@gmail.com

name: beside a lake, for 2 wheel vehicles only!
description: coming from Sadri in the direction to the Ranakpur Tempel, you see on the left side a sign and a yellow gate for safari ....just some meters before on the RIGHT side, you see a small track going down from the road. just follow this track and you will reach a "grassy", but little bit wet, area beside the lake. its absolutely beautiful here and you are not visible at all. some noises from the road. space for 2-3 tents.

name: Bush camp near road
description: After a long day drive we found this camp spot. As well in the evening as in the morning we did not see anybody. Some wild live around as antilope and birds. You can hear the road but it did not bother us.

name: fish Tali
description: very cheap and delicious food. especially the fish tali for 220 rupis ....it includes two peaces of fish. the veg.tali is also a very good portion for 100. nice owner. speaks english.

name: Bush camp near road
description: Okay place to stay if you on a transit. We marked the beginning of a dirt road. If you follow this you will find some options. Even a small lake with nice birds. Did not see anybody during our stay. There are roadworks in the area. Not sure how long this will be nature. You can here the train. Did not bother us during the night.

name: S.S. Automobiles
description: Very competent mechanic despite the tin-shed-look of their workshop. Recommended by many people. Just make sure the boss, Santosh, is taking a lead on any work.

name: Hoztel Jaipur
description:
Decent location, large parking area. Could fit at least a dozen motorbikes and maybe even 2-3 cars. Hoztel is clean and dorm beds are comfortable. 8 person dorm has poor shower. Breakfast available throughout the day and cold beers for sale at 200 rupees/can. 

Hoztel books all rooms through hostelworld.com, and for whatever reason they ONLY get their prices through that website. I showed up and they couldn’t tell me a price without checking that website. The prices on the website are always changing too, so they couldn’t give me a reliable number for one night in advance without checking.

name: Ko bar sit
description: Good mechanic. Repairs big bikes. We were here with our Yamaha XT660's

name: Our Lady of Lourdes Church
description: Parking in the garden of the church. Very quiet and secure camp. Toilets are available. Try to not arrive late at night. Father Sunil is a very friendly guy who lives there and doesn't mind letting you in and showing you where the toilets are. if you can't find him around you can send a WhatsApp. His number is +91 76793 93255

name: Magen Homestay
description: Homestay newly opened towards end of 2019. Rs3,500 for room for 4 with breakfast. Good room with separate sitting area. Rs500 for parking and breakfast for 4 people. When we insisted on parking only we were offered the room for 2,500. Really nice family, but still working their pricing out. Parking in their private compound. Size restriction is access to their street through a tight 90 degree bend with concrete walls either side. Large m is possible (5.6m length 3.2m height)

name: De Oriental Grand Hotel
description: Hotel with large flat car park behind hotel and away from road. No charge for parking/sleeping in vehicle. We did have dinner in hotel which was pricey but good food and generous portions.

name: Way to coal yard
description: Flat area opposite gateway to a village. Road is very quiet at night. No disturbance. Airtel 4G signal is available but slow.

name: Helsa Resort
description: Large flat areas for parking. We had dinner at ‘resort’. No charge for parking and sleeping in vehicle. Quiet secure place to spend night. airtel 4G coverage mostly ok.

name: Akash residency
description: very nice hotel. extra clean. friendly staff. we paid 900 roupies for 2 people. safe parking for bicycles

name: New Vasantashram
description: Very nice hostel, super clean and super cheap (400 Rs / pers in dorm : for Mumbai, this is incredible !). 3rd and 4th floor.

name: Longwa Village
description: Not so wild camping on flat area between chief’s hut and the Travellers Inn. We didn’t see the chief. Did take a guide for the afternoon from the Inn and confirmed with them it was OK to park there. Bonus fact, you can park your vehicle on the border so that you can sleep with your feet in India and head in Myanmar!

name: Women Development Center
description:
a quite spot underneath the tree passed the gate of the WDC. The sisters here run a program to educate poor women to save them from trafficking. 
sister Betsy asked us in the morning to give a motivational speech in front of the class. Her email address is betsyghy@gmail.com
If you come during daytime you can ask for permission in person.

name: Namdang House
description: Small guesthouse. Owner was happy for us to park in grounds without charge. Restaurant with usual fare available. We were able to refill our 20L drinking water with filter water etc.

name: Rupon Automobiles
description:
Multi-car/brand workshop with very good mechanics, cheap (2000 roupies a full day of qualified labour) and with spares available. We did A LOT of work on our Defender here (clutch change, electrical work, diesel heater repair, vacuum pump and starter servicing...) and it was very well done. They also have a body works and painting workshop. Best garage in the whole West Bengal and Sikkim according to many customers sometimes coming from far. Definitely a great place for a technical stop, lot of things available in Siliguri.
Open 9am-8pm - Contact Mrinal +91 99333 33999

name: ema laundry
description: very clean laundry. a bit hard to find on Google maps. if you go down the blue gate in the green fence on the right side of the road and ask for laundry you will find it. 80 rupees per kg for fast service. 24 hour. they also do delivery to hotel if needed

name: next to football field. dry season only
description: relative quite place in Imphal. park on the grass field next to their football pitch. during wet season the river covers this ground and just after the wet season it might not be cleared yet. very welcoming locals they brought wood, made us a campfire and offered their rice liquor. they also put up a fight for us when soldiers came around requesting us to leave. as it was not safe and they were responsible for us. after some discussion we told them we didn't want their protection and wanted to be left alone. we got inside the car and a little while later they left us alone.

name: Another Indian Oil stop
description: Unusual as by 6pm they’d shut up shop and turned all the floodlights out! Which meant a quiet night.

name: Enchanting Majuli
description: Public Ground outside a small guesthouse. There are two entrances. The first closely to the junction might not work for large vehicle. The second entrance to the field at the abandoned buildings is more accessible and a quieter spot to park. People at the guesthouse are helpful. We hired a couple of scooters there as getting around island with a larger vehicle is difficult and impossible in places with low wires.

name: Football Pitch by Tea Estate
description: Parked at end of football pitch near tea estate. Spoke to a few people who seemed to be attached to plantation. All perfectly friendly but were keen for us to move very early the next morning!

name: The Loft Hotel
description: Nice 3 star hotel with great staff and extremely secure parking. Clean rooms and hot shower. Good food and free breakfast.

name: Quiet place, near some field
description: Nice and quiet area a bit away from the  main road. some place for camp with tent or car with an access dirt road. I stay there for the night and saw nobody.

name: Hibu Tatu Homestay
description: Nice family Homestay. They can arrange Goode’s and home cooked food on request. Laundry service also available.  No WiFi or mobile data signal!

name: Passa Lath Resort
description: Small 6 room hotel with large flat parking area, restaurant etc. Very welcoming, no charge for parking (we did have breakfast)

name: Halatynrai Fooding and Lodging
description: We went to the OYO up the street also on iOverlander, but they said they were fully booked. We were directed here. The coordinates are approximate! Again it’s just down the street from the other hotel here on iOverlander. Owner was super helpful with our stay and also helping us with things we needed to do around town. If possible ask for the far room since it has an additional window. The power does turn on in this town until 4 and the other rooms are pitch black until then. No hot water but he gave us a big immersion rod to heat water for a shower. If there is gas there is a kitchen you can use to cook. You can bring the bicycles in off the street. No parking for vehicles.

name: next to church
description: a flat place next to a church. we were left alone all night. the road to it arround the back is a lot better than the steep road up in front. the toilets of the church are not locked so you can use them

name: Guesthouse run by family
description:
The rooms are rent by a lovely mother with two children. 

2 rooms outside and 1 room in the house. 

Double bed, Coldwater bucket shower and mosquitonet. 

Space for 3-4 motobikes in the yard
. 
Room for 600-700 rupees

name: Explore the real Mysore with Amju
description:
If you want to see the real life in Mysore give Amju a call. He also travels a lot himself and knows, what a real unique experience feels like! He will show you around in his TukTuk named „mon amour“ that he built with a lot of love and passion. Amju brings you to corners of the city, workshops and other shops you normally don’t find. We spent a perfect day with him. 
Call +91-9742979581

name: Aranya Tourist Lodge
description: Standard government lodge with flat parking, high roofed covered areas for parking also available. They can arrange jeeps to visit the park etc for the same fixed price as everywhere else. No charge for parking (we did use restaurant and arrange jeep hire through hotel)

name: O’coqueiro
description: Nice little restaurant. Delicious food, owners speak English. Shadow, green surroundings. Easygoing atmosphere.

name: 1.5 K lonely beach
description:
Coming from the main road you will go through a little village. Quite soon the road will become dirt road. Take the first dirt road wide enough for cars to the right. On google earth you should see Ahmedpur Mandvi Beach. This is where you will enter the beach. 4x4 needed to drive on the sand. Only accessible for smaller cars because of overhanging trees. 

Beautiful clean beach. Stretches for 1,5 k. Only saw a few people walking, some friendly waves where exchanged. View on the fort of Diu. Lovely spot!!

name: Forest rest house
description:
governement place where you can put the tent or van for FREE. 

The place is very safe (guards), staff super friendly.

name: Dipu Motor Works
description: Got leaf suspension repaired here. Heavy Truck workshop with lots of welding/bodywork/ chassis repair going on.

name: Treebo Blue Mountain Resort
description: Hotel with large flat car park beside property which was little used by guests. Follow the signs for blue mountain cottages (past first car park which has low wires). Bit of a random hotel, we did stay in room initially but then moved back into van and they were happy enough for us to stay on.

name: JK Steel Wheels-Bhartiya Tyre
description: One of the better tyre workshops in town. Good range of tyres available.

name: Ayush Hotel
description:
Basic rooms, but clean and cheap (500 rs double room).

Very friendly staff

name: Pune, near Osho Park
description: Just a stripe on the street. Place for at least two big rigs. We stayed there for three nights without any problems. It is a good, rich area, due to that a quite safe place. In the night it was rather quiet. It is situated next to the Osho Intl. Meditation Center and the Osho Teerth Park. Ten minutes walk to the ‚German Bakery‘. Good restaurants in the 7th Lane, about 1,2 km walking distance .

name: Parking by the Colva Beach, Goa
description: Parking place directly at the beach. At day crowded, at night empty and quiet. We stayed there for two nights without any problems. Police was there on second day while we were on the beach, but they only enjoyed the shadow of our car and disappeared after twenty minutes. Several restaurants and cafés are there around this place on the beach. They have simple European toilets and beach showers. One the parking place is a small bar where chilled mineral water is sold - 10 Rps/0,5 l.

name: Toribari Picnic Area
description: Big flat grassy area with a stream.  A bit dirty because of the picnics but Ok for a night or 2 near the city. Very convenient if you need to go to Rupon Workshop. Few cows and locals in the morning but quiet at night. River is not so clean but locals still wash themselves and the laundry as we did. NB: not possible to camp accross the river at the Google location of the picnic spot as this is a natural reserve with rangers. Could hear some elephants at night! ;)

name: Perfect place to rest in calm
description:
Hug park with trees. Easy to arrive and easy to entrance Big Vans and trucks. Rustic gate, not asfalted, just follow the concrete path still the dry River. The gate is open and the park is free. 

Very beautiful place close to Chandigar 5 km and close to the Sukut Wild Life  reserve.

name: Nandi Hills
description:
it's a place near to banglore, at a height of 1300mts, curve roads, forest area,old monument
tippu sultans Summer staying fort

name: The Annexe Homestay
description:
Booked through Air BnB this place is simple, clean and stylish. The price of the rooms is £12 per night. Both rooms have balconies and great views. The shower works and there is a small fridge in the room. There's a washing machine in the main house and a courtyard to hang stuff out. Had to park motorbike on the street which got covered in dust from construction work.
Probably the best place I've stayed in in India.
No WiFi but Vodafone worked very well from room. 
There is a shop where you can buy stuff just up the steps.

name: Reliance tankstation
description: At the back of this fuel station there is a restaurant (old en closed). Behind the restaurant you can park and sleep. We are on the way towards Goa and this is fine place for 1 night sleep. We ask they people from petrol station if we could sleep there and they where very relaxt.

name: Ferry Nimati(Jorhat)/Kamalabari(Majauli)
description: One way for 15 Rupees per person and further 700 Rupees per car. Per motorbike it's 30 Rupees. Could take our 2.4 ton van without any problems, but not sure, if vehicles with long wheel base will fit. Takes about 40 minutes.

name: Parking spot
description: Here you can leave your car. Every size. Prices in the picture. Location in the middle of the city.

name: Shiny hotel
description:
Nice small hotel. All you need to stay for some nights. I paid 850Rps for two nights. You can find cheaper hotels here. I saw one for 300 Single room per night.
The national park is not far away. There is a paid parking spot very close. There you can leave your vehicle.

name: Camp on old Road
description: It's just along the way to/from Yingkiong, situated on the old mountain road. Can't be seen from the new road. Access should be possible with 2WD also, as long you've got enough clearance. Nice views, very calm! The site itself is not too special, you'll need some time to find even grounds.

name: Big and hyde esplanade
description: Its a big esplanade very flat and easy to arrive, is a calm place. Good for Big trucs. In the country side. Not the most beautifull place but very usefull to spend the night.

name: River Bed
description: Some site on  the river bed of Siyom river. Should be accessible most time of the year, but anyways 4x4 is recommended. Many spots along the river bank.

name: campinglamping
description: Glamping site, but you can try to ask if you can sleep in your own tent. Not so cheap but very friendly staff, a campfire and delicious food.

name: Parking in Rajgir
description: Secure parking in the center of town; dirty but not noisy. 100 rupees for 24 hours. Gates close at night, but you can sleep in your camper. Convenient if you want to visit the temples and markets; good for one night.

name: Parking Area
description:
(See recent updates to location in nearby field) 
Big párking close to a kind of temple. There is nobody around here, nobody disturbed us. Is easy to walk to the Amber temple, but the parking is quiet and calm.

There are a lot of trees and little mountains around the place and it is very hidden from the main road. There is no noise of Cars or horns here. The parking is big enough for Big trucks. 

Good place to visit Amber. 15 km from the Jaipur centre.

name: JJ Cottage
description:
Good hotel with warm water. Very clean. Not in the city center of Munnar. But for fourty ruppies you can get into the city center. Here are also some restaurants.

They also offer full day or half day hikes. I paid 2000 for two nights and a full day hike.

name: Karma Temple Guest House
description: We stayed in the parking (no shade) at the back of this Tibetan temple. Paid 250 rupees per night to sleep in our camper, use the clean toilets and hot showers; basic rooms 500 rs., en suite 2500 rs. Clean and peaceful. Walking distance to Mahabhodi Temple.

name: Munsyari
description:
Field with a fantastic view towards the Panchachuli mountains. I was told this field is private property but that it’s ok to camp. Friendly people living across the road. Kids will come visit. Whole town will know you’re there, but all friendly. Toilets can be used at the petrol station. If the field is no longer accessible, the helipad at the top of the village could be another option. 
Munsyari town itself is nothing special. Mostly concrete buildings nowadays. Trash in the streams. But very friendly people and beautiful surroundings. Good place to relax or hike. Views are great and the air is fresh. Nice for short day-hikes, or serious multi-day ones. I was told there are hot springs at Mathkot. 
The road up is a beautiful drive and the lovely winding mountain road from/to Kapkot surprisingly quiet and very very nice.

name: Orange Roots
description: Go here, pay a very reasonable amount of money, and receive unlimited delicious vegetarian food, Thali style. Run entirely by women.

name: Nice spot in a pine trees forest
description: Follow the left path going in the forest from the main road, the forest is hilly, but go on for more o less 500m, you will find some flat space on the side of the path. We camped here for one night, very quiet, no problem at all. In the morning, friendly locals past by saying they were going to hunt with stone catapult. Nice spot.

name: Hippie Hill - Kasar Devi
description:
Large field at the top of a hill at the north end of the Kasar Devi ridge with beautiful sunrise views to the Himalayas. Locals all pointed to this location when I asked for camping. No facilities. Some kids will hang out here also. 
The small ridge of Kasar Devi a.k.a. Crank’s Ridge a.k.a. Hippie Hill was a stop on the hippie trail once upon a time. Bob Dylan and George Harrison hung out here. It’s still very peaceful and shanti with plenty of homestays and some restaurants and cafes on the path over the crest of the ridge. Very laid back locals and easygoing vibe. Easy to linger. 
Kasar Kitchen on the main road just down from the camping hill is a nice place and owner Raju can help you with anything.

name: Siikhe Lake Camping
description: Camping at lake, very idyllic. As we've been there it was off-season, so not opened to cars. Entrance is said to be cheap. It's being run by the local community. We recommend a try!

name: NMT shipping Mumbai Office
description:
/!\ Caution /!\
NMT is known for RoRo Shipping but they will offer everything else. However they will hire seco shipping which you can hire directly without the bad service of NMT
...
NMT Shipping Agent in Mumbai.
I shipped my RV truck RoRo from Middle East (Sohar/Oman) to Mumbai. I was using their Dubai office.
Overall, excellent work on both ends.

Address (Nov. 2022 @18.92523, 72.82451):

NMT Shipping Pvt Ltd.
as agents for NMTC B.V. (NMT Lines)
Office No.165, C Wing, 16th Floor,
Mittal Tower, Block III,
Backbay Reclamation Scheme,
Nariman Point, Mumbai-400021
India

T +91 22 66104045
F +91 22 66103987
W www.nmtshipping.com

name: Zora Cafe restaurant
description: Nice place to eat with AC room upstairs. Very delicious and not expensive. The food in the picture was 250 Rps. Tomato cream soup, shawarma, bottle of water and vanilla milk shake.

name: Site with great view
description:
This site is situated just aside the road, but on a lower level. Cars didn't really recognize us and it was a good stop before Sela Pass. The next morning was fantastic! Magnificent views! At more than 3.650 m we've been above the clouds. If there's no snow, you should be able to drive even lower and past the radio mast. Then it should be a perfect spot! 
4G available

name: View Terrace
description:
So, here's the flat ground next to the site close by the road. If there's no snow, we think this place should be perfect! The way down here is a bit rocky, but should be no problem. No cables in the view and mountains ahead!
There are several separate smaller grounds around here. But, as I tell you, we can't exactly tell how they look like, since now it's snow covered. But, and this is actually most important, it's flat ;-)

name: Binsar Wildlife Sanctuary
description:
For panoramic mountain views on a clear day, it’s a nice drive into Binsar Wildlife Sanctuary (gate 6h-18h, 600 per foreigner for one day/night plus 250 per car) and an easy one-hour hike up to the Zero Point viewpoint. 
At the end of the paved road there is a grassy parking for a Forest Dept bungalow where the caretakers allowed me to camp. Don’t know if that’s standard practice, but on the way here there is also a tourist resthouse with parking where you could ask, although likely less quiet. 
Nothing to do but enjoy the silent forest and the views from the top. And hope to spot a leopard..

name: Government Guest House[emergency]
description: Neepco-Govt lodging may be used for emergency during road damages

name: Parking next to Indian Oil Gasstation
description:
24h Service, no facilities.
Relatively quiet and save.
We asked if we can stay overnight.
Very friendly staff -> indian-like: no problem

name: Amla Fort
description:
We parked in front of this old residence, because we didn’t get through the small entrance. Rooms with toilets and shower available.
Very tiny street through the village, but feasible even with RV Truck.
We had dinner, which was organised from the village nearby. Parking was free if charge. Lots of people around as travellers are a top attraction in this village.

name: Rupis Resort Hotel
description:
Hotel Parking next to the Airport.
Huge Parking in front of the Hotel with 24h Security. Very friendly staff after approval from Hotel Manager.
Free of charge for us. We offered to have dinner at the restaurant but it was closed.

name: Amazing park close to the river
description:
Amazing place in the bank of the River.

Is very easy to arrive, also for Big trucks.

Is very calm and quiet not noisy. The people is very friendly and not anoying. 

During the night a lot of mosquitos.

name: Site at Stupa
description: Close to the site logged by toyotoro at the monastery (in fact it's only 200 m via footpath). Here you'll find your quiet - few dogs, few people, no monkeys, only some people. Just aside a carpentry with very nice workers. Perfect views on the beautiful mountain range forming the border to Bhutan. You'll be surrounded by prayer flags and have a huge meadow in front of you to hang out at good weather to enjoy the sun and the view.

name: Riverside
description: Flat grounds and one of the few possibilities to camp with your car in that beautiful gorge/valley. Very calm at night, only very few locals around.

name: Vista Hostel
description: Nice secluded place to stay and relax with good views. They have dorm and rooms in an old converted house high up the hill. Young owners are very nice to chat with. It is a 5-10 min walk through the jungle from the small car park (mind bears and leopards). They were fine with me sleeping in the car so just had dinner and a steaming hot bucket shower there. Car park not for big rigs.

name: Calm place close to the river
description:
This is a good place to sleep close to Bombai. In the way from Rajastan to Goa

From the main Road, turn left, there are some works and It looks like if there is not more Road, but there is one along the River. At the begin of the non asfalted road there a tap whit water.

Once you leave the main Road, is not asfalted, and not very good quality one but is not nessesary 4x4.

We sleep behind a Big abandone boat. Few people came friendly to say hello, but not disturb. There was not noise in that night. The spot is very beautiful.

Good for Big trucks. There is a lot of rabis... Same same than un other places india.

name: Service point Classic
description: Excellent workshop, very professional mechanics, also works with foreign cars and 4wd, owner speaks good English. High entrance, enough for 2,8 mtr vehicles. Nirankar Classic +91 9810156477

name: Babul Store
description: At Babul's store you'll find anything for a longer stay in the middle of Arunachal's nowhere. He is very nice, talkative (good in English) and has a lovely family. Prices are reasonable. You'll be happy afterwards!

name: Hotel Aruvi , Yelagiri hills
description: Nice and neat place to stay in pocket friendly way.

name: Noida. (Warehouse overlander/parking)
description: Wharehouse with shed/walled with guards 24x7. Guards/walled gated compound

name: Shirwal
description: This place is next to a reservoir, 3 Kms from AH 47. About 2 Kms from local inhabitation. Take left to Alandi Road after Shirwal and after the bridge. About 1500 mts a Ganpati Mandir is marked in Google maps. At that place a mud track goes on the left - goes slightly lower. In fact it is a gravel road that got submerged years ago. Very peaceful and safe. Have camped here pitching a tent on 6 occasions in last 5 years.

name: sabalpur village
description: It is a nice place.here all necessary things available

name: Shammi Angira
description: If you need lapping welding for motorcycle this is your man

name: Bambolim Beach
description: A nice and quiet beach not too far from Goa’s capital city of Panjim. Generally frequented by locals. Not many tourists show up here

name: Secret Garden - Hidden Garden
description:
Nice and affordable beach huts with good parking. Apart from the more upmarket resorts, there is not a whole lot of choice if you want beach-front accommodation with decent private parking space in Agonda, but this is one. 
Secret Garden has atmospheric bamboo huts in a beautiful green garden. A little jungle at the beach. There are more huts, a nice restaurant and the parking (this location) at their Hidden Garden 50m away. Huts with/without AC. 
Mind the overhanging cables if you have a high vehicle! No big rigs down this street!

name: Dzukou Valley
description:
Path is not easy, but the place is nice and quite. Near a river.
good place to start the trail to the view point (about 2,5 hours of wild stairs)

name: New chumukedima river
description:
Closed to the main road, we went down in the river. it’s noisy by day but very quiet by night. Trucks starts a 5... 
It’s not a perfect vanlife spot but it’s good after a long messy road day.

name: Rajputana Cabs
description:
Rajputana Cabs is a tour and travel agency in Jaipur, and is operating from the year 2013. Today they are a registered taxi service agency in Jaipur, and is highly positive reviewed on the web, because of their excellent taxi service in Jaipur.
You can contact the team at Rajputana Cabs to book a taxi in Jaipur for local city sightseeing, visit nearby cities of Agra, Ajmer, Bundi, Ranthambore, Pushkar, Khatoo, Salasar etc, and also for Delhi, Chandigarh, Ahmedabad, like hiring a one way cab from Jaipur to these cities.
Plus they do offer lots of packages which they have mentioned at their website.

name: Rajputana Cabs
description:
Rajputana Cabs is a tour and travel agency in Jaipur, and is operating from the year 2013. Today they are a registered taxi service agency in Jaipur, and is highly positive reviewed on the web, because of their excellent taxi service in Jaipur.
You can contact the team at Rajputana Cabs to book a taxi in Jaipur for local city sightseeing, visit nearby cities of Agra, Ajmer, Bundi, Ranthambore, Pushkar, Khatoo, Salasar etc, and also for Delhi, Chandigarh, Ahmedabad, like hiring a one way cab from Jaipur to these cities.
Plus they do offer lots of packages which they have mentioned at their website.

name: Santram Holidays Pvt Ltd
description: Santram Holidays Pvt Ltd is a 2017 started travel agency in Delhi, that offers car rental, sightseeing tours, and tour packages.

name: Riverside
description:
Big grass area, only some cows and birds !
Along the river, there are lot of quiet places.
This area into the wild is perfect for vanlife !

name: Hôtel Dalkola
description:
Close to the highway, the hotel have a big walled flat grass parking. 
He charged us 500Rs for one night 
He can cook for you.
The owner Alam is very nice

name: Grease Monkeyz (Motorcycle Garage)
description: Good workshop. best care for your machine and extra Alteration work will be done clearly. Happy customer

name: Royal Rajasthan Tour and Travels
description: Royal Rajasthan provides Best Cab and Taxi Rental Service in Jodhpur in Rajasthan.

name: Weigh bridge
description: Weigh bridge on your way to the container port. 100 rupees.

name: Grillz of Delhi
description:
Perfect place for fresh roasted chicken, wraps, Gravies ,Burgers and snacks. 
8595795518 their contact number. Open up to 4am

name: Kerala
description: Sight-seeing places in munnar and Kodaikanal and many off-roading places.

name: Vadodara  A world Heritage and Cultural City
description:
Hire  One Way Cab to Vadodara, a world Heritage and Cultural City, it is considered a perfect vacation spot. If you are interested to get deeper, and eager to know the world heritage, history of art, and cultural tradition of Vadodara. 

Choose YATAYAT one-way Ahmedabad to Vadodara cab to take you through the entire city for longer trips.  Ahmedabad to Vadodara cab fare is cheap and affordable so you won’t have to give second thoughts about exploring the entire city place by place. The beauty of waterfalls and planetariums became tourist attractions for children as well as adults too. The cab service from Ahmedabad to Vadodara takes you to the enigmatic temples and ancient palaces, all of which are known to be the beauty of old heritage. Enjoy the shopping of traditional handicrafts on the hustling-bustling streets. If you are interested to know much about Gujarat culture, then Navratri time is the best time to travel all through the state, especially from Ahmedabad to Vadodara by cab to witness their folk dances, foods, and events.

name: Kotchula
description:
It's a private property attached to the nearby homestay. Facilities available at homestay can be used during parking. 

MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified.

name: SRM Holidays Private Limited
description: SRM Holidays Private Limited is a unique Tour Operator in Delhi as well as listed as a leading Tours and Travel Agent in Delhi. The Company provides various Customize Holidays Sightseeing & Tour Packages with Hotels Accommodation In Delhi to North India Tours. To know more visit us at https://www.srmholidays.in/

name: Parkachik Alpine Tents
description:
A small hostel by J&K tourism, there is a nice place outside the property with a stunning view of the mountains around where we camped peacefully. 

We were allowed to use the washroom inside the building. Food is also made available by the family that lives in the building for travellers. 

They offer private rooms with attached bathroom at Rs 400, bed in the dormitory at Rs 100. Camping is free.

name: Padma Ling Guesthouse
description:
A beautiful Homestay with a camping ground on their property. It is run by a family who offer private rooms with attached bathroom with breakfast and dinner at Rs 2500 per room for 2 people.

The food offered delicious home made food in the common dining area. There is a place to wash clothes as well on the outside. 

The camping area is part of their property. It is safe and clean, barring cow dung in some places since they allow them to graze there during the day. 

There is a common pit-type toilet and a shower with hot water for campers.

name: Store 18 the supermarket
description: this is good shopping market for your essentials food items.

name: Rajasthan Cab
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place is not verified by an Overlander

All that needs to make a travel/holiday a lifetime memory is right here at Rajasthan Cab. To us, your every journey deserves to be full of comforts and joys. Thereby, we provide you a complete travel solution. Since the last decades, we are exceptionally recognized as the leading Taxi Rental Company in Rajasthan for a leisure holiday experience we offer to our esteemed guests.

name: Near mobile tower
description:
The way here is quite narrow and steep. Make sure to drive up in low gears. No disturbance from locals. 

Should go to nearby location “kumily hilltop” to watch sunrise. 

Big rig: I drove a dmax up here. Not suitable for a big RV

name: Fill n chill petro park
description:
Talk to manager before setting up tent. Very friendly folks at the petrol station. Enough space for big rigs. 

As a gratitude fill your tank here 😁

name: Wayanad Kurumbalakotta View Point
description: This place is very beautiful, this is the highest peak of Kerala

name: ATM with A/C
description: Air conditioning is a blessing for the very hot days. Doesn’t work with western cards, though.

name: Ranakpur Nature Reserve (guest house)
description:
An orchard that also has rooms for a fair price (600-1000 Rs.). Plenty space to park, big rigs also possible. We came by motorbike. 

The owner is very friendly and kind. Tasty food and freshly grown fruit.

You can organise leopard sighting tours in the morning (6am) or evening (4pm).

name: Leopard sighting
description:
Granite caves where leopards and other wildlife can be spotted. Best times of the day are 6:30am and 5pm.

4x4 will allow you to tour the entire area, but you can get quite close with normal vehicles and then proceed by foot.

Looks like you can also stay for the night

name: Lake camp
description:
Peaceful and quiet place to wild camp next to a lake. Temples nearby, and crocodiles in the water (beware).
Grassy but solid ground. 4x4 recommended, but also normal vehicles can go

name: Cafe water's edge, Kulu Himachal India
description: An awesome spot by the river Bias in Kulu. The owner of this private property is more than accommodating to have your rig Park here. great food ambiance and a bar by the water. toilets on premises.

name: Bella River view Manali, Himachal Pradesh
description: A lovely restaurant with plenty of open lands with private forest lands making a river crossing. great bathroom facilities and can accommodate big rigs. ask for Sunny Negi

name: Balaghat Area. River crossing
description: A nice place to be adventurous with a river crossing and camping on the river bed. RTT and POSSIBLE tenting only. 4x4 required. Will encounter when driving from Jhansi /Delhi to Hyderabad or Bangalore.

name: Dolavira Homestay
description: Mohan .. who runs this place has a heart of gold. A cumin farmer has opened up this homestya will make ur stay extremely comfy. you can deploy your RTT or rigs here.

name: Letro Camp
description: A large valley by the river with clamping tents, you can pitch your own or bring in SUVs with RTTs.

name: Crossroads camping (65Kms from Bangalore)
description:
ADMIN NOTE: this entry is by the owner and not yet independently verified.
 
A private 20+Acre farm that is Overlander friendly. There is a lot of place inside the property to wild camp. This site also has small cottages to rent with modern bathroom facilities. Nestled among farms, a large waterbody and quaint rural trails and treks. The forest range is about 2 Miles away and is part of the Elephant Corridor. 

This is built by Overlanders (Me) and for Overlanders. So if this region is on your agenda then make it down here. We have a 2.4 KM offroad tack for some fun. A central Kitchen you can use to cook will make for a great community. If you are a Burner (Burning Man) you will fund friends here :)

name: Ryan Cafe - Morjim
description: Fantastic wild camping site with out any disturbances. I parked almost at the beach. You have to follow the tiny lane past the car park. Eventually it leads up to a single lane path. I drove till that point and set up camp in my truck. There’s a lifeguard house on the right when you drive past the car park. That’s your cue. 100 meters from there is where I parked. There’s no access to any facilities. It’s perfect if your rig has everything. You get fantastic sunsets and sunrises. No trouble from anyone (so far). There are tons on shacks right there.. so food is not a problem. No toilet soo might need to use restaurants or some hotel close by unless you have your own. I stayed here all alone and it was totally safe. You can definitely drive larger trucks here too. Watch out for the sand as it’s very soft in a few patches. 4x4 would be handy! Have fun!

name: geda patiya
description: really nice place to stay room super clean and nice wifi good staff very helpful good bike parking all save great base for travelling to Salt plains or beaches to the south woukd recommend staying here you get everything in the city but its nice and quiet here

name: resort villa
description: really nice place good base for day trips all you need is here

name: Motorbike mechanic (Nisin)
description: His name is Nisin, helped me fix a tire. Recommended by others too

name: Mini Goa
description:
This place called "Mini Goa" is big natural area with wide meadows and access to a turquoise colored lake.
Some signs warn of swimming and indeed the lake is very deep and steep! if you can't swim this might be very dangerous for you.

There are food-trucks at the entrance area which sell food and cold drinks.
Parking fee was 30rp, it was no problem to stay overnight with our van. Nice mantra music is playing too sometimes.
4G Internet is usable (2Mbit/s with Airtel). but might be to slow for serious work)

name: Park Millenium
description:
Big parking near the park under tree.
Quiet place. We arrived at night.
Don't know if they are any washroom.

name: Hotel California
description: Small rooms, very clean, english speaking staff, very secure parking for motorcycles in underground carpark on site.

name: Homestay
description:
5 Rooms with local family in their homestay. Family really want to make your stay enjoyable and cannot do enough for you.

english spoken

Motorcycle parking is available in the garden out of sight from the road, quite safe.

No aircon, but has fans on each room.

all rooms, big double bed.

toilets and showers available in seperate block

breakfast, lunch and dinner available if required.

name: Near Road
description:
Near the main road but far enough to be quiet. Clean beautiful view to a waterfall which is also far enough to be not too loud .
Dog Friendly: Away from settlements so no stray dogs here!
Better to arrive in daylight, to find the best place to leave the street to the off-road.
Suitable for tents too, but stony ground.
Almost no internet with airtel, we managed to place our 4G router to be able to surf the cyberspace with 1-2 bars out of 5 and max 1Mbit/s

name: Drinking Water (low pressure, low space)
description:
Water Tap labeled as drinking water.
low pressure (2l/min)
approx 25cm between tap and bottom surface

name: Tripper Nest
description:
Very comfortable beds, hot showers, very clean and great hosts who speak English.
Street parking for multiple vehicles, quite safe as you are in the middle of nowhere.
Fantastic views over the valley. Airtel signal, but limited Vi signal

name: Drinking water at hospital
description:
currently there is a construction area!
On the parking of the hospital you find a big pipe which is usually turned off. ask at the hospital to use it.

filled up 30 liters in around 10 seconds

name: Maharana Cabs
description:
Maharana Cabs was established in the year 2018. it is a prominent tourist attraction in Udaipur. it features vintage cars and luxury cars on display. which tourist can enjoy and click pictures.
They are also available in Nathdwara, Rajsamand
They also provide local sightseeing along with vintage car display.

name: Zanskar Filling Station
description: Due to the remote situation, fuel is not always available here and on other petrol pumps, if you have a straight time schedule, it's recommended to refuel when you arrive!

name: Last petrol pump
description:
If you plan to drive to Leh via Zangla and Singe La Pass, this is your last chance to refuel!

Due to the remote situation, fuel is not always available here and on other petrol pumps, if you have a straight time schedule, its recommended to refuel when you arrive!

name: Cooking Gas
description:
This is maybe the only source of cooking gas in the valley.
On the first day it was closed but the next day (friday) at 10am many monks from several monasteries came with pickups to exchange their bottles.

We use a turkish picnic cylinder and he refused to refill it but after some time he did it.
It was only possible because we carry many adaptors and with ours and his we managed to fill it.
he filled the bottle 100% which is super dangerous. i had to remove 20% to reach a safe pressure! make sure to weight your bottle!

name: Lingshed
description:
Here you can camp on even ground with a great view to the village!
Next to this place is a tea-stall which looks somehow temporary (tent)

name: Teastall and Maggi
description:
Tea-Stall and Maggi-point

little parking possibilities, small clear brook for water beside

name: Natural Water Source
description: Small and clean brook with water outlet/pipe.

name: Singayala Restaurant
description: Small simple restaurant at the road to Leh

name: Watse Homestay
description:
We did not stay here but we saw this homestay while driving from Zanskar to Leh and it is the only one we saw.
You will relatively easy reach this village on your trip and it is more or less in the half of the route between the Kargil-Leh highway and Zanskar.
I would recommend to contact the Homestay before you departure.
0091 9469 19 588 5 (also whatsapp)

As internet and phone connectivity is very weak here, don't expect a quick response.
I don't know if they can speak english but one of  the neighbors who gave me the number did.

name: Road to Leh
description:
This road to Leh is very beautiful but it can also cost your life - People actually die here because of the road conditions although there is some  regular traffic on the road. There are plans to improve this road to be a major highway to Leh but as of now it's not. However, only short sections are seriously dangerous.

Most parts of the road are dry clay and drivable even without 4x4, but it can become muddy if wet. Some parts are very steep and there is no possibility to pass with other vehicles. On the right side, steep land awaits to slide down and on the left side, the canyon waits for you.

Look for coming vehicles far away (1-2 km!) and try to communicate to arrange who can drive or make space. Trucks of about 12 tons are also driving here. We also had to drive over rock slides which was no problem because we have 25cm between axis and road: a normal car might touch the surface in some situations. Our 4 ton, non 4x4 truck is 3m in height and a co-driver was absolutely necessary to check height-vs-rocks on some creepy parts. 

!!Don't drive while or after rain!! !!Don't camp on land/rockslide areas!!

Coming from Zanskar, at: 33.87512,76.85106 you have already passed the creepiest parts but the next pass is steeper than usual and dangerous if wet!  The rest of the Road is relatively easy to drive even the 5000m Singe-la pass is no problem. But Rain and wetness will change everything!

There is no gas station after Padum!

2023 Fall update: The road has been greatly improved and the best path will be to go via the Zanskar Valley road past Nerak, and avoid Lingshed which is supposedly steeper. Some parts of the road are paved, but it is still narrow and dangerous with some crossings through sand or over small streams of water. This road can be completed with no issue in an autorickshaw.

name: This road to Zanskar can be seriously dangerous
description:
This road to Zanskar is very beautiful but it can also cost your life - People actually die here because of the road conditions.
However, there is some little regular traffic on the road.

There are plans to promote this road to a major highway to Zanskar but as of now its not.
However only short parts are seriously dangerous.

!!Don't drive while or after rain!!
!!Don't camp on land/rockslide areas!!

Most parts of the road are dry clay and good drivable even without 4x4, but they become muddy if wet. 
Coming from Leh, if dry - the first 3/4 of the road are relatively easy to drive but especially at the last 1/4  after 33.89901,76.84762 you can expect some really creepy and dangerous parts, depending on the size of your vehicle.

some parts are very tall and there is no possibility to cross with other vehicles, while on the left side, steep land awaits to slide and on the right side the canyon waits for you.
Look for coming vehicles far away (1-2 km!) and try to communicate to arrange who can drive or make space.
However, trucks with approx. 12tons are also driving here.
We also had to drive over rock-slides which was no problem because we have 25cm between axis and road, a normal car might touch the surface in some situations.

Also mind: our 4tons, non 4x4 truck is 3m in height and a co-driver was absolutely necessary to check hight-vs-rocks on some creepy parts.

There is no gas station on until Padum!

name: Raj Hotel
description: Good average-priced hotel in beautiful location. Ideal after riding the Saach Pass. 1500 INR for a double room at the time of writing. No warm water but good facilities and pretty clean for Indian standards. Tasty food available on site. No secure parking for motorbikes, but quite rural and safe area.

name: Seven Seas Guest House
description:
Lovely and cheap guest house with single and double rooms, very friendly hosts that can help you get a SIM card and the tourist authorisation for visiting the mountain passes. 
Secure parking for several motorcycles is available on site and they do laundry if requested.
1200 rupees for a double room.

name: Shoe repair scammers
description: The guys acting a shoe repairer are actually scammers and will try to make you buy them food supplies and will tell you all sort of sad stories so you can buy, in order: food for their families, a shoe repair kit that could change their life, clothes etc. None of that is real and they have agreements with the shops for getting the money back afterwards. Don’t dal for them, they are professional

name: Himalayan summer camp
description:
Group of big tents than provide a place where to sleep and eat.
The tents have communal spaces with mattresses, pillows and plaids. You’ll need a good Sleeping bag due to the altitude, even in summer can become pretty cold during the night.
The entire setup is very utilitarian, don’t expect glamping, but it’s a cheap place where to stop between Leh and Manali.
250 rupees pp.
The “restaurant” has the basic bread omelet and noodles.

name: Tenzin Camp
description:
Campsite with fix tents that can sleep up to 4 people and have en-suite bathroom. The restaurant have basic food. We paid 1000 each in September (low season) included dinner and breakfast.
They would allow to set your own tent.
Send a WhatsApp to Tenzin for info +91 8629826772

name: Free Parking in the nature
description:
Beautiful parking next to the river.
Close to the city and with many restaurants close by. Main market 15min and drinking water spring 5minute by foot.

name: Sportsfield next to Road
description:
It's a sportsfield ,right next to the road, which also used by locals to park their small trucks.

Not the best place but good enough for a night. Not hidden, directly visible from the road.
The village youth plays Volleyball in the evening and might come to say hello but apart from that, nobody bothered us.

While it's dark there is almost no traffic, also in the morning until 8:30its really calm.

name: Big parking Tourist area Sissu
description:
Police recommended this place to us. It's not beautiful as they promised but it works.

Helipad of Sissu, tourist fair and parking all in once. Food stalls and trucks, zip lines along the river. It's probably a big carnival here in main season but now it's quite. A lot of space, so not hidden at all but nobody cared about us. 

Big tarmac parking (helipad), gravel car park close to an artificial pond or you can also pass the helipad on its left and come closer to the river.

Some poor people living in tents, relatively clean toilets available.

Nice view onto a big waterfall

name: Little Rivendel
description: A fantastic spot, away from the main road and settlements, alongside a tiny river with view on a little waterfall from the qanat. At the end of the road are “hot” (not so hot) springs. Staying the night in this beautiful valley was a blast. It’s quiet, peaceful and there are some bushes around. Next to the little river in which you can wash (it’s cold ).

name: In the middle of Gondor
description: A beautiful place in the middle of the valley and surrounded by mountains. It’s an open plain so you’ll be visible from the road but there is almost no traffic here. Really quiet at night with amazing sunrise and sunset. You can drive as far up the plain as you want. Also very doable without 4x4. (We drive a Volkswagen T2). Enjoy! En remember: don’t leave any waste!

name: mollys house
description: quickly stopped to shelter from the rain and have some tea, beautiful orchard. the workers dont seem to speak much English but nice view

name: snow land hotel
description:
nice doble rooms with beautiful view to the mountains, clean. Only cellphone signal mo wifi available in town. 
$1000 Rs.

name: the climbers restaurant
description: trendy little restaurant in Keylong, lovely view of the mountains, good prices and fair amount of options to choose from.

name: passport checkpoint
description: there's a police man checking visas and passports for every foreigner, friendly, quick. be prepared

name: supermarket
description: here you can stock on anything you can't find Iin the local market, lots of imported stuff

name: Wanderlust Guest House
description:
Small hotel with 5 rooms
Perfectly clean, private bathroom, AC.
And a perfect rooftop with shades and delicious restaurant
Internet is very fast.
800 INR per night for a double room.
1300 INR per night for double room in Jan 2024.

name: home of the world guesthouse
description:
this is the best place I've found yet in India, it's really clean, the room is gorgeous, nice shower, nice bathroom and the hosts are excellent. Food and laundry are included in the price which is an extra from the average service you get.
there is a garden if you want to make some stretches and the street it's not crowded so if you want to go for a little run or walk it's the right place to do it in Jaipur.
it's a bit far from downtown but you can also rent a scooter here. 
There is space to park your vehicle inside the property 
$1500 rupees for a double room for 2 people, it's totally worth it paying a bit more than usual, specially if you want to rest from the craziness of India

name: laughing Buddha
description:
nice little vegan and vegetarian restaurant in Pushka, everything is delicious, I had the coconut banana date shake and the mix vegetable sandwich (non vegan with feta cheese and mozzarella) also everything's organic and reasonable price.
perfect if you need something less intense than Indian food or something more filling than parantha 
clean toilets

name: toffu safari
description:
cool backpackers hostel, the owner toffu is very helpful and also has a luxurious safari to the thar desert with camels and a pool at good prices.
nice hotel with small kitchen to get some chai in the terrace or simple breakfast. they also offer camel safari, it's a bit more expensive than the average tour but it's worth paying a little bit extra to have a nicer experience in India, the rooms are comfortable, clean and Tofu is helpful, very talkative and friendly.

name: Rayt Hill view point
description:
View point with proper parking and amazing view around.  
In daytime crowded with people enjoying the view. In night time peaceful and safe. 
Day time a shack is open for coffee, tea and Maggi.

name: Railway dam
description:
Situated about 1hr from Nashik and 3 from Mumbai it's beautifully located next to a lake surrounded by the mountains. 

Easily accessible and flat parking space. 

Some locals come but in general it's calm and peaceful.

name: Bhandardara Lakeview Camping
description:
Amazing location to camp. It's an official campsite but the owner let me stay for free. Location is just superb. 
Beautiful view of the highest peak of Maharashtra and the lake is perfect for swimming. 
5 clean washrooms are there. 

Peaceful. No insects, no mosquitoes and magnificent sunset experience

name: Spring Water on Chanspa Road
description: Don't know if it's filter and/or from a spring but a lot of locals come to fetch their water here. Some guys load their mini vans full. We were sent here by a local guy and had no problems, good taste.

name: Riverside Gravel Beach
description:
Gravel Beach between Zansgar River and the Road. Little traffic on that road.

There is a turnoff from the road where the red gate but we drive right onto the big gravel Beach.

name: Truckers Campsite
description: Big area full of trucks as truck drivers come here for rest or to stay a few days. It's gravel and towards the end grass and some trees. It has a bit the feel of a campsite. Toilets an tea/stalls on site. Nobody asked for money and we asked several people. On the river. Busy road on the other side so it's not quite. Kids come to play football and cricket. Entrance at 31,9852659, 77,1305382

name: Sonu Juice
description:
Very tasteful juice, not so expensive (80 for medium size)
Ask for the menu
In front of it, there is the Raju restaurant. Also delicious, try the malai kofta 
Price is about 250 INR per meal, 80 for naan

name: Ocean front safe spot
description:
Secluded safe spot to backup with a 4x4 and rtt.
We spent day and night here and maybe seen 4 locals. 
4G is working and the view is amazing.  From here you can see the Mumbai skyline.

name: super cool Cafe in jaisalmer
description: trendy terrace Cafe with lots of plants and cool art, the owner Naresh is a beautiful person and a very talented artist who could show you how to sculp some mud if you stay a little around town. The food is fresh, tasty (vegetarian only)

name: wild camping in the dunes
description: nice spot to watch the sunset, wildcamp in your car or tent.

name: lassi shop
description: take a traditional lassi to go, there are many flavors. fresh and delicious

name: dream heaven haveli
description:
nice hotel haveli type with great view of the lake and spacious terrace, rooms with balcony, hot shower, clean and quiet.
$1200 rupees for a double room

name: Backpackers Den
description:
Nice little Hostel in Colony of Lucknow. Yard fits a van or maybe two cars. We stayed in a room, sleeping in the car is possible, get in touch with the young owner Harsh to find out about prices.

We were in town to find parts for our sprinter. Harshs uncle has a car part business, he helped us to find mechanics and even called one to come to the hostel  to dismantle a part so that one of his staff could take it to a shop to compare with another part. Helpful and nice people work here.

We payed 1600 for private room with private bath, dorm is 900 all including breakfast.

name: Beach Entrance
description: Beach entrance, from here you can enter the beach and drive as far as you want along the beach to find your own place.

name: Parquing in green area
description:
Next to the other parking which actually forbidden now. Not best place in the world but the best we found in Amritsar for free. It is in a green and calm at night area. Walking distance from golden Temple. Only 100Irp by Tuc Tuc. Oposite this place there is a very popular street food place with delicious and cheap food. Many street dogs around but not too bad for a short walk with our dog. 
We stay here Teo nights when we enter India and one more night few month latter when we exit. 
It is next to a public toilet.

name: IndusInd Bank
description: This ATM accepts visa and Mastercard. You can withdraw up to 10.000 rupees here.

name: Quiet near some cave temples
description:
Unpaved and partially hilly, free and quiet parking area for visitors of the temple caves and the botanic garden.

We slept here one night on the way to Mumbai in a more or less even position. Was quiet and comfortable. Many (friendly) dogs. (they did not attack our dog)

name: Quiet parking at the promende
description:
Quietish parking at the beach promenade, plenty of parking space at least from the evening time.
235rs per 12h
continuous fresh breeze from the sea
looks pretty safe

name: Pathpavers - motorcycle mechanic and parts dealer
description:
Great place to get fixes and maintenance done for bikes mainly sold in Europe / the US. 

They know their stuff well, are treating bikes with the proper attention and care and besides that offer a great place to just hang out. 

For my Tenere 700, they fixed a broken cable, a bent handle bar and built a custom solution for my luggage rack. Full recommendation!

name: Jwala Niketan
description: 500 rupees per night for a single person. A room without a window but access to the common roof terrace. I paid 700 rupees for a bigger room with a big bath and my own balcony. It’s possible to park the car in the fenced garden. But watch out: Someone has to lift a low-hanging electricity cable (~2,00m) to enter the gate. Really humble, friendly, and helpful owners. They offer additional breakfast if wanted and they seemed to have a water purifier on the first floor but I didn't use it. The other guests were all foreigners so the standard for the hotel and cleanliness seems to be for foreigners. The Wi-Fi was working fast and without interruptions.

name: IndusInd Bank ATM
description: Here you can use Visa and Mastercard for getting cash money at the ATM. 10.000 rupees maximum per withdrawal.

name: Gravel parking near small 24h restaurant
description: Here you can stay for the night. Just ask the owner as he will say you where to park. They do it because want to have spec for trucks arriving after darkness hits in. The night was calm even that I parked immediately in front if the restaurant. No toilets here. Delicious food.

name: between trees
description: nice place close by the street, but far from highway noise.

name: pandhal cafe
description: first place I've found in Kerala to sell fresh made coffee. It's also a bakery, little pricey but was worth it.

name: Tibetan chef restaurant
description:
Tibetan restaurant in Fortkochi frequented by many local people that ensure you the best quality and best price 😆
Good opportunity to try beef momos for the first time, maybe you'll never see them again in India...

name: overnight parking
description: Parking behind a gas station for free, 200m away from the highway. Beware of the monkeys.

name: Namkila Automobile
description: Tyre repair shop. Has some hydraulic and mechanical bead breakers, compressed air, as well as automotive parts such as tyres and tubes, oil, lube. Mechanic has limited tools but is good and persistent.

name: Reliant Hotel
description:
It's not a 5 star hotel, but I think the best you can find in this town. 
Paid 1500 INR for a room, car can be parked in front of hotel, nice food in the restaurant. Friendly owner

name: Garipati Palace Hotel
description: Probably the fanciest hotel intown, paid 2300 INR for a nice room. Big parking lot, guarded, didn't check how large is the gate exactly. Nice owner, speaks perfect English and helped me to find a working atm that accepts foreign CCs !!

name: Hotel Athens
description: Nice hotel with nice owners. There is a car park, although this is on the street. The owner says it's safe and he checks on the car once in a while apparently. Hotel with clean sheets and very nice hot shower. Good restaurant for room service as well. Bargained price down to 1300 roepies for one night.

name: Mozo Hostel
description: Babu and his wife provide excellent accomodation for a very cheap price. There are group rooms and private rooms available. There is hot water, average WiFi and pleasant relaxing area. The area is surrounded by beautiful forests and villages. There are day treks, monastery's and temples nearby. Food is basic but good and cheap.

name: Munnar coffee
description: if you're looking for authentic Kerala coffee visit this shop on the roof top of a local restaurant.

name: Gurudwara Bhora Sahib
description:
nice Parking at the aerial of the Sigh temple. very nice and helpful people.
But aware, if you are looking for a quiet place, this isn't the right one, but you can get the full indian life, even during the night.
the visitor center is on the right site of the main entrance and probably you have to book  a room. the cheapest one is 200, we had one with bathroom for 600.

name: hôtel restaurant
description: Hotel restaurant.  We slept for 2 days in the parking lot with our 4x4 truck. No height limit, we didn't pay for the pitch but we went to eat at the restaurant in return.

name: Nimoo NH-1
description:
Nice place to camp. Has a restaurant&cafe with very economic prices, WC and shower (warm water only on the evening). 
Run by Rinchen Dorjay who is very friendly.

name: Minria Guesthouse
description: Clean comfy rooms with balcony, AC, ceiling fan, fridge, towel, watercooker. Warm shower and fast and reliable Wi-Fi. The owner family is really humble and the road is a dead end therefore really calm. Its possible to park the car right in front of the premises. I came for a day, stayed for a week. Payed 1100 rupees per night.

name: Little Rock Home stay
description:
Moderator note: place added by owner or manager.

Udupi is one of the top tourist attractions in Karnataka and has various educational institutions. It is notable for the Krishna Temple and is also known as the temple city. It also lends its name to the popular Udupi cuisine, is also known as Parashurama Kshetra, and is famous for Kanakana kindi.

name: Hotel Shaurya
description: Hotel close to the Nepalese border. For 200 rupees we could park in front and sleep in our van. They let us use their toilet and wifi. They have a restaurant on site with some cheap food! Friendly people.

name: shippin yard and customs
description: This is the yard you have to drop your vehicle to get it shipped out of India. Its on google.maps at the right place, you drive under the building-entrance. Inside its organised the Indian way. Take a lot of nervs and patience with you. It took from 10 am to 8 pm going from my hotel near the airport, drop my car, do some customs paper work and get back to the airport-hotel. Full day experience. Welcome to Mumbai

name: Vehicle Scale
description: Here you can weight your vehicle with slip, i.e for shipping

name: Next to river
description:
In the evening we found some young boys making their food next to the river but they showed no interest. Later 2 boys on a bike came to ask if we are tourists camping for the night. And that was OK.

Morning time around 7 ladies come to do laundry. But again they showed no interest in us. 

At night very peacefull and safe, it's just behind some homes. Next to an old unused temple. 

4G on all networks is working properly.

name: Ama Café
description: Best coffee shop since Turkey, Georgia, Armenia, Iran and Pakistan! Coffee and cake are amazing, and the staff is very friendly. Highly recommend visiting here!

name: 300 meter from main road
description:
Locals roam between the fields but are very friendly. 
We even recieved a good amount of bananas from the local fields. 

magnificent spot with amazing sunset and sunrise views.

name: Hotel Varun
description: The hotel is a bit old, but OK. Centrally located, they have safe parking in the front of the hotel with a 24/7 guard. Motorbikes can be parked safe in the backyard. I paid R3,000 for a room, with breakfast (which was very nice, buffet with side orders). For the price it was OK, not many good reasonable priced hotels in this area.

name: Beni Taal
description: This is a private property but camping and Overlanding is allowed. Just inform them and maintain cleanliness. It's a big grassland with a small lake. Drinking water is available. No toilet facilities. Very friendly local people. You will love the Himalayan snow peak views from here. Very calm and quiet village.

name: Authentic camel experience
description:
Kheta is one of the few authentic camel safari guides. He sings traditional songs, is kind and alot cheaper than the commercial ones. Please support Kheta and his family! 
Location on iOverlander is not where he lives: call him on +91 95710 96265

name: Abhayanand Agro Tourism Center
description:
This is a nice place managed by a young entusiastic couple. They have simple but clean rooms rooms from R1,250 up to R3,500, double, triple etc. They have also have dormitory for R550 per person. Very nice food, you can get breakfast, lunch and dinner here. All organic from their own farm. 400 metres walking to the Ellora caves.

The place is behind Kanhaiya Hotel, you have to go up a little dirt road. There is a small sign on the road, easy to miss. They are also on booking.com, with phone number.

name: No Name Hostel
description: It's a hostel run by a community. You can pay a small monthly rate or volunteer and stay for free. super nice people.

name: Mangal City Mall parking lot
description: If you’re exhausted of the crazy driving, poor wild camping spots, and being rejected in hotels here for being foreign, you can crash on this big parking lot for some rest. The area has some grass, and is behind the mall so you are a bit secluded from the busy street. Though there is little to no privacy so it might be more comfy with a big rig. As a bonus, there are tons of nice restaurants in the area, and a McDonalds! There are free public toilets (dirty) in the mall, alternatively you can use the clean McDonalds toilet if you’re willing to buy something there (they have McCafé too).

name: next to lake
description:
An amazing spot next to the lake with view on the Sri Venugopalaswamy Temple and an amazing sunset!

good for big rigs. 

4G works. 

peacefull. some locals come but don't bother.

name: Next to small waterbody and fields
description:
Beautiful spot. Next to a small waterbody. 

Locals come but very friendly. Got a fresh coconut this time. Night time it's very peaceful. No disturbance. 

4G working on all networks.

name: Small ground in between the fields
description:
Great location.
Except landowner nobody else seen. 
nearby stone factory. some noise comes from morning till evening. Nothing too much. 
Nighttime extremely peacefull. 
small stream and waterbody nearby. 
Good internet speed. 
Secluded.

name: Backwater Camping
description:
This is a very cute family run camping, more like a Glamping, near all the wineries of Nashik. It’s closest to the York winery, where you can have a wine tasting and tour for 500rp per person. 

The camping usually charges 1299rp per person for sleeping in their tent, barbecue dinner (veg/non veg) and breakfast. However if you sleep in your own car, they will offer the deal for 800rp per person.
