The owners are super friendly, and it’s a very chill place to spend a night. Plus the dinner is perfect after wine tasting (and so much food!). They even have a bonfire! Toilets and showers are available (basic). No WiFi but good 4G coverage with Airtel.

Better to WhatsApp/call them before you arrive if possible so they can arrange the dinner +91 96041 02709, else you might have to wait a bit for them to prepare it.

name: Parking Lot Taj Mahal
description: It's the West Gate Parking of Taj Mahal. We stayed here over night. Here is place for big rigs. From here you can walk to the Taj Mahal entrance or take important the white golf car to the taj Mahal for 20 rs for each person. Don't use the normal rikshah because they are more expensive. The parking lot has also facilities but we don't use them

name: Middle or grassland.
description:
Safe spot. No wild life. 
Some locals travel to nearby workplaces. Not disturbing. Hardly any sound in day time. Just nature. 
Nighttime it's extremely peacefull. Just some nearby peacocks you're hearing. 
No insects or mosquitoes ( early December).
Good 4g connection. ( jio, vodaphone and airtel)

name: Hotel Ruchira & Swimming Pool
description:
If you need to unwind from Mumbai, or are waiting for your car shipping from the nearby port, this is an amazing hotel to stay at. 

You’re only 8km away from the port for the shipping, and can enjoy the beach and hotel’s swimming pool.

The rooms are very modern and clean. The staff extremely friendly. The swimming pool is a good way to cool down, and rooms have AC. Electricity is on/off in the city, so they have a generator too. 

We paid 2000rp per night for a double room, you can probably sleep in your car in the safe alley and use the reception toilets and swimming pool only if you prefer.

name: Tourist Pension
description:
Tourist Pension is a guesthouse where you are welcomed as family. The owner is also a certified touristguide and can tell you everything about his city Nawalgarh. It’s a big house with 8 rooms for guests. The rooms are very clean and beautiful decorated with traditional ornaments. Not all of the rooms have hot shower and there’s no airco. 

There is secure and safe parking for motorcycle inside. Good traditional breakfast and the possibilitie to join for dinner for 350 INR. Everything home grown and made themselves. They are very eco-friendly. Owners will do everything to make your stay as good as possible. I paid 1200 IND per night for a single room.

name: Big empty space
description: We came to Amritsar late, and found this quiet place. We slept for a night, nobody came and disturbed. Place is huge 100 overlander can stay together.

name: Nature place near the road and a temple
description: Very nice place in the middle of the Indian jungle :) nearby a small temple with very friendly people. Perfect also for dogs to run.

name: Big Top Garage
description: Sameer and his team did a great job fixing our steering wheel issues and electrical work. We provided a long list of neccesary check-ups and repairs. Almost all work was done within a day. Sameer discussed all steps and asked for permission to replace parts or order new ones. He speaks English well. He is very accommodating.

name: Private Home
description:
A nice quiet house, area perfect, family near, just 10 meters, they have a nice Mercedes camper van and love traveling. We slept here for a night and were invited to the family’s house for a nice dinner. They would love to help and meet overlanders. Nice big playground in front of their house.
WhatsApp: Jaideep Chahal: +91 82688 88866

name: Blue eye backpackers
description: Good hostel, 250rupie in dormitory, 700 for private. Nothing fancy. There is safe space for (one) motorcycle inside the hostel to park (included in the price).

name: Ranjit Avenue D Block
description: Free campsite. Camping here tonight. An empty plot inside a colony named Ranjit Avenue D Block. Cars parked in random. Parked my caravan here. Contacted Jaideep @+918268888866 for water in adjoining house.

name: Cool place to Stay for a night
description: It was too late to continue for driving so we stopped at this petrol station called “Reliance”. People were very friendly and it has enough space for 2-3 Camper Van. They have filtered drinking water and toilets were very clean, + cold shower. Nobody disturbed even it was close to the road it was super quiet.

name: Filtered drinking water
description: At the Reliance station they have filtered drinking water and running water too. Good place, friendly people.

name: Reliance station
description: Good Place.. but our international bank card did not worked here. Have to bring CASH.

name: “Dhillon Car Bazar”
description:
We came to this old man he works with his son. They done great job for us. Fixed my front two doors, Added new AC mount and did some work under my camper van. And charged only 20$. No need to doubt about this mechanic, he knows how to do and what he is doing. + Good person. His son speaks in english little bit.
Also there was a Car wash 3m away :-) We paid 500 rupees for outer washing.

name: Wild Campspot near the Motorway
description: Flat area near the Motorway with a lot of space to park and have a good night also for dogs very nice.

name: Next to ocean
description:
In the entire area this is a spot that has somewhat hard ground. My 2WD Manindra Scorpio managed.  
The view on the ocean is amazing and even there are some trees for a hammock to hang. 

Hardly any locals come. We have seen 4 and non are connection. Safe spot.

name: Plains. hard ground
description:
While most of the surrounding areas are soft sand grounds this is hard. 
We didn't find anyone around. and tracks also show not many people come there. 

Beautiful open area and plenty of choices where to park. 

From leaving the main road you'll find a path and that path leads to this area. First you'll find trees with lots of drinking bottles under it but when you continue to drive forward you'll find some pristine areas.

name: Hidden gem in this area
description: We were driving in a dark night, it seems like there is no parking or no spot for sleep but finally we have found this beautiful parking. There is a food court KFC and mini cinema in 30m, and petrol pump 50m.

name: Official Rest Area
description: It was a good place to sleep. It is under construction but it will finish soon.  Some noise from the highway.

name: Mcleod Ganj Parking available for all campervans
description:
There was a big enough space for campers.
It was a high enough all types of caravans will fit it. It is on -3 floor, big buses stops here

name: Gyoto Tantric monastery parking
description: There is a parking spot only for 1 caravan just in front of big white stupa in Gyuto Tantric Monastery. First have to ask permission. We stayed here for 4 days. But please follow the rules, respect lama and monks.

name: Wildcamping on the beach
description: Beautiful beach with good waves. Calm, some friendly locals and fishermen come by but there is almost no one. Right in front of the sandbeach is a strip with grass where there are multiple places to park under the trees and the coconut palms. 4G OK.

name: travelerstribe nature hostel
description: MODERATOR NOTE: User reports location is incorrect, Place deleted.

name: place on the hilltop
description: A calm place on the hilltop not too far from the road. Very easy to reach. Beautiful view. Only some friendly cows in the morning. Bit dirty with rubbish, but perfect for the night.

name: camping inside creepy tower
description: There is a lookout tower here with space in top deck for a tent. I was able to fit my 1 person tent but a 2 person would probably fit too. nice shelter from rain and animals for the night. two guys showed up at 9pm to drink a beer. they only spoke Tamil and after an awkward greeting they went to the lower platform while I was at the top. after they left no one else stopped during the night. there is space behind the tower to hide a motorcycle but I opted to leave mine out front, visible to the road as to not spook any visitors. good choice I guess. there is space infront to park a car, though it is literally right on the side of the road. better as a  motorcycle and bicycle shelter I think.

name: many spots near river
description: one road in here that any vehicle can do, but many flat spots to choose from. I took a nice one close to the river and had a great sunrise. no one came during the night.

name: Hillusion
description:
Nice place near Udaipur. Bar, restaurant, friendly staff, toilet, hot shower, not too big gate to enter, so no trucks. but vans are fine.  +919660277704 raahi speaks english
contact him

name: Small clearance along dirt track
description:
Finding a spot for wild camping with a vehicle is NOT easy around Dharamsala. Especially not with roof top tents. This is not a great spot but functional if you have a small van or like us Landrover with roof top tents. Nothing bigger than that fits here. It is just a small clearance along a dirt track. The end of the track with a bigger clearance is just a few meters further on but locals use it for parking so no room for us. You are right beside the track so if no toilet in the van you have to be a bit creative. In the evening very quiet. In the morning locals passing by but all friendly and no one seemed to bother. Only one car passed by during the morning 
Probably only a functional spot in low season.

name: Parking spot by the road
description: We came to Delhi late, so we did not have any choice. We slept by the small road next to the main road for except bit noisy it was a safe place. Nobody disturbed.

name: Huge parking near Great India Mall
description: We came here around 22pm, it was so noisy until 12:00am. Because there was a lots of bar, cafe. , live music near Great Indian mall. It is close to everything but noisy!!! After 12:00 Nobody disturbs, security guys came several times for check.

name: Smart Bazaar Huge Supermarket
description: Here is a huge supermarket like in Europe. It is located at the ground floor of Great India Mall .Huge parking space outside

name: Attack - Don't go there!
description:
be careful in this area.
we wanted to sleep here. and night a group of men came and hit the car. the smashed a window a tried to pull us out. only with big luck we could escape!

the police told us this area has a big problem with this groups.

name: 8 auspicious Him View Guesthouse
description:
A lovely guesthouse managed by a very nice woman. Rooms traditonally furnished, so clean and with possibility of electrical heater in wintertime. 
Cat 3 double rooms with balcony and mountain view is 3800 rp pr night (Dec price(. Cat 1 double rooms (downstairs) 2600 rp  we are a family of 4 with teenage children. We had 2 extra mattreses in our room and  paid 40 % more for the room. Breakfast, good, choose from meny, is included. Hot shower 24/7. 
Very little space for parking though. We just squezed in with a Land rover and the roads to come here are narrow and steep. If no room for patking she will find another parking for you just 1 min away.

name: VELA resort
description: Ask for Vicky. This man will make your stay at his resort the most memorable. The resort has a huge parking and is big rig friendly: there are all amenities and 2 mins walking distance to everything

name: OMG This Parking is a Hidden GEM
description: We came late but found this beautiful spot by the lake. Nobody disturbed and it was a super quiet. No engine sound no road noise just birds. Wifi password is just: [passwords are not allowed] and super fast.

name: Spot in the middle of the forest
description: We found a spot inside the forest, near to main road, its quite but you can Listen the noise of the road, its nice, there are a lot of little spots if you take the little ways, this one its okey to stay clam, we can take a shower outside , anyone bother us , and the dogs hace space to   ‌investigate. Good place to sleep on this area . if you have a small van maybe can follow the little gravel road (last photo)and you arrive at open space 50m in front.

name: Phoenix mall is the best in this sity
description: If you follow my location you will come to big parking space near Phoenix mall. Just 50m

name: D mart supermarket
description: A fairly well stocket supermarket. No fresh food, though, and very few dairy products. Prices OK. Especially toiletpaper does not have that bad price. Plus that you can pay with VISA card. Aware though that some of the cashiers have an automat that reject international card so shop between cashiers!!

name: Exchange and wester Union
description:
Here you can find the best rates and take your money by wester Union 
GATEWAY FOREX PVT LTD (in front of India restaurant)

name: Parking in center of Chardigarh
description: Good place to spend a day while visiting the city of Chardigarh. The night was a bit noisy but it was the last night of the year, probably a normal day it is not so noisy there are toilets but they were not available when we were there, there is also a "drinking" water point.

name: ATM Indusind bank
description: ATM that works with international visa card

name: Big Parking Area
description: There was a big parking area for trucks. Bit noisy but nobody disturbed.

name: Quiet place to sleep
description: It was really nice place to sleep. Nepali border and border guard soldiers’ camp just in 200m. We slept here for a night and nobody disturbed.

name: Open field near the road
description: Open uncultivated field, very quiet. The ground level is barely flat and there is a lot of space. Some locals came for selfies but none stayed long. During the night no noise, even from the road, and no mosquitoes at all. 4G available with Airtel

name: Motorcycle Parking
description: Cheap Underground Motorcycle. Down the ramp, plenty of space. Good if you’re booked into a hotel nearby which offers no parking (street parking for most hotels except Ramada).

name: Hotel Heaven View
description: Avoid this hotel, particularly if you are considering it for the parking they advertise on booking.com and their website. The “free private parking” is just the spot outside the hotel in the very busy commercial street so not appropriate if you have luggage or motorbikes that attract attention. The attitude of the hotel owner was unfortunately very bad, he lied when we called ahead to check the parking situation and later refused to do what all hotels do for tourists and be our reference for SIM cards, despite speaking with the Airtel seller.

name: Green Hotel
description: Comfortable hotel in good location, they have a parking garage that is big enough for two adv motorbikes (a huge plus given how narrow the streets are).

name: Viewpoint
description: Large and mostly flat area (viewpoint) on top of mountain. next to the sh 130 but quiet. there are a few places behind trees and bushes to hide. easy to enter with every car. we were told that it’s dangerous due to wild elephants and tigers. still hoping to see them;)

name: Western Union
description: Western Union. hidden but easy to acess with cars, because it's on a big road. opposite side of the road is dcb bank (bright blue and yellow) good to orientate. no place to park. just park on the road like a lokal;)

name: Nature Area
description: An open area interspersed by trees and bushes and surrounded by low rock walls. Plenty of space for wild camping. Not visible from the road. A distant house. A bit of noise from close by wind Mills. A couple of locals passed by. Asked if we needed something. No garbage. Good for visiting Jain temple and Hindu temples in Osiyan. Take little asphalt road on the left when coming from Osiyan. Take an almost non-existing sand path on the left side in a curve on the asphalt road after having driven a couple of minutes.

name: beginning of rough track
description:
Leading into semidesert area with many possibilities for wild camping. We drove around 5-10 minutes along the sandy track. Only garbage at the beginning of the track. Noone around ezcept from camel herders late afternoon. and a couple of locals came by to talk in the evening.
Nice area with great sunrise and sunset. 
No need og 4x4.

name: Clearance along the road
description:
Small clearance along the road. Some trees to hide behind though not completely hidden from the road.
Some people drove by but we where not disturbed.
Only a little garbage and very quiet at night - might be different on a weekend or indian holiday.

For small vans with high clearance.

name: Abu Adventures
description:
A campground for school classes and the like. 
We where allowed to stay on the ground and use the toilets for free. Gave a tip to the staff, who where friendly and offered masala tea and food. 
It is only for small vans since the spot is small and the road, through the village, to reach it is narrow.

name: Vishnu temple
description: behinde the Vishnu temple, in front of the Templeguesthouse. Good to park. Really impressive temple and possible to walk around (outside temple) with your dog. Straydogs around but no problem. Really nice villagers. You could stay in the guesthouse, we gor a tour, looked pretty ok. The temple offers breakfast, lunch and dinner.

name: Pamban Island
description:
Along this peninsula is forbidden to camp and even to enter after 6pm. It’s a very sensitive area (avoid drones or off-road etc)

But you can enjoy good fresh fish from local restaurants (like this one, Mr.Fish… kumaran is very good guy speaking English)

name: Parking of LODI GARDEN
description:
Parking LODI GARDEN, is good to be in the center of New Delhi, perfect if you travel with dogs because in this park are pet friendly and is very nice to walk.
Guarded by security cameras, open 24/7, free toilet open from 07:00 to 21:00.
A bit noisy both during the day and at night.

name: Aqua outback
description:
This is a paradise! Wonderful location and super nice owners, some activities too… the best to relax some days 

Dorms 3500 (3meals included)
Rooms 4500 (3meals included)

00919600788789

name: quite Parking in the Middle of Hampi
description: This is an official Parkingplace to use when to visit Hampi. Drive to the End of the Parking, leave the bussy part and you can Park your Car under Palmtrees Close to Matanga hill, behind the Old Bazar. Locals come in the daytime for Picknick. On the Front Part you can find Foodstalls and a Public toilet. there are Watertaps ,too. we Payed 50rps for one Night.

name: Parking area of Sigh Temple
description:
Parking area of Sigh temple. No road noise, just the sound of the river and prayers from the temple. Prayers finished at 8pm and startet again at 6 in the morning with singing and music, so not the best place for sleeping long. After an hour or so it was much quieter.
The people are very friendly and said it is ok to park here for the night. They also offered to provide a room in the temple area for us. There are toilets, cold showers, places to fill up water (don't know about the quality), free chai and food. Not much going here, just in the morning more people came to visit the temple.

name: Spot between trees
description:
Hidden place between low trees.
Driving on the road from Chittorgarh Fort you can take the dirt road marked with a star. After driving a bit you will have some fields and fences on the right, while on the left the area is free of houses and the like. Only trees. 
In winter it is possible to drive under some of them and in this way make your way through, so you are less visible from the little dirt road (possibly also in sommer time depending on how it is with leafs on the trees).

We drive a Landrover Defender with rooftoptents. Anything higher will be difficult to drive beneath the trees.

Further behind this place there is a small temple. Hidden behind  trees.The road to reach it not in side, but a few men past by. No one disturbed us.

name: JUST FOR ACCESS: Road to reach freecamping spot
description: Follow this road and shortly you will reach a nice spot for free camping.

name: Lake with Island
description: Here it’s a nice spot to visit this lake with island and tane… about 150rupies by boat go and back

name: Suryanelli Eco Camp Village
description:
An official campsite on the way to Munnar. They let us park here and use toilets/shower for 500 rupees per night. It has a stunning view over the lake. Very peaceful and quite.
The entrance gate is quite narrow though, so not possible to enter with big rigs.

name: Rs Taxi Service
description:
Rs Taxi Service has the largest network in car hire in Chandigarh.Most reasonable rates in Chandigarh for taxi service local and outstation as well.
Call 7696112244 Or 9988837636
Email:-  chandigarhtaxi1984@gmail.com
www.chandigarhtaxiserivce.net

name: Quiet field next to highway
description: Next to the highway but quiet. Slept very well. From the sandy road it is difficult to find a good way into the field, maybe check it out on foot first. Here are some goats, cows, rabbits and gazelles. During the day several times workers came from the road building factory which is a few hundred meters away. It is a bit annoying, but they are friendly and go away after a few minutes or a selfie.

name: open big spot surrounded by low trees and bushes
description: Outside of Maheswar going towards Ajanta Caves. Nice spot. Reacheable by high clearance vehicle. We have 4x4 but think it would be possible also with sturdy 2x2. Nice view from the plateaulike clearing above the surrounding landscape. No houses visible. Road far away. No one came by. Very quiet. No litter. A bit stony ground. Easy to be level. Reachable after a max 10 min drive along a track with fields on left side. At some point you turn right and drive around a curve to arrive here. Where track leaves main road marked by star on Ioverlander.

name: Parking at crematorium
description: If you don’t mind sleeping next to a crematorium, this is a quite spot for the night on the way to or from Munnar. The road is busy during the day, but gets very quiet at night.

name: beginning of trail to overnight spot
description: entry point to track leading up to overnight spot

name: Bank for visas
description:
Around here you find many banks but no one of them will accept your cash or foreign account to make the payment for visas… so you need this guy 

9818764458 Dev 

He charged 500rupie for 4800 payment (Bangladesh commission). 

Stay near a bank so you can do it with him and receive the receipt 

Thanks India to make everything so

name: namma beach
description: nice beachside parking. quite and chill on weekday. dont know about weekends. no facilities, only nice parking at the beach.

name: Big parking near palace
description: Big parking spot next to the palace. Stayed here 2 nights with our bus. A few buses and cars parked here during the day and almost no one during the night. Good 4G coverage. During the day some locals came to see and greet us but very calm at night. Relatively clean. Walking distance to Mysore mall, markets and anything you need. 100 Rupees per day. Call Deepak +91 77959 00825 if you need a nice guy to show you around in his TukTuk.

name: Hanumanthu Restaurant
description: Very famous restaurant. Best palav/biriany in town.

name: The Crashpad
description:
The best overlander spot. This community of climbers has created an incredible space in the middle of nature, 1 hour from Delhi.  There is a huge green esplanade where you can park, bathrooms and a hot shower, plus they cook lunch and dinner every day.  The price per person per night in your own vehicle or tent is 500r, 1000r if they let you have the tent, and 350r for food.  There is a huge bamboo common room with a rock-climbing wall.  The guys who run it are wonderful and very friendly, it's all self-managed.  If you need a place to relax and enjoy the van life in nature this is the place.  You can contact them at @the_crashpad_mangar.
Recommendation : the place is far from the supermarkets, so it's a good idea to buy everything you need (food and everything) before getting here.

name: Rest area on the Lucknow Agra Expressway
description:
This is a huge parking lot still not finished on the Lucknow Agra express way. This is also a gas station maybe the only one of this highway (be aware !!). 
There is toilets, running water, food court, a lot of space to park. It is very quiet at night ! A good rest area on a highway

name: Nayara fuelsstation with shower
description: Good, clean and warm shower in lady’s washroom at fuelstation.

name: Mehrangarh Fort Parking
description:
Parking area of Mehrangarh Fort. 80/- for the whole day. A lot of space and convenient to visit the Fort and walk down to the city.
On Google it says opening hours are 9-17h, but there is no gate or anything, so it is probably possible to stay longer or even sleep here, might be a good place?

name: Plain
description:
To reach this flat grass plain you have to take a right, when coming from Ellora caves, down a dirt road past a lot of garbage. The road drives past fields. At some point some of the field plains are unused. This place is reachable through a small gap between the trees along the road. Difficult too pass if you are bigger than a small van because of branches. Also good idea with high clearance if you want to get away from the dirt road and more out of site.

We stayd here two night. First night no one came by. Second some locals. One local seemed to want some money, but we were not sure and didn't react and he just left.

There are probably similar places further down the road. But the whole area around the caves is otherwise not that good for freecamping.

name: Bhaje Caves
description:
Unlevel but more or less out of side from a small road. No houses around only nature.

Take a small dirt track from the small asphalt road which goes uphill after Bhaje caves. Follow the dirt track for less than a minute around a curve.

The place is quite unlevel and some garages around, but it is possible to find place for a small van. We have a Landrover 4x4 but it may be possible also with a 2x2.

name: Bangladesh Embassy
description:
Mandatory documents for visa application 

1)Online filled application form

4) solvency certificate from bank
5)COVID vaccination certificate copy

7) 2 passport size photos 
8) request letter from applicant (signed and addressed to - The Visa Officer,  Deputy High Commission for the People's Republic of Bangladesh, Chennai.)

10) current passport copy
11) previous Bangladeshi visa copies , if any.
12) Invitation letter
13) accommodation details at Bangladesh (C form)
14) Declaration stating that the applicant will not be involving in any short or long term employment/ consultation / financial activities during the stay in Bangladesh.

Embassy may ask for additional documents during the process.

Applicants are required to submit hard copies of the relevant documents at the Mission for processing the application.

Documents submission time is from 10am to 11am ( Monday to Friday). Office timing will be strictly followed.

Visa processing takes minimum 7 working days.


*_*Type, Tenure, Entry and Validity of Visa* are subject to the decision of the *Deputy High Commissioner**_.


Cost 4800rupies for European countries

name: Best place to sleep in this area
description: We came at night, nobody disturbed, nobody asked any silly questions. At Reliance petrol pump parking.

name: Temple parking next to highway
description: Large temple parking area next to the NH 48. It is not quiet but no one will disturb you. For the night you have to park close to the entrance because of security.

name: Vijaya Durga Agencies
description: I found this gas-filling spot. My bottle was a normal German bottle but they filled it without any trouble. Good people, speak a little English

name: Goverhand hotel
description: Goverhand hotel in Fatehpur sikri perfect for a night after visiting the city. They charged us 500Ri for parking with access to the bathrooms. They let us stay with our dogs in the garden. Very friendly staff

name: Sunset point
description: On Google it is called Sunset Point. It is not the most beautiful or cleanest place and also loud. No road noise, some people come here of course, but nobody talked to us. There is just the obligatory loud techno music in the distance and in the evening loud music from the bars nearby. After 11pm or so it was quiet, so we slept well. If you can't find anything else, there is space here, but it is not the most relaxing place. The road here is bumpy, but nothing terrible. Also be careful, we are not sure if this is the safest place, maybe don't leave your van here alone.

name: IKEA
description:
Large IKEA parking area. High vehicles can park on a large field in front of the entrance. One place with shade. Only open during the day from 10:30.
In the restaurant you can get free breakfast (Croissant, chocolate paste and hot drinks). There is also wifi and power outlets, if you need to work on your laptop. It is not very busy, so it was nice to relax in a familiar place.

name: Calm place at the beach
description: Very calm place, compared to other places, directly at the beach. Very friendly locals. We cleaned up the beach around us a bit and than it was perfect. The road from the NH66 is small but we got here with just lifting a few cables and we’re driving a big bus. Some small food stalls and groceries are close.

name: near Om and Kudle beach
description:
alternative to other spots on Ioverlander close to Gokarna village. The parking behind Gokarna beach is,really dirty. We did not check the spot above the temple.
Here it is clean. No houses around and not visible from anywhere except a walking  trail leading between the two beaches. We only saw one person on that trail in the morning. No view, though. Just natural surroundings. Some mosquitoes at night but nothing bad. Best with some clearance to get here. From the road leading to stairs down to Kudle beach take a turn of into a bumpy terrain with a small track. Left side of the road. Drive till this point and you are out of sight from road.

name: From India to Bangladesh
description:
EXIT INDIA Going out from India takes about one hour. Very kind all, but not very practiced about the carnet. You need some copies which you can get from Raju “office”. 
Raju will give you the best rate to change euro or dollars.

name: Riverside camp spot
description:
Between farm land this dead end road is only accessible before monsoon.  
It's dirtroad but with full hard road leading towards the river. 
Stayed for nearly 24hrs and didn't see anyone at all. 
Beautiful sunset and sunrise

name: Parking next to stadium
description: There are a few parking spaces around the stadium. One is paid parking. This one was for free. Might be difficult to park here if the is a match. Small restaurants and shops are in and around the stadium. Metro station is very close and Tuktuk also available. Tuktuk to ferry to Fort Kochi was 100Rupees, Taxi was 200. Ferry costs 6 Ruppes per person.

name: Unused field
description:
coming from Vijayapura (Bijapur) you can take a small road to the left before this and the other spot.It begins as a narrow asphalt road and then becomes a dirt track. 

When you arrive at the spot you just drive up on the small hill to the left. A bit bumpy.
Some locals came by but surprisingly no one stopped to speak with us.

name: Perfect spot on the beach
description: Just en the beach, in the middle part, that's perfect because there are anybody, some locals but anybody disturbing us. Easy way to arrive at the beach, just behind its a farm, but nobody comes, maybe it's abandoned. Absolutely amazing sunset in this point. No conexion at all, but you can go to some guest house to ask for the wifi.

name: sleeping place
description: Sleeping place near the street but very calm. Perfect to take a rest. Also with bigger trucks it's possible to reach. 4g is available

name: Camp with a view
description:
Great camp spot near Badami. God view and sunset. Level. Mix of sand and gravel. No garbage.No houses nearby.

The track that leads here is marked on MapsMe and leads to some caves further on.
4x4 needed but not technical.

name: Lonar Crater
description:
Grass area just near the rim of Lonar lake.
[.................... Content deleted by admin ....................] You can walk down to a small temple at the lake shore by following a small trail (wich you can se on MapsMe)

The dirt road leading to the camp spot is also marked on MapsMe. When coming from south it is the first dirt track on the left right before entering the village. There is another dirt track further on but it is closed by a gate.

Some locals came by, and some stopped to talk, but no one seemed to have a problem with us camping.

no 4x4 needed 
not completely level, but okay

name: Nice clearing in wooded area
description: on the way to Kanha NP coming from south. A track leads into the woods  opposite a sign leading to a mine. track drivable also with 2x2. Narrow but opening up at the camp spot. Quit a big rather level area dry grassy area. Just a couple of herds walked by early evening. No habitation around. No roads visible. Only a bit of sound from the road. We saw two wild boars when driving. No litter. Very quiet night. Morning totally undisturbed.

name: Pebbles Restaurant Campsite
description: The owner of Pebbles Restaurant allows to stay behind his restaurant. It's okay but not perfect. But to visit Auroville it's very nice because you can walk in the area. He wants 250rs per night.

name: kikar kund waterfall
description: This waterfall is marked on Maps. If you drive the minor road, route 11 on Maps route SH68 on Mapsme between Kanha NP and Bandargarh NP, this is a very nice option for an overnight stay. We drove about 20-30 min off route 11 along a small country road  through rural landscape t to reach the waterfall. Road is on Maps. Part of it just a track. At the end we passed by a little shrine to reach a clearance above the waterfall. Not very leveled spot, best for smaller vans. Nice view. A couple of locals walked by but there were only two houses from which we were visible but at quite some distance. Very quiet night except this sound from the waterfall. No rubbish. No animals. No 4x4 needed.

name: Wheelostay
description: Hestay,  220volts, free wifi, parking avaliable, showers, strong cell phone signal, lawn, pet friendly, doctor avaliable.

name: Small spot behind ruins
description:
Driving further on from the parking at the fort ticket counter we drove into a ruin area behind the fort. We followed a track marked in MapsMe. It is a very ruined part of the ruin area, does not seem that anyone ever come here to visit.
You have to drive through a very bumpy and stony track at some point, but we think it is okay even without 4x4.

Some recontruction work was going on in the beginning of the ruin area, so I may not be a good overnight spot forever.

We spent to nights here but arrived at at sunset and left in the morning.

A guide at the ticket counter told us that he thought it would be no problem to spent the night at the parking in front of the fort. It is not a big parkinglot but there is room fore a campervan or two.

name: Water hole desert wildcamp
description:
Calm and quite desert wild camp between trees and bushes next to an artificial pond close to the famous Rat Temple.

Some locals come with their animals or just because it's a nice place. Few motorbikes on the gravel road but one of the most peaceful places we have been to in this country.

If you want more peace you can use the gap in the fence at this place to drive off into the wild and find many places.
Another nice spot around 27.795634, 73.365228 right at some sand dunes.

name: Lalita Home Stay
description: Homestay that lets you camp in the spacious and quiet backyard, surrounded by fields. The Dutch host John and the team are very friendly. John understands the needs of overlanders. We could use the amenities in the house (kitchen sink, toilet, washing machine) and shower is possible upon request. Wifi not working at the time of writing, but being fixed. Property has been built with care and evth is very clean.

name: Rekha & Kamla Homestay
description:
Small paradise for overlanders. Wonderful friendly and welcoming family, delicious food. (all organic, freshly from the farm) Perfect for kids to roam around.
We were their first campers, and they don’t speak english but we understood each other and used the amenities but slept in the car.
Farm is very well run and everything clean.
Next to the road but no traffic during the night, only dogs barking.

name: Lime Villa
description: Parking next to Lime Villa Homestay for big rigs and for smaller rigs in the courtyard. The people of Lime Villa are really nice. They let you Park for free. the Homemade food is delicious and they Help to organize a Boat cruise on the Ganges. We booked a room for one Night to get a hot Shower. Laundry service is available too

name: little village
description: We parked our car at a little open place in the forest but after a few hours some locals came to us to say that we were standing in an elephant crossing zone so we had to move because it was not safe. They said that we could park our van next to their houses. So we spend the night in de middle of an little open space surrounded by their houses. Very friendly people! If you are looking for a safe spot in this area we definitely recommend this place but if you want peace and quiteness this place is definitely not the place to be. But after all we had a good night!

name: peaceful land on the edge of mountain
description:
Good silent and peaceful place on the edge of a mountain. 
Good road and amazing view. 

No stray dogs. 
Good internet speed ( Vodafone,  jio both tested).
Great view on the valley

name: bare land opposite face rock
description:
Nearby French Castle and opposite Face rock ( I actually added this to Google as the rock looks like a face).

Anyway. Internet connection requires a little spot finding. A meter to the left and it's full strength. meter to the right: nothing. 

But extremely silent: despite nearby the road. Completely turns silent at night

So very peacefull. The owner of the land is extremely friendly. Just ask him if you can stay and he'll be fine.

name: Next to a lake and temple
description: Small area next to a street where no 4x4 is required. You can hide behind some trees and nobody was disturbing the night. Some trash around. Maybe busy at the weekend but we don‘t know as we slept here during the week.

name: Good restaurant
description: streetside small restaurant, fresh good cooking according to your taste, eg not spicy. One can park over night, very few cars. Very friendly.

name: LG guest house
description: Truly great guesthouse. Family who runs it build it themselves and did a beautiful job. Family is very kind and gave a lot of tips for getting around the city. Location is walking distance from the fort. We could park our motorcycle inside. There is room for 2 motorcycles. No parking available for 4 wheelers and don't think they will be able to drive up the narrow streets.

name: The Heritage Piti Jalsa
description: A new property located just at the entry of Kaza before the bus stand near Zostel Kaza. Travelling in frigid Spiti Winters we reached in evening to find Zostel closed. On further enquiry we met Jaskaran @ 9888833363 and he welcomed us to the hotel. 5 cozy mud rooms have been constructed with a common washroom and common dining area. Served homely food by Tandup ji. It’s a point to note that very few hotels and home stays are open in winters in Kaza. We paid ₹4000 per room per night including two meals. The property formally will open in May 2023 with more rooms and a cafe.

name: Ganges river
description: Very peaceful place on the river Ganges.  Nearby there is a village with basic products for survival.  Park rangers do not patrol this place.

name: Parking near museum
description: If you arrive too late at the tiger sanctuary, the gate guard may not let you in.  A good place for one night because there are temples in the area that play the mantra all the time.  Street food and local traders in the area. Toilet and water tap available in cafe on museum.

name: Oriental Insurance
description: Oriental insurance office where you can purchase insurance for your international vehicle. it costs around 100 euros and it is possible to add Nepal and Bangladesh for a small extra.

name: Spiti Mud Huts, Tabo
description: A beautiful hotel in Tabo near the helipad. Great place to acclimatise before heading to area beyond Kaza. We paid ₹3500 per room. Served great meal.

name: River view campsite
description: Cell phone connectivity , inside the river beds , 3.0 kms from the main national highway 44 , free parking , water , Wi-Fi , food on order , generator in demand , bird site seeing in morning , safari arrangement, bonfire and river boating optional

name: Fabrico
description: Washes and dries within 4 to 5 hours. One kilo costs 69 INR. Tel number shown on photo is not correct. The right one is +91 7513500817

name: Dev Hotel
description: Good restaurant and free parking in the quiet backyard of the hotel, if you eat here.

name: Royal restorant
description:
Good food, rooftop restaurant,
 free parking over night, free shower

name: Field with trees next to NH30
description: Next to NH30 and reachable from both directions, no middle barrier. Large field with trees next to a river. Not very quiet because of the highway and tempel music, but nobody disturbed us and it was a good place for sleeping. Here are unfortunately a lot of mosquitos.

name: The quietest place in India
description:
200 meters from the viewpoint a small 1,5km dead end road leads to a lake and dam at the end. Halfway there, stay left at the fork. A few times a shepherd and someone curious from the dam company walked along here, but besides that there is nobody and all were friendly or didn't talk to us. It is really quiet, the view is nice, shaded parking and great to relax. We went swimming in the cool lake and walked down the stairs to the bottom of the dam to a small river and waterfall. Apparently it is not allowed to walk on the dam, even though many people do.
No Airtel reception in the whole area.
When coming from Goa, the mountain road goes very steep uphill. From the other direction the main road is narrow and bumpy, just so you know that it is not the easiest or quickest drive here.

name: LPG auto gas
description: LPG distribution with an Italian refueling system.  They refill gas cylinders if you have adapter.

name: Forest
description:
Several good places on the eastern side of the canal. We spent a day here, waiting for covid test results. It is visible from the road, but the road is much less busy than on the Banbasa side. Taking a bridge further south also allows easier access to the border. (At least during pilgrimage season, there was thousands of people using the bridge in Banbasa town)
Some villagers collecting wood and pilgrims taking a rest, everyone friendly, but left us alone mostly.
There are crocodiles along the canal.

name: S Pandey & Company Office
description:
Office of S Pandey & Company where you meet, discuss and sign papers.
3rd floor - tell lift man you look for "s pandeh"

name: Petrol Station
description: Behind petrol pump, free drinking water, Free Air for vehicle tyre pressure, Wi-Fi , washrooms , Tents available on Request , Genset power back up 24 hrs , CCTV cameras .

name: Belur
description: Quiet wild  camping at a lake near the town. Nice sunset. Close to famous temple. Unfortunately no restaurant nearby.

name: wild camping
description: marvellous quit spot, nice landscape and sunset

name: Raj Tower
description: Available high speed internet and office space for working.

name: Beach parking
description: marvellous beach parking between village and sea. Trees for shade. Friendly villagers. Low hanging cables.

name: Durga temple + rooms
description:
temple in the middle of mountains. they have double rooms for 300rps, free meel in the evening. 
there is a little shop next to the temple (samosa, sweets, water,...)

name: Nightparking in Kochi
description: Silent and shady parking ground next to public football field. Very close to Kerala Kathakali Centre which performs every day excellent shows on classical dancing and classical music. Very authentic.

name: peacefull wild grass land
description:
A hidden gem. Spent a night and day here and haven't encountered anyone.
Birds are all around. Nearto Forrest area.  Safe and peaceful. 

Both Jio and Airtel are working properly.

name: River bank
description: A nice place after the fields next to a river. Many locals and tractors during the day working the fields but quiet during the night (slept with a door open). From Shravasti, the road is quite sandy but was no problem for our 2WD van. In darkness 2 fishermen came and asked for a 'parking fee' after pulling out a random piece of paper from their pockets but when we laughed and did not give them any money, they left. The next day we had a good 45min chat with the Police but were eventually allowed to stay with their phone number. Most peaceful spot we had stayed at for weeks.

name: next to the river
description: A dirt road off the bridge connecting villages, fields are a bit further away. Quiet spot though used as a transit road. Only a few villagers came to say hello, and no police. Many spots along the road to park the car without being in anybody's way.

name: Parking at the Sai Baba Diner
description: Parking near the Sai Baba eatery where they feed pilgrims for free.  There is plenty of shade which taxi drivers use during the day.  Peace and quiet at night.

name: Riverside
description: Quiet parking next to the river. We stayed a couple of days without any disturbance. You have to cross a bridge, turn right and then drive past a few houses (old hospital). Behind the houses is a water pump, also at Indian Oil just before the bridge, you can fill up water. In the next small village (1km) are many small shops and restaurants. Good phone reception. There are places with a nicer view in this area, but this was so far the most quiet.

name: Next to the road in amazing scenery
description:
Space next to the road. Not totally level but ok. Amazing scenery. About 6km from the tunnel and 1km before Koksar. On the bridge at this town is a checkpoint. Until mid may the road is closed towards the Spiti valley for tourists, because of the snow. In the evening there was however no control and cars could pass.
Just mind that this place is super touristic. Maybe we were unlucky, but during the day several hundred tourist taxis parked here and it was super crowded. At 5pm everyone was gone again. No Airtel phone reception here. Towards Sissu reception gets better.

name: Wild land inside the farmlands and jungle
description: A road leads there, it's a bit rocky and you'll need some ground clearance to proceed. There are multiple patches of unused rock/farmland. On arrival we've seen so goats and their owners but that's all. it's extremely silent.

name: Gandikota cliff, Indias grand canyon
description: Am amazing location suitable to large and small rigs. The view is amazing. The location secluded. Be aware of the temprature. It's extremely peaceful and the view is breath taking.

name: Next to road and farm land
description: Silent place not too far from the road. Nearby a waterpoint for RO water. Peaceful when we where there ( weekday) but signs of drinking ( bottles) probably in weekend. recent bottles.

name: Near a lake and Mango farm
description:
It's near a waterbody. Very peaceful. 
While we stayed here only some locals who played cricket came. 
In monsoon it might need 4x4 to reach.

name: Next to ocean. View sunrise
description:
Small and comfortable place next to the ocean. 10+ fishing boats call this place home. 

The locals will come but are friendly. 
Nice sunrise. Beautiful warm ocean. 

Parking area isn't too large so although big rigs can fit you might need to check.

name: Farm land next to a lake.
description:
Some farmland away from the main road and close to the highway.
Beautiful sunset. No mosquitoes. No locals. No stray dogs. 

Not reachable for tall rigs due to power lines over the entry road. 2.5
2.2mtr (ish) is max height.

name: Next to fishermans lake
description: Stunning sunset. Remote location but you'll find some locals who come to say hi. Very friendly people.

name: Riverside. Leh Road
description:
The road to Leh is closed after Darcha until some time in May (depending on the snow). Jispa is the last village before that. Here are a few options to park around this helicopter landing pad, or even on it. Next to it is an unused Tibetan temple. To get closer to the river was not possible with a van, but with car or bike it works. The views are great. In town are a few restaurants and guest houses, it's a touristic area. But there are more shops and everything in Keylong.
Airtel reception is not the best.
Many construction workers camp and hang out at the helipad, not sure if it is always like that. They also use the river as washroom. So best to go a couple of hundred meters upstream, if you want to camp at the river.
We didn't have any problems and stayed several days. It is very quiet, nobody disturbed us and the locals are really friendly.

name: dead end in middle of nowhere
description:
it's a deadend road. middle of nowhere. 
all day we didn't see anyone. Beach is on walkable distance.

name: Clearance with mountain view
description:
It is really difficult to find a decent wild camping spot in the Srinagar surroundings!! After a rather noisy night at the Swiss hotel parking we just needed  peace.
with a small 4x4 this place is a very nice option. Only the last bit of drive up to clearance requires 4x4.
Get of the Srinagar Leh road between the villages of Buna Muang and Kijpora. The side road leads up to Naranag. There are habitations anywhere along the road for many km but after driving around 2 km there is a rough side track at the left side at something that looks like a water reservoir tank. Drive up till the clearance. Visible from the entire valley but long distance, no habitation nearby. 
very quiet at night except sound from artificial "waterfall" in the valley and nobody passed by till mid morning where a couple of locals walked by. 
Clean at our spot although dirty along the track leading up. Very nice views.

name: Remote area with hammock trees
description:
Peacefull area with 2 trees for a Hammock. 

We stayed 2 nights. Locals don't bother. Extremely silent. 
Beautiful surroundings.

name: In front of ocean
description:
beautiful local beach. no crowd. 
in front of temple ( sound after sunrise).

Extremely friendly locals. 
Bear warning: do not be outside at night. 

Magnificent location.

name: spot next to a river
description: Next to a river behind a tiny village, just turn towards the riverbank and you can park there easily. People are friendly looked at us for a bit, that was it. You can hear the road, but you are not really visible. (4G Airtel)

name: little spot at a side road
description: Drive up to the abandoned green house (you can hear the car's, but you are not visible) next to a small river, very quiet and green. 4g airtel

name: dugri forest
description: Quiet spot in the forest, a few good small spots for a camper/4x4 around, 4g airtel

name: Café NoMads
description: Amazing tea with European style pizza, good prices and generally top food. The owner helped me a lot to get around in Orchha finding a place to sleep etc. Place has a chill vibe and even better terrace

name: Hotel Raghav regency
description: it has a big nice parking space. i stayed here for 500 rupees in the car. rooms themselves are alright clean and very spacious.

name: Hiranya Resort - Basecamp backpackers campsite
description:
Great camping location only 8km for Ellora caves - peaceful and secure.  Large spaces for vehicle camping plus tents provided on nice lawn area for back packers. Other cabin Accomodation also. It’s a large facility with different open space areas. We visited over a weekend and resort had lots of guests but only two campers so plenty of private space. Breakfast included.  Restaurant for other meals if required. Security guard in area at night. 

Natural locations Lots of birds and monkeys. 

This campsite is shown as Basecamp Backpackers on Google maps. hard to find on google maps it’s part of Hiranya Resort so once off the highway follow the signs to the resort and go to resort office.

name: Bundeli Farm Resort
description: Orchha is an amazing place to visit and this spot is a good base. Really large resort under construction with lots of vacant blocks. You can rent a villa or they are also building a small hotel. We camped in the pool compound a few hundred meters from the main area. Nice pool, grass area and clean showers and toilets. A few Guests visited the pool until 8pm then the gate was locked and we had the space to ourselves. A bit expensive - they charged us IR1700 but for a very secure, very quiet spot with our own pool it was a good option for us in the heat of summer. About 10 minutes drive from the town where there are amazing heritage buildings, temples and palaces in great condition. We stayed 2 nights but could easily have stayed for three with so much to see and do here.   Note Poor intermittent mobile coverage

name: Next to a lake. small dead end path
description:
Small dirt path at the end of a village. 

Local come but don't disturb

nights very silent. 

no stray dogs. 
5g internet.

name: Next to road but quiet
description:
About 100m next to the road on the way to Leh, but quiet. Good to stay for one night.
Here are two very cute dogs, so maybe bring something to eat for them.
Phone reception is good.

name: Chemre monastery
description:
Parking along the road to the monastery. Not the best campsite, but for us it was good for a day and night. If you have an offroader or bike you could drive a couple of hundred meters into the mountains and are totally alone.
The view of the monastery and village is incredible and it is very quiet. During the day a few cars drive up and down, but besides that nothing happens. 
The monastery is not very touristic, but worth a visit if you are here and entry is free.
Good phone reception, but no shops or anything.

name: Tso Kar Lake
description:
From Leh road take the small road which is in excellent condition. After about 15km comes a village with many restaurants, shops, a Tibetian monastery and a water pump (infront of the building with big prayer wheels).
Another 5km further there is a short gravel track to the lake. Unbelievable scenery, wide and open landscape with mountains all around and very quiet. Be careful to not get stuck, after rain it could be muddy. It is a salt lake with a lot of mudd and wet lands around, so no swimming or anything like it. We tried SUPing, but it was a desaster. It can also be very very windy, probably not a good area for tents. In June we had temperatures just below 0°C at night, but during the day it was warm. Some tourist taxis come here, but you are mostly alone.

name: Ghagaria Camp Resort
description:
This is a glamping site on the way to Valley of Flowers NP. It's only accessible by foot and pack animal along a cobbled trail but also by helicopter if you have the money for that kind of thing. No vehicles allowed. We were quoted 2500 INR per night by we asked for a 2- night discount, and they dropped the price to 2000 INR per night. This place is one of several glamping sites here, and it's on the highest terrace. The tents are fully furnished with beds and lots of bedding. The tents have power outlets and lights. The power here seems slightly more reliable than the rest of India has been. The tents have private bathrooms with sit- down toilets, soap at the sink, and a tap for a cold bucket shower. There doesn't seem to be paper, though. Food up here is about 2-3+ times the price it is in Joshimath. 

Entry to the National Park was 600 INR per person for foreigners as of June 2023. Compared to the temple and lake hike for the pilgrimage, the park was almost empty. It felt like we had the entire thing to ourselves for most of the day when we went in at 7 AM and then out-hiked everyone else. Lots of food/ drink is available at small cafes on the trek up and towards the lake, but there are no services in the park.

name: Hundar Sand Dunes
description:
Between two towns (Diskit and Hundar) there is this gravel track going through the sand dune area. It is very busy during the day with a lot of tourists taxis driving to the big car park on the western edge and also a lot of locals that use the river for washing. It's like a huge fun fair with huge crowds and hundreds of camels for camel riding. Not really the beautiful and quiet nature we were looking for...
However, there are a lot of possibilities to park next to the road, but it is very very busy. At night some people had a party, so we also didn't sleep well, but maybe you are more lucky or find a place further away from the road.

name: Cafè paradiso
description: The best coffee espresso in Alappuzha, good location and good staff (joe)

name: Airtel
description: Can buy pre paid sim here, need an Indian friend that can receive a OTP to set it up in store though. 500 for 1.5gb per day

name: Permit office
description: Apply here for permission to visit the outer areas like Nubra valley, need photo copies of passport, page in passport with visa stamp, and visa. Not very helpful or friendly, I’d probably use one of the agents down the street a little way next time

name: Barot Valley Zero Point
description: It’s a wild camping spot besides Uhl river. Have been camping here with two tents and 8 friends. Besides the road but very less traffic. No services at site but beautiful deodar tress cover. Fabulous sound on the river. Lot of brown trout for fishing. Licence required for the same though.

name: Empty landscape above Lamayuru
description: Super quiet and lonely field above Lamayuru. Nobody comes here, we have seen just one person the whole day. Can be difficult to find a flat spot. Phone reception is good. It's just two minutes off the main road NH1 and you can still see Lamayuru monastery. Good for relaxing and take a walk into town.

name: free asphalted place
description:
nice calm place to stay close to border. nice neighbours. few indians coming at daytime for cricket or evening with friends, but dont disturb us. calm night in the nature next to main road. watertab! close by are shops. 
they dont want you to sleep at wahga border, here we found a really good spot. carwashing other side of the road (300rs).

we didnt like the border ceremony cause it was very very loud and propaganda. we left it. special too loud for kids!

name: Waterfall
description: Nice waterfall, they worth a visit

name: Waterfall
description:
Other waterfall worths a visit. 
Btw road is amazing in the middle of forest.
You don’t need to pay again, ticket is valid for both waterfall

name: Up the cliff
description: Following this road you can find different spots where you can stay overnight

name: Green park
description: Benny is one of that person can make your day! He is a good soul that loves to share to skills of plants. I think you should pay a visit to him, and in case he has 2 tree house where you can sleep

name: Graveyard with horse
description: In this beautiful old graveyard there is something unusual: an horse’s tomb

name: Exchange money
description: If you need exchange money here it’s the place BIG SHOP

name: LITTLEARTH
description: Im pretty sure this is one of the most western spot (coffee and super market) you can find in the entire south India

name: SIMCARD AIRTEL
description:
Here you can buy your sim card for the big north (450rupies one month)

 gulshan
9906116420

name: Permit for restricted areas
description: If you want reach highest mountain,  here you have to apply your permission (few hours, 700rupies)

name: Bistro Boulevard
description: Fancy western coffee for your espresso & croissant

name: Supermarket
description: Quite western supermarket but they don’t accept international credit cards

name: Exchange office
description: Best rate in the city!!! In LADAKH it’s much worst!!!! Remember it

name: Mohsin house
description:
Mohsin is an extremely kind person, that kind of person loves foreign travelers from all around the world.  He invited me to his house, offering me food and time just for the pleasure to share experiences.

He has a little second house in front of his home, where you can camp and even have a bath 

Feel free to contact him, and Please approach him if you really love the idea of sharing experiences and time, he is a very good souls 

Phone/whatsup 
0091 9858689943

name: Running water next to the street
description: Next to the road are several water taps. The locals told us it was drinking water.

name: Devik Hotel
description: Dekid hotel is located at the end of Keylong village square. The staff is super friendly, food is amazing and you can park your car at the main square. If your car has foreign plates you will make friends with the full village. Really recommended for altitude acclimatization towards Leh.

name: Between road and river
description: Large empty area next to the road. Good for a lunch break, resting or even staying for one night. If you park close to the river, you almost don't hear the road anymore. Not too much traffic anyway. Weak phone reception unfortunately.

name: flat beside solar field
description: quite spot, even you are visible from the street, but nobody cares and nobody came by.

name: on the top
description:
big flat area beside the pass.
Nobody there, but a niche view around.

name: Zanskar River
description: quite place directly at the Zanskar River. Visible from the street, but far away.

name: Salt & Pepper restaurant
description: It is a nice and clean restaurant with friendly, helpful stuff. It's just opposite the dragon supermart.

name: Dragon supermart
description: Well sorted supermarket with all the stuff for the next part of the journey.

name: Sandy Flats
description: Huge sandy flat area with a good view at snowy mountains and a monastery.

name: Himalaya Adventure Store
description: This place sells a decent selection of camping gear and outdoor clothes at reasonable prices. I was able to find a "real" foam sleeping mat here after having no luck since Manali. They also sell has canisters for small stoves and other stuff too.

name: River Greens
description:
A small maddow with rocks next to the river. it's a quiet place with a nice view.
The front part will  be used for bus washing in the evening, so it's better to find a place in the back.
it's probably the last chance to find a sleeping place below 4000m altitude when you arrive from Leh.
poor internet coverage with airtel.
Some restaurants near the bridge.

name: Spot near rivers
description:
This is one of the best spot I found in India, quite easy to reach (just 200m of bumpy road… but if I manage on a Vespa, you can do it easily!!). I stayed here in low season, very quiet and wonderful nature. In high season I think it will packed of people. Enjoy and please, CLEAN THE AREA as much as you can, let’s keep this world clean giving a good example.

(In front of a resort 50m far there is a hand fountain with water)

name: Jaipur Delhi Cab - Taxi Service
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Added by owner/manager.

A name that can be relied on, JAIPUR DELHI CAB was launched in 2014 with an objective of creating a smooth intercity transportation platform to solve every commuter’s problem. Within a year of its operation, they are now on its way to become a leading name in the industry. Their ultimate destination is to become a synonym of best name in outstation travel. It is the Top class taxi in jaipur. Jaipur to Delhi One-Way Taxi is the one way taxi in jaipur.

name: Hotel Uran Plaza
description: Small hotel of 6 rooms on a spacious beach front area. Lovely staff with nice meals served.  Veg and non-veg food cooked to order and reasonably priced. Not far from Nhava Sheva port. We waited here while our vehicle cleared customs. Owner Jennifer Pereira was very helpful with connections for local arrangements. Space to park in the grounds. Private and secure.

name: Jio Store for India Simcard.
description: Very helpful Guys in this store! They try a lot do make it easy for you to get a Indian Sim.

name: Hotel Sach Pass
description: You can stay here before cross the Sach Pass. Simple clean Hotel with great view and little restaurant and shop.

name: Airtel SIM street seller
description: The man in the shop Airtel asked us for a person of reference and finally send us here. He asked 500 roupies/SIM card (1.5GB/day) to activate without person of reference.

name: Dhaba Fuelstation
description: fuel station with petrol an Gasoiline. On the Street cross to Nubravalley.

name: Fuelstation Tangtse
description: Indian Oil Tangtse, fill up if you can. Diesel and Petrol.

name: Parking Gurudwara Gangsar sahib
description: Car parking next to the Sikh temple. Very nice to learn with the community. They allowed us to stay overnight. So nice people.

name: Chandigarh Homestay
description:
Very peaceful loving people. Beautiful Garden and very quiet place. Closed to restaurants and shops. There is a garden for children and Ronnie will help you to know what to see in the city. 
Please call him before arriving: +91 81949 85494

name: Sukhna Silence Garden Parking
description: Parking at the end of the road, just nearby the Silence Garden. Very quiet during the day, just people coming for their sport early morning and evening. Quiet night. Easy for all vehicules, and easy to park. Police came and never say nothing.

name: Hitkari Farms
description:
Wedding hall that welcomed us inside of their parking. They give access to facilities. 

Only available out of the season of weddings. 

!!! You need to call before and check with the owner if it is ok : Mr Subhash TYAGY +91 99713 49191

name: Small laundry place
description:
Small Laundry from the village. Very nice guy. 
50 roupies /towel and small bedsheets, 150 roupies for big bed sheets, 10 for small items.

name: Parking Deeg Fort
description: Fort’s parking. You need to park in the side to let motorbike enter and go out. Street noise, ok for one night out of the crowded touristic place. Small village, shops around available.5 minutes to walk to the palace.

name: Parking Keoladeo National Park
description: Keoladeo National Park has a private parking area for 60 roupies /day (from morning to night). They allowed us to Overnight. It costs 120 roupies for the 2 days. Entry to the park cost 851 roupies/adult. Also possible to get rickshaws and guided tour.

name: Lovely Yoga Retreat Sanatan Yog
description: If you are looking for a peaceful and personal yoga retreat, then you have come to this place. We spent a week at Sanatan Yog and stayed in their beautiful backyard. We always felt part of Sanatan's family with a long historical past. To make a reservation, call or text Sanatan (+91 96720 22207). Private or open courses are available. Yoga sessions take place in the temple under the supervision of the Hindu gods. They also have accommodation facilities. Several beautiful and delicious restaurants are in waking distance.

name: Tserkamo monastery
description:
Beautiful monastery and temple at the end of a small valley. Super quiet and far away from the main tourist hotpots. Just a few locals come here for praying. 
We were invited by Lama Samtem of the German NGO "Himalaya Haus" while another German travel group stayed here for a few days.
It's a peaceful place with great views, a beautiful garden, it's own spring, a super old tree and small cave up the steps on the mountain, where 800 years ago the monastery was founded by a monk.
We stayed below the main parking lot, there we had our own space and it's more level. There are also guest rooms and even a kitchen and dining room. Not sure if you could stay in one of the rooms and how to book it, but parking with a camper here for the night is no problem. Tent should also easily be possible. The people are very friendly and welcoming. It's a great place to visit and to relax tor a couple of days.
Only very weak phone signal available at the entrance gate, the tower is in the previous village.

name: Bush camp by the river (near road)
description: Nice Bushcamp on riverbank. opposite bank high cliffs. river access by foot. quite close to road but high grass/weeds give enough shelter for tent.

name: flat ground and river access. Visible from road!
description: Big flat open area next to river with high grass and bushes. beautiful spot near river yet very exposed to looks from the roads. you will almost certainly be visited by locals. not sure if allowed to camp but looks like public land

name: flat open spot near river. exposed to road
description:
Big flat open area which looks like has been camped on many times. near some houses and right next to road. unsure if allowed to camp or not
google says official camp ground on other side of river

name: Saini Homestay
description:
Nice little homestay. clean, decent mattress, no a/c only fan. friendly staff. bike parking out front, not quite off the road but feels safe. 
700 rupees a night for a double ensuite room. seems like the most affordable option around

name: Amazing view - Feet in the water
description: Nice camp on a "beach" with amazing view. Flat, lot of space. No airtel connection but next to a Free WiFi spot.

name: Free Parking next Mehrangarh Fort
description: Free Parking with view on Fort and Jaswan Thada. Quiet for the night. Some people come to give food to the birds, and other People come early in the morning to do their sport. But they are kind.

name: Pushkar Free Bus Parking
description: Bus station with free parking available. Men’s from the shops are very friendly. Easy to reach the centre of Pushkar by foot. Some bus come the night and people sleep on the ground but they are not noisy, and not disturbing at all.

name: Pali small lake
description: Some space in the « nature », nearby the lake. Very quiet. People from the neighbor farm are friendly. Some Birds to see around the lake and enjoy the quietness. Occidental supermarket nearby - they accept VISA (see location).

name: Smart Reliance Supermarket
description: Big supermarket with « occidental » food and material. It accepts international cards (visa).

name: Side valley with river
description:
Nice side valley. Initially, there is a gravel road for 150m.
Sandy spots for tents.
Must check rain forecast as the "whole valley seems to be a riverbed for extreme rainfalls.
Many bushes to hide the tent behind.
River is almost cancelling the noise out from the highway. 
Small river seems clean. I filtered the water though.

name: Grease Moto Club Kaza - Spiti Valley
description: Awesome motorcycle hostel complete with a full garage and mechanics. Super comfy dorms at 700 rupees with breakfast, lunch, and, dinner available at an additional charge. Great place to meet other bikers and share some beers.

name: Park place near abandonned house
description: Place where you can park, building nearby is abandoned. Easy to reach for big rigs. For big vehicles it is better to stay there and go to Abou Mont with a taxi, bus or hitchhiking. D’armadas temple really worth it.

name: Beautiful place in nature at a small lake.
description: Cool place for a day or two. Some shepherds visited us. Access to the lake possible. Some young people swimming and washing themselves here. You have to expect interested spectators. Take a walk around the lake.

name: Wild campsite with enough space to park and a flat area up on some rocks
description: This whole area is very prone to landslides, so it's possible that this is a very dangerous spot to camp. But we decided to stay here instead of looking for a homestay in Nerak village just up to the road. We camped here while driving autorickshaws through the Zanskar Valley. It's just off the road and is a really beautiful campsite. There was some garbage, and lots of animal droppings. Please keep the area clean.

name: LPG Filling pump « AUTOGAS »
description:
Nice service. Possible with « coupelle » like France/Turkey. 
Price 69,57 INR/L. (02/10/2023)

name: Aruchanal Pradesh Bhawal
description: This is where you can apply for permits to visit Aruchanal Pradesh. Very helpful.

name: White House
description:
It's a guest house with small parking facility. The rooms are good with AC and it's also the cheapest in Lucknow. Use reference of Babla Da (+91 99840 63943) to get a rate of Rs. 800 per night. He's a well known biker and traveler.

Here's a number of hotel guys: +91 95605 91039 & +91 93356 61726

Please don't call in the number via Google Maps because OYO handles that.

name: Ashok travels
description:
Travel agencies that also offer money exchange. Office is at the 2nd floor (outdoor scales). 
Rate was Ok.

name: Reliance Smart
description:
Grocery supermarket. 
They do not have visa (10/2023).

name: Meshwo Dam Viewpoint
description:
Lake Viewpoint. Crowded during the day and you will probably have to make some selfies, but very quiet and fresh night, and quiet in the morning. Beautiful sunset on the lake. OK for big rigs. 

We could see that it is also possibility to park down near the temple, maybe less people but no view.

name: Camping at a quite fuel station
description: Good place to stay overnight on the way to Rakchham. The owner invited us for a nice spicy dinner. Surprisingly quiet overnight

name: Indian Oil Gas Station
description: Here you can have your LPG gas tanks and cylinders filled. Very friendly Guys

name: Bhairon Mandir Parking
description:
Protected parking pretty central located. Good place for sightseeing and staying overnight. Relatively quiet for Delhi.

Maybe currently one of the pest options for Big Rig’s - great 5g connection!

name: Hotel Aastha
description:
Nice hotel with super friendly staff. They have a restaurant and good wifi.
Price for a single room is 525 rp. Double room is 600 rp.

name: Umlingla residency hanley
description:
I stayed here as a starting point to go to Umling La. Hotel with private rooms and big parking space. I paid 3000 for a room including dinner and breakfast. The price is so high because its remote. Probably you can find a cheaper homestay in this town. There are many. 
This hotel sells petrol since there is no petrol station (nearest one is at Karu). I dont know the price because i brought my own petrol. 

There is hot water in the evening.

name: Umling La (highest motorable pass in the world)
description:
Umling La is the highest motorable pass in the world (5800 meter). It is located near Hanle. 
To get there you need a permit which you can get in Leh. (I got asked for my permit at the Upshi checkpoint). 
There are multiple routes to take to get to Umling La. The easiest one is to go to Hanle. And from there go to Umling La. There are no petrolstations in this area. The last petrol station coming from Leh is at Karu. So bring enough petrol. 
The route Hanle - Photi La - Umling La is all paved. (Around 90 km)

Before going here make sure the pass is open.

name: Jaisalmer Hostel Crowd
description:
Nice and clean Hostel close to the Castle / Fort.
Surprisingly clean and very dedicated staff. Probably because the owner is German.
We needed a tailor to repair our soft luggage and staff took care of it over night.
Dorm or double rooms available.
After a tough ride through the hot desert on our motorbike we‘ve been so lucky to find this place

name: Wild Himalaya Glamping Camp
description: This is a small and peaceful campground situated on a mountainside among apple orchards with a beautiful view of the valley and mountains to the East. They offer 3 furnished glamping tents and space for 3-4 small tents if you have your own. There's a small cafe/restaurant on site with great food. Toilets with running water as well as power available here, but no shower. Parking is slim, good for motorcycles, bicycles, and backpackers. small vehicles ok. No secure parking but safe area.

name: Diskit, Nubra
description: Sonu Motorcycle Mechanic. Good and reliable motorbike mechanic. Open thru the day till about 7 in the evening.

name: Money 2 money forex
description: Travel agency. Exchange money. Good rate and friendly.

name: TiNY HOMESTAY
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: place has not been verified by an overlander

Welcome to Tiny Homestay in Shimla, nestled in the scenic hill station of Shimla! Our cozy and comfortable accommodation offers you the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Our home stay is conveniently located and easily accessible by car, with ample parking space for three or more vehicles. As soon as you enter our charming abode, you will be greeted by a small but functional kitchen, equipped with all the necessary amenities to cook your own meals. You can savor your meals on the balcony, which offers stunning views of the surrounding mountains and greenery.

The bedroom is cozy and comfortable, with a warm and inviting ambiance. It features an attached bathroom that is clean and well-maintained, providing you with all the basic necessities. We understand the importance of staying connected, and that's why we offer free WiFi to all our guests, so you can stay connected to your loved ones, browse the internet, or catch up on work.

Our Tiny Home Stay is perfect for couples, small families, or solo travelers who are looking for a peaceful and relaxing stay in Shimla. Whether you want to explore the natural beauty of the region, indulge in some adventure activities, or simply relax and unwind, our home stay is the perfect base for you. So come and experience the beauty of Shimla at our Tiny Home Stay – we can't wait to welcome you!

Kamla Nehru hospital is 20 minutes uphill walking
HPPSC exam center is 15 minutes uphill walking
St Edward's School is 10 minutes uphill walking
Portmore school is 15 minutes uphill walking
DAV New Shimla Exam center is 4KM
ICAR-Central Potato Research Institute is 500 meters away 
BCS School is 1KM away

Room start from 700 a night

name: Big green lawn among the pines
description: Large green meadow among the pines with several flat spots.  During the day it is frequented by people who come for picnics.  There are many dogs, but they are only looking for food and cuddles.  The view of the mountains is very beautiful.  At night, perhaps we were unlucky, at 11pm some young people arrived with loud music.  When they left there was a beautiful silence.

name: Ride inn Cafe
description:
Hotel and Cafe.
The owner is also a Motorcycle driver and for foreigner tourist he make special price's. we paid 2160 rupees incl. taxes. for a big spacious and clean room, normal price is 2700 incl taxes.
Definitely a stop worth even just to eat or drink a beer.

name: Mitra 2.0 Hostel
