Permit can be purchased here as well (beside Rekong Peo).
There was a „inner line checkpoint“ in Akpa on the way but I cycled just through, probably one also could stop and get through by telling them to buy it in Pooh.

Office is in the main building on the left after entering the gate. Room 203 is where you get the permit or will be send first to the copy and forms place…
100R for copies and forms.
200R for the Permit.

more infos for this Permit:
https://raachotrekkers.com/ilp-permit-kinnaur-spiti/

name: Two Dhabas right on the road
description: Cyclists can refill their water here instead of carring too much up. There are no springs along the road to here…

name: SNV Restaurant Rooms & Tents
description: Camp which accepts tent for 200INR. Nice view, close to the road and random music outside

name: Goko's Valley View Hotel
description: Tea Shop and Camping site in Dzuleke next to road side. Place is in Dzuleke, after the petrol pump. Goko, a local friendly lady runs the place, its a tea shop, great views and a cozy place. She is helpful and allows to pitch tent or car camp nearby. Great place to stop and unwind. Toilet and flowing water avaliable. Great place for simple dal chawal and tea. An ideal location as a base camp for Dzuleke. Cell network is avaliable some distance away.

name: Cellphone 5G Network (Jio)
description: SIM based Jio Network avaliable at this spot, 5G internet speed is good. Spot is next to a milestone.

name: Shanti guest house
description:
Amazing location, open from June to September
Asked 1500, negociate 1200 for a basic bedroom and 2 meals
Many French coming there

name: Shinkula top
description:
Small restaurant at the top, they accepted to share their shelter to put my tent for free.
Busy with noisy tourists at day, quiet at night
Full asphalt from Manali, then mainly gravel to go north

name: Last chance camp
description: Beautiful view but full of trash. Just enough space for 2 people tent

name: little shop on the way to the top
description: The only shop I found between the beginning of zanskar road and the top of the climb. Very helpful

name: Dragon guest house
description:
1500 for a large bedroom and 3 meals. Many other guest houses around, give them a try. 
Best village I have seen so far. Amazing sunset and hikes around

name: Nice house and green area
description: Local worker from NPD road come here to get phone connection. It's a private area where people are welcomed. I pitched my tent for 200INR

name: Little shop
description: Little shop with snacks, Chai and Maggi. There enough space to pitch a tent

name: Chagar guest house
description:
Very basic guest house for 500inr
Very nice people
Toilets outside in a trailer
No shower, simple pipe outside
Little shop with snacks and restaurant on demand

name: road closed for construction
description:
The NPD road is closed from here going to north. I was able to cycle it from 4am
The road to Yulchumg is open (4900m)

name: road closed
description: NPD is closed for 60km from here and further south. Some people are able to cycle it

name: Tourist Reception Center
description:
In this pretty complex on the second floor, you'll find the office that issues trekking permits. As of July 2024, foreigners are not allowed to solo trek in Kashmir so hiring a guide or joining a trip is compulsory. I was quoted between 2450-4000 INR per day for a guide in July, the more expensive ones include food and horse.
documents required for permit:
- your passport
-a medical exam (can be done at "Modern Hospital" in ~1 hour for 400-600 rupees)
- your travel insurance
- your guide's details
- your guide's company insurance

name: The Hosteller - Mcleodganj Bagsu
description: Nice hostel with lots of space, Cafe and a small parking garage for motorbikes and cars

name: lower road for asphalt
description:
The southern road is nicely on asphalt while the more northern one is under constrution until 2028.
It was possible to cycle the northern one today but tooked lots of energy and was not nice seeing the smooth other side. 
You could visit the very old (ppl say 3000years) Phukthar Monastery/Gompa on that side. To do so it‘s better to enter through the road with the sign for the guesthouse there because the hikingpath (east side of the side valley) was completly block from the roadworks there!

name: Terraces with view
description:
Camp perfect for cyclists
flat terraces for serval tents
nice view down the valley
not too windy, at least today :D
evening sun

You just have to bring your water from the big camp down at the bridge if you’re going towards the pass. Next clean stream comes about 0.5h cycling towards the pass.
Hight 4064meters.
more or less visible from the road but there is no direct access due to a crash barrier.

name: Beach Camp
description:
Lovely flat place to pitch a tent with some sand.
This place might be less safe after/with strong rains!

There is a Tea tent 1.5km down the valley where you can get some food.
Fresh water source directly at the street where you jump off for the Beach-Camp!

name: Udaipur Taxi With Guide
description: Being an Udaipuer Taxi With Guide travel and tour operator, we offer a complete range of travel related services for your India holidays. All our staffs are well trained in the hospitality over the years and passionate about their work. They are always eager to meet your requirements 24X7, with impeccably planned trips which reflect our hands-on experience and in-depth researches.

name: Hindustan Motorcycles
description: excellent motorcycle shop, well stocked and friendly. There are many other mechanics on the street

name: Chader Restaurant
description:
Breackfasr, Lunch, Dinner
Here you‘ll get Tea, Egg-Toast, Parotha and maybe Rice and Dahl for lunch.

Fresh good water next to the building.

There would also be a flat space to camp close to the river just down side next to this restaurant, but it‘s quite visible…

name: Dhairya’s Villa
description: Beautiful villa in a quiet neighbourhood. Close to restaurants and various shops. Parking for cars and motorbikes. Very clean room equipped with hairdryer, TV, air conditioning and Wi-Fi. The price is a little high for standards, but it's worth it. Around €23

name: Airtel
description: Airtel Smartstore, can active SIM card on foreign ID. Bring 800 rupees and a lot of patience ;)

name: Alchi Monastery
description:
Beautiful and old monastery,
defenitly a visit worth!
Entry fee is 100Rupies

name: Luminaire Homestay
description: villa located in a very quiet and safe residential area. clean rooms and private parking. a double room for single use €8

name: Nature park
description: Very large parking space to stay overnight. We asked at the entrance to the natural park if we could spend the night in their parking lot, without problem. We visited their park for 40 rupees. Calm and trouble-free night. To get to this square you have to cross old Manali but no problem for our 6.5 meter long sprinter.

name: Near the temple
description: Very large parking lot with a magnificent view of the temple and the mountains.  We stopped to visit the temple and eat, but it's no problem to stay the night, 3700 meters above sea level.

name: Water at Gas Station
description: Could fill up our tanks with a big hose. Water is ground water and seems very clean. Staff very friendly.

name: Large quiet place
description: Really quiet place, not far from a town.  Very good Airtel internet network.  Several vehicles without problem but no shade.

name: Paralatse La South
description:
There is a beautiful hike through pure nature from Baralacha La Pass to this one here.

I drove half way up by bicycle and hiked the other half. It‘s about 4km, so maybe bit more than one hour hike one way. You‘ll have to cross two streams with clear, cold mountain water. 
Follow the stone figures and stay more or less in the middle of the valley to get to this beautiful Southern Pass and Viewpoint.

name: Laundry dry cleaner
description: Possibility of leaving your laundry here.  We dropped it off around noon and picked it up at 7 p.m.  The price is 50 rupees per kilo.  Decent service.

name: Gareeb Narwaz
description:
Best kebab in town 🍢🍢

We got this place recomended from locals and it did not disappoint.

He has chicken and mutton kebab

name: Wild horses Camp
description:
Lovely mountain lake with wild horses around.
I cycled up from Chushul (after lunch) and did the Pass the next day.
Be aware that: 
- you have to bring your own water (the lake is salty)
- it is on almost 5000meters hight, so be well aclimatizied or don‘t sleep here!!
-Chushul is also the last place to get wifi for a while depending on your route of course :-)

name: little shop
description: Little shop with snacks and peanut butter ❤️

name: Mahe market and restaurant
description: Very nice couple who speak English. Perfect to get info about the roads around

name: sumdo restaurant
description:
Restaurant
Little shop
Rooms available. 
The owner speaks English, nice spot

name: Wild Tso Kar valley
description:
Amazing camping spot with absolutely nothing around for kilometers
Very few vehicles. Asphalt road, you can get far of it easily
Very windy in the evening
No cellphone in the whole valley, my last connection was in Chushul

name: Bedrooms and shared rooms
description:
Bedrooms for 1500
Super basic shared room for 400
The owner doesn't speak English

name: A bicycle shop
description: A few bicycle shops around this area. Probably the best place in Indore if u need to fined some spare parts for your bike

name: A small flat spot
description: Here is a small spot for the few tents or even a car. Clean but I couldn’t find access to the river. Nobody comes at night and you can see the back of the Statue from here

name: Murawah Hotel
description: Clean biker friendly, good rooms, good standard

name: Padum
description: Korean Restaurant in Padum.  Small coffees shop up footpath opposite Ibex Hotel.  Run by very friendly Hira. Selling choices of tea real coffee cake and Korean food. Korean restaurant.

name: Laundry with price\kg
description: Laundry with modern machine and price / kg (79.-/kg + 18% tax). The guy even delivers your clean clothes to your location for free.

name: Place for tent near a small river
description: It’s a small place for one or few tents near be clean river. If you go South then turn right after the small bridge and get inside the forest like 50m., then turn left the there is flat spots with low grass. You can still hear cars on the road but it wasn’t too bad. River is good to take a bath and wash your stuff. Nobody came at night but kinda a lot of mosquitoes

name: Tusita Hotel & Restaurant
description:
A small family driven hotel on the way to Leh!
Wonderful scenery, very quiet very biker friendly place to stay.
Immaculate clean, nice local food.

name: Spot near the road
description: There are many spots for your tents between bushes and trees or for a car even if you won’t come deep into greens. I found completely out of trash area and it was hidden from others as well. You can still hear the road but not much. Internet connection wasn’t good (Jio)

name: Peaceful spot
description:
You leave the main road for a land path and you go on until you find an area to park on the side of the path. It's far enough from the road so that you don't hear it. It's down a nice small hill of rocks.
Only 3 motorbikes rode past us in the morning. The only nuisance were the peacocks singing a lot. Perfect for a night, a rare wild spot in India.

name: A place for tent on the farm land
description:
There is a small place for one or two tents. If you go South then turn left from the main road before the small plateau and keep going around from the left side. You’ll pass a small temple and since you get behind the plateau there is a flat spot. You can also keep going by the same path and get up, there is also a big flat area. No shade but on the way to the top between the path and the plateau there is a natural pool, small but really deep. Not sure if you can drink this water but perfect for the shower. 
Just one farmer passed by.

name: In front of the Don Bosco retreat
description:
Best night spot in Yercaud, as we spent hours looking for one.
It's easily reachable, big rig ok, quiet. Of course expect some curious people to come and visit out of nowhere, so it's better to arrive just before dark.
You can go and visit a view point at Don Bosco, close to the spot (20 Rps /pers). Also there is a trekking, but we found out about it too late to test it. 
A little word about Yercaud. We appreciated to find fresh air in the mountains, but that's it. It's a hill station, so there are many Indian tourists in the weekend. So expect a lot of noise, a lot of selfies and crowd everywhere. To find wild nature maybe you have to book a guided trek since we didn't find on our own.
if you know Ooty, it's quite the same spirit...

name: Skitsal Camp Sarchu
description:
Small cottages, and tents.
Very friendly owner, extra blankets if needed.
Very good homemade dinner and breakfast

name: Star India Workshop
description: Here the is a good workshop, friendly people that speak English. They help me to change the diesel filter and clean very well my diesel inox prefilter. They also provide me a new diesel filter as spare part.

name: Leh Shree Toyota Service
description: Official Toyota car service. They help me to clean my rear diesel tank, and to check the fuel filters

name: Lemon Dew Cafe
description: Lovely little garden cafe next to the beach, great lassi and very friendly owners

name: Santa Maria Hostel
description:
Excellent little hostel in the heart of Fort Kochi. Small aircon dorms and private rooms available. 
Parking for motorbikes and perhaps smaller overland vehicles, definitely not big rigs though.

name: Mandalchan Hotel
description:
Nice place to rest in Leh. Very friendly people, specially Zahoor that speaks English very well. Very clean place, good price included breakfast and if you want also dinner (very good). There is a big park for car and motorcycle. The hotel is close to the center and the market (5 minutes of walking)
Zahoor mobile number +91 8899069728

name: A.O. Guesthouse
description:
Nice place to rest in Sumoor. The owner likes flowers and the garden is very beautiful. The location is very clean and friendly.
Tsewang Jorgais +91 9469777716

name: Murthys Surf School
description: We stayed three weeks next to Murthys Surf School. We could use the shower and fill up our water tanks. Murthy is a local surf teacher, always with a big smile on his face. He and his family are super lovely. His wife cooks delicious food .

name: Santa Maria Hostel
description: Great little hostel right on the lake shore with small aircon dorms and private rooms. Very helpful staff who can arrange any excursions you need. Access by motorbike only or small cars due to height restrictions. A lovely place for a couple of days.

name: Near River
description: Little Place for two Overlander of the other side from the River. Not beautiful but good for a Night. It is difficult to find a space here. But other vehicles and large overlanders can also park on the bridge.

name: Rustic Paradise huts and Restaurant
description: This place is perfect for overlanding. Place has lot of secure parking, 24x7 running drinking water and Good boulders for bouldering.

name: Riversong Bliss
description:
Awesome new hostel right on the riverside! Cool bar/cafe area to chill and meet fellow travelers.
Dorms rooms with or without AC, private rooms also available. 
Good mobile service and quick WiFi at the property.
Parking is limited but there is a courtyard where motorbikes can be parked and there is safe space 100m up the road for larger vehicles.

name: Chamtse Guest House
description:
Nice simple guesthouse with a lovely family.
We paid 1000 rupees per person for a room with private bathroom, breakfast, and dinner. If you don’t want the meals it’s cheaper.

The family cooks for you and you eat together in their living room. Everybody is super welcoming and you feel at home. 

There is safe parking for multiple motorbikes. The house is a 15 minute walk from the busy walking street and very calm.

name: Honda moto service center
description:
Here is the service center for Honda moto. Helpful people, they speak English.
It's located in the basement of the Nissan Kashmir Showroom

name: Serenity Inn guest house
description: Small guest house, safe motorcycles parking for at least 6 motos. Not possible for car because narrow street. Nice and clean, open in 2023, good location. Nice family.

name: YOLO Backpackers Max
description:
Pretty Hostel, one of the few with good parking in Old Manali. Great view from the balcony and good bathroom with warm showers.
Great location in the middle of old manali.
In September we paid 800 rupees for a room.

There is a small restaurant available.

name: Wild camping by the river(only 4x4)
description: Good spot on the side of the road with lots of flat areas. Accessible only through the river crossing (depending on the water level though - we were in early September and it was possible to cross with high clearance 4x4). Few local people and kids starring for a bit then got bored and went away. You can have a dip in the water around. No shade only tiny trees around.

name: Near bridge (walk in only)
description: Near the river and a walking bridge. a large spot for parking vehicles and camp. On the kullu-manali road.

name: The paradise north camp - Camping, rented tents or rooms
description: It's a campground with tents already installed, and some rooms. We asked to camp in the garden, with our own tent because we wanted to save some money, it was possible for 300rupees. Place is nice with grass and nice view on the mountains, quiet. Possible to rent a nice tent, a room, or dinner or breakfast but we didn't try all that options.

name: Lake Tso House Pangong
description:
Around the lake you have hundreds of different cabins. This one is quite cheap (2800rupee for double room, dinner and breakfast included) and we were happy about the service for this price.
Simple 3mx3m room, with private bathroom, hot water in the morning for shower. All clean. Dinner and breakfast included and good. Nice view on the lake from the dining room. We parked our moto in front of our window. Electricity with generator in the evening and morning. Quiet.
Booking.com or WhatsApp number +917051981301

name: R-one garage
description:
Small multi brand work shop. 

We first went to vw dehli to get our vw crafter fixed, but our it stayed their for two days without getting any work done (they apparently were looking for a jack for two days). We then changed garage and came to this workshop.

The guys here were really nice and helpful. We got our car repaired which includes clutch and flywheel change.

They do all sorts of mechanical work, body work (paint and body repairs), car modifications and more.

Don’t hesitate to contact them if you have any issues.

name: The Flying Monk Cabins & Sauna
description:
Beautiful clean wooden cabins, backing on to an orchard with lovely views. Plus a very sweet, very friendly dog and very helpful owner with amazing English. 

Oh and it has a sauna too - great place to stay

Turn left off the main highway cross the bridge and follow the small road up past the open green space and you will see the Pepsi branding and it’s at the pink gate on the left.

WhatsApp on 94590 12982
Email - flyingmonkadventures@gmail.com

name: Concrete pad near fields
description: Ok for big rigs, friendly locals, down paved track through small villages just off main highway, concrete pad beside track, good spot

name: Jio Cellular Data
description: Jio and Airtel Cellular network avaliable in a small area at Patsio, after the Patsio army camp. One can access the internet in a small 100mts area. Jio 4G network is avaliable. Altitude is about 3800mts.

name: SkyView by Empyrean
description: New luxurious adventure resort & Ropeway, restaurants, activities beautiful setting & hiking. Camping with hotel permission is fine for self contained vehicles. It’s near Patnitop, Jammu and Kashmir.

name: ATM Chowk Farid
description:
ATM withdrawal for Visa and Mastercard. No fee. 
10k max but multiple withdrawals possible

name: Darcha Rasoi Food Point
description: Darcha Rasoi Food Point is run by a lady named Chhering Choden, a friendly lady with  yummy food making. Budget friendly and a place with a view, its ideal for travellers. Charging point and comfy seating avaliable. Clean washroom and exceptionally good masala herbal tea is avaliable. No alcohol and No smoking at her place.

name: New Chandigarh Holiday Home
description:
Nice hotel with secured parking for motorcycles (or one car). Rooms are big and clean, with AC.
Quiet place and friendly people.
1350 rupees via booking.com.
You can also order dinner and breakfast, cheap.
Far from the city center but perfect after a long day driving from Himachal Pradesh to South.

name: Stay Inn
description:
Very good hotel, clean, no smell, good AC
1150INR without AC
1450NR with AC

name: Trippy Turtle Hostel and Parking
description: The Trippy Turtle Hostel is a nice paid option to stay in Manali. We paid for two beds in the dormitory (350 each) and could use the bathroom and stay with our van on the big parking lot. Friendly open-minded people who work here.

name: Noodles
description:
Really nice Restaurant, we eat there 3 following days. No stomach or belly problem !
Price is ok
We tried very different meals but the best is chicken tikka masala with steamed rice.

name: Bike store (clothes,helmet,gps holder and more)
description:
Really good store for bikers.
You cans find all stuff for bikes. 
Helmets gloves,spare parts and more
Really good shop

name: Vista Resort - (Safe Place for motorbikes and cars)
description: Very nice hotel. We paid about 13 dollars for two people. Very clean. Includes air conditioning and a secure, covered parking space for bikes and cars with camera surveillance and hot showers.

name: Shri Ganesh Hotel
description:
Quiet place just outside the city, close to the lake.
It looks a bit old-fashioned but it's clean.
2000 rupees for a double room with AC.
Nice people.
Secured parking for motorcycles, street parking for cars.
There is a small restaurant inside.

name: The country Side Resort
description:
Nice hotel with safe parking.
Really nice, bit of luxury hotel with big garden, swimming pool, but still affordable. We found a good price on Agoda website around 1000rupee per night. Good place to relax, quiet, restaurant on site.
Good safe parking for any size of vehicle.
Walking distance to the sacred lake and touristic spots.

name: Himalayan Bike Bar
description:
Cycle shop selling few parts and having everything needed for mechanics.
Very friendly and very English. 
He helped me a lot for a very little fee. 
I can recommend.
On a first floor.

name: Moustache Manali
description:
Moustache hostel location in Manali. 
Dormitories and private rooms. Restaurant on the top floor. 
Very friendly and helpful staff. 
Very clean and well maintained. 
Great value for money in dormitory. 
Possibility to make a washing machine for little fee (200 rupies). 
Court in front where you can store a bicycle safely.

name: Smyle Inn
description:
Fine hotel in Delhi. 
Small, but clean rooms. 
Used to foreigners and respectful staff. No bad surprise. 
Fine for the price, and neighbourhood ok. 
Not easy to find an hotel in Delhi without being scammed. This one is fine. 
Breakfast included.

name: Joey’s hostel
description:
Nice and friendly hostel with a rooftop with view on the Taj. 
Dormitories and private rooms. 
Restaurant. 
Friendly staff organising some tours.

name: Unfinished housing development
description: Plenty of places in an unfinished housing district. Looks like they built the road network for a new district but no houses were ever built. Now the roads are partly overgrown so they provide perfect hiding spots. Night was quiet. Good 5G and 4G signal.

name: Adventurous park up by river
description:
4WD and ground clearance only. There is an ‘island’ in the middle of a shallow river with a large grass patch, plenty of trees and a nice river on the far side.

Park ups are hard to come by in this area so it’s not too bad.

At the corner of the road, there is a dirt track that leads down to the water.

Men are digging out the sand around here but all very friendly and leave you alone. At night no one is here.

We forded the shallow river to the island, but there are probably 6 or more spots on the closest side. The rafting companies use just up the river to collect the rafts. 

First time we got some peace and quiet in the area.
A couple of shops to grab essentials just back at the road, including dried fruit. 

Great for cyclists to pitch a tent at.

name: Zu-Zu hostel
description:
Nice hostel in Shimla. 
Very friendly staff. 
Clean. Nice common areas and view on the valley.

name: Triumph motorcycle repair shop
description:
Officially Triumph shop, knowing a lot about big motorcycles , they repair clutch regular service at 50k, new tires act.
Vikram is the manager
 +91 81309 48193

name: Nawal Sagar Palace Hotel
description:
Lake front hotel in a nice old house. The rooms are big and clean with AC. Secured parking for all types of vehicles. Friendly people.
Below the fortress and close to the city center.
We paid 1800 rupees for a double room with breakfast.

name: Next to park on dead end street
description: Next to a park on a dead end street. Walking distance to the biggest shopping mall with a huge grocery store. Trees to fit under. Good for big rigs. Quiet during the night. Few stray dogs. Looks like a good neighborhood.

name: N. Homestay
description: A friendly family is running this homestay in a quiet neighbourhood. 10 minutes from the Taj Mahal with tuk-tuk. Big rooms, we paid 1300 R / night for a double room. You can also have breakfast and they organize city tours if you need. Safe parking inside the garden for one of our 2 motorcycles, and the whole neighbourhood is secured so it's even safe in the street.

name: Down by River - quiet
description:
Look for a small track going down towards the river. Careful of any sharp stones but there are plenty of areas.
Far enough from the road to be quiet, but there is barely any traffic.
Good for an overnight stay.
No one came.

name: Overnight pit stop - quiet
description:
Not the best or cleanest, but good enough for a night. 
It’s part of the old road on the other side of the river. No one drives or walks past but there are broken bottles around. Good enough for an overnight stop

name: Sujan Singh Park
description: Here you get 20l bottles of water, 80 rupees per bottle. Car has to stay on the road, bottles are behind the first block

name: Moustache Rishikesh
description:
Luxurious hostel. 
Dorms and private room. 
Female dorm available. 
Very friendly staff
Swimming pool accessible even with dorm. 
Parking where you can park bicycles, motorbike and car. 
I think it’s not big enough for truck. 
Good value for money. Good wifi

name: Café 60’ - Beattles
description:
Very good veggie and veganburger ! 
For those in need of change from Indian food I can recommend this restaurant with a 60´ atmosphere and very good food ! 
International (burgers, pasta, pizza) and Indian food. 
Meal around 300-400 rupies. 
No parking. Nice outside

name: Checkpoint
description: It’s a final checkpoint leaving India. Passports and car registration checked. 15 mins to complete.

name: Mahi Communication Sim Card phone
description:
Great Phone Shop for Travelers!
This shop is ideal for purchasing SIM cards that work seamlessly in Ladakh and throughout India. The staff is incredibly helpful and experienced in assisting foreigners. They can set you up with a local SIM card quickly—just make sure to bring your passport for registration. Highly recommended for anyone needing reliable connectivity while exploring the region!

name: Grass and peace
description: A very nice place on a big grass place with beautiful landscape and big stones. Very calm. Easy to access. Be careful because there is bears and leopards around. Close at night.

name: Ramesh Filmcity
description:
"Welcome to Ramesh Film City, the Best Pre wedding Location in Jaipur, a modern photography and cinematography studio with multiple 'sets for shoots' that can fulfill all commercial photography requirements, music video, prewedding, and couple shoots.

Photographers can enjoy Time, Space & Privacy to create the perfect frame. They are situated on Amer Road near Hathi Gaon Jaipur. They have open-air and covered sets, that provide various backdrops and props to create your perfect shot.


Why Ramesh Filmcity?

Expertise in Pre-Wedding Photo and Videography.
Beautifully Crafted Cinematic Experience.
Dedicated Team to Capture Your Love Story.
All-in-One Photo and Video Location.
No Need to Travel to Multiple Places.
Changing and Makeup Room Facility.
45+ Sets of Locations in One Place.
Enchanting Backdrops for Unforgettable Memories.
Picture-Perfect Locations in the Heart of Jaipur
Gowns and Dresses Available on Rent.
Save Costs on Outfits
Pre-Book Professional Makeup Services for Picture-Perfect Looks
Flexible Booking Options:
Locations Available for 1 hour, 5 hours, and Full Day
Mobile Photography is also available

Don’t miss the chance to capture your unforgettable moments. Contact us now to check the available dates for your exclusive shoot.

Want to book your dream shoot? Feel free to call us at 📞9587535595 Let’s create magic together!

For More Info: https://rameshfilmcity.in/"

name: Next to Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Statue
description: Quiet and clean place at the roundabout, directly behind the IMAX cinema. Lots of space. Large vehicles no problem. Easy to get to. Buses wait there for their passengers. We can't say what it's like at the weekend, but it's a great parking spot during the week.

name: Camel cafe
description:
Camel Cafe Parking Facilities

Secure & Peaceful Parking for Carava Vans & Trucks

Located in front of Camel Research Centre, our Camel Cafe offers:

•⁠  ⁠Free Parking
•⁠  ⁠24/7 Security
•⁠  ⁠Scenic views of the camel farm

Important: Please note that parking within the camel farm campus is not allowed. Our cafe provides a convenient and authorized parking solution.

Additional Benefits:

•⁠  ⁠Assistance from Dr. Jitu Solanki, wildlife expert and owner's son
•⁠  ⁠Long-term parking options available
•⁠  ⁠Advance booking recommended

Book Your Space:

Call: 9414430948

name: Overlooking Wulhar Lake
description:
Little flat spot overlooking Wulhar Lake and Sopore. Quiet at night but locals come for the view in the afternoon and early evening, all friendly though!
Good 5G phone signal.

name: Bullet Point Bike Repairs
description: Royal Enfield specialist but will work on any bikes and knows how to get things done in Amritsar. Excellent service and friendly owner who isn’t happy until you are happy.

name: HDFC Bank ATM
description: Able to withdraw Indian Rupees using my Visa-branded ATM card from Bank of America.

name: Hotel Reyansh
description: Fairly spendy at about USD$18 for a double, but great shower, hot water, ceiling fan, wifi, and an underground parking garage for the motorcycles and cars/SUVs. Clean rooms. On the main road, so lots of traffic noise during the day.

name: Restaurant 'My Goodness'
description:
A nice place on a tiny parksite in front of restaurant "My Goodness", at the beach. Check with the owner if it is fine to park there. We could use the toilet and shower of the restaurant "Shaka Shack" next to the place. We got water also.
A narrow road to get there. With our MB 310 we could just make it.

name: Peling view
description: The place is in the parking lot of several houses.  There is an amazing view.  Adjacent to the parking lot is a homestay and you can eat here, and use their toilets.  Lovely and recommended to spend a night here!

name: Tourist complex
description:
On the right side of the road (when you come from Zojila pass) there is a sign for a Tourist Centre. 
The rooms are very nice and go for 500 rupees (I didn't even bargain). A true hot water shower and well designed interior. 
Beds are not the best but also not the worst I've had for this price. 
If you travel with bicycle, they let you park it inside the room!

name: Peling hot spring
description: The place is a parking lot of several houses near the bridge that leads to the hot springs.  Lovely place by the river.  There is a place to buy tea and more.  The locals were lovely and brought us vegetables for dinner.  We forgot to take a picture of the parking lot itself, but the place is highly recommended for an overnight stop.

name: Lulu Mall
description: Luxury shopping mall and a very big supermarket
